title: Good business hotel with smallish rooms
comment: First, the two real positives of this property are a) some great staff who cared about the guests; and b) remodeled guest rooms that were very comfortable.

title: worst bed
comment: Worst Belvoir I have ever been to

title: Noise
comment: The shower sound from the neighbouring room is too big.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a warm and beautiful atmosphere
title: This hotel has everything you need
comment: This hotel has something for everyone to enjoy.There are beautiful pools,a playground terrific food,bars and you can even walk to the Boardwalk. I will definitely be staying there again.

title: Good hotel conference
comment: Ihotel met all of expectations and even exceeded them in every department except the conference food. I was disappointed and would rate the food as below average.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's completely overpriced for the actual quality you receive!
title: This was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel!!
comment: This hotel was really dirty...the hot tub has dirt on the floor and on the bench...you can clearly tell it hasn't been cleaned in FOREVER! The pool was so cold you couldn't even get in and it was dirty too! This AFTER we waited over an hour for the maintenance guy to fix the door so we could actually get into the pool area. I had to call the front desk twice to get that done!! The bathtub in the room had stains that I could not remove after trying to clean it myself. For what we paid for this room for one night, they did not even offer a continental breakfast yet the rude front desk guy informed me I could purchase breakfast (for a ridiculous price per person) in the hotel restaurant. We were already paying above what was reasonable for that level of quality and to not offer breakfast is ridiculous!!! The room has two air vents in the ENTIRE room and the air goes on and off which is very frustrating...the room remained hot and never felt comfortable (yet the air was working properly) no matter how low we turn it down. The guy at the front desk was on a personal call when I walked up one time to ask a question and actually rolled his eyes and stated "what do you need?!" Ummm...this was the worst experience we have ever had a hotel and considering the cost of the whole thing I would NEVER stay here again!! We checked out other hotels in the area (due to having to return to the area in a couple months) and would stay at those over this hotel in a heartbeat!!! This hotels offer either continental breakfasts or breakfast buffets at their restaurants at a way lower price than this place, Take my advice....BOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

title: The staff was helpful and professional
comment: From the valet parking workers, bell man taking our luggage to room, lady at the check-in counter, folks in the restaurant until we checked out and got our car to leave the service was excellent...everyone was courteous and very professional! Seems like we've lost some respectful and professional service across the board but not at the Downtown Sheration-Nashville!

title: Don't get club level
comment: Ive stayed at this hotel a few times and staff is good, however the last two times there, I paid for club access and both times I could not access it. I mentioned to the lady at front desk and both times said they need to activate at checkin. Shouldn't you know that by looking at the computer screen.

title: Beautiful site
comment: The hotel/resort was beautiful. All of the staff were helpful and welcoming to all.

title: Wedding Location
comment: I was married on Smather's Beach and all of my family and guests stayed at Belvoir Suites. It met all of our needs and more - the perfect place for kids to enjoy the beach and the beautiful pool. Our pool side reception was amazing - beautiful venue and great food. No one wanted to go home after 4 days at Key West.

everyoneShouldKnow: If the compressor fails on the AC at the hotel, there isn't much you can do as a guest other than look for a new location
title: Not the best hotel
comment: The AC failed while I was there, so the room I was to have was moved to an upgraded suite. That was a plus! However, the furnishings were out of place for the room, and the two window-style AC units were so loud that during a phone call, someone asked if I was on the tarmac at the airport! This is an old property that they are trying to keep updated, but it wasn't working for me.

title: Hershey Vaction with the family
comment: Hospitality was excellent i recommend this hotel for anyone. Being a part of BPG preffered guest was excellent for Me and my families needs for a fun vaction. Club room was excellent. And I could not ask for anyhing more. Suite , Club room and all employees were friendly and made my stay excellent. Thank you Grandbourne and Belvoir.......

title: Great Vacation, great location
comment: Hotel exceeded our expectation. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. We can recommend the hotel and will come back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Every one was very helpful friendly and we loved the 1.5 hour hike and tour given.
title: we loved the pool area and the setting
comment: It was very relaxing and it made us feel very well kept, all of the staff was very caring and informative.

title: Family vacation
comment: The staff was top notch. They bent over backwards to make us feel valued. This hotel is very kid friendly with a great pool designed for them along with one for adults. The lounge was a time and money saver as well. Overall this was a great hotel with all the amenities you will need for a family vacation.

title: Praise for Anthony in the club lounge
comment: The club lounge ran like clockwork with Anthony there. He was amazing! The day he was off, it was a different place. We were there for six days, and missed him greatly the last night. He made sure everything was stocked and that we had plenty of time to order drinks. He was a tremendous asset to the Belvoir

title: perfect
comment: The Hotel has wonderful service, from the front desk, the bell boys, housekeeping and the parking chaps where all so polite and efficient.

title: Customer Service
comment: Your hotel did a great job in terms of making us feel special. The partial ocean room was great and the staff were pleasant, thanks for making our vacation a memorable one.

title: Limited beach access, crowded pools
comment: Very busy lobby area. Lack of on property dining. View from room (21st fl) was spectacular! Very clean and modern property. Plenty of elevators, no waiting. Resort charge is a joke. Basically you pay $25 (and tax on top of that) for unlimited phone service (who doesn't have their own cell phone) and a bottle of water. Pool is jam packed with kids, and the beach is too narrow. Great location for shopping and access to activities.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can't find a better one !
title: Overall, best hotel ever in the last 40 years
comment: The staff is superb from top to bottom. The facilities, cleanliness and room could not be better. We will always stay here !

title: Staying for a conference.
comment: Our room was not ready until 6 o'clock for BPG.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has it all in elite hotels.
title: Dolphin
comment: Best of the best in elite Disney Resort Hotels. Every luxury you look for in a top hotel is there. We will return for our 5th time.

title: August visit
comment: Should have realized that a hotel undergoing renovations may not be able to offer all amenities.

title: Wonderful staff, average room
comment: I arrived around 10pm to the Belvoir Ft. Worth after a 3 hr. Super Shuttle ride from the Love Airport. I was exhausted and just wanted to relax and go to sleep. My TV wouldn't turn on. Really? I called the front desk, and they quickly sent a maintenence man to switch TVs from another room. Then, overnight, the in-room air conditioner began making a "chirping" noise everytime in came on. Woke me up each time. Again, the staff was very friendly, but these problems were very annoying, and I changed rooms the next day.

everyoneShouldKnow: As tourists, we couldn't have been in a better hotel!
title: Comfy and Convenient
comment: The bed and linens were quite luxurious and the location, for a tourist, is superb. Restaurants nearby are good. The little deli right across the street has good food at reasonable prices. So glad that we stayed here

title: Quick stay
comment: We had a one night stay at this hotel. Unfortunately, we were disappointed when they did not have the room type we reserved available when we arrived. We were then given a Junior Suite but again were disappointed by its size -- extremely small. And, the bathroom did not have any counter space at all. It was very difficult to put on makeup with all your supplies resting on the lip of the sink.

title: Bar Service was lame
comment: We ordered 2 drinks in the hotel bar. The hostess added a $5.00 gratuity to the bill, then never brought us our change.

title: Great central location; fair accomodations
comment: Great location with lots of room downstairs. Great bar and lounge. Room was fair sized, but, constant drone of elevators and people in the hallway made sleeping difficult. Nothing wrong with this hotel, in fact its pretty nice, but might look for better options near by given the great selection of hotels within a few blocks.

title: Rennovation of common areas great
comment: The pool and bar and general common areas were great. Particularly enjoyed the slide they had. The staff were nice. Loved the gym.

title: Horrible service / uncaring staff
comment: Stayed here with my wife for one night on our way back from Grand Canyon/Sedona. Was expecting a restful night / pit stop but the overall experience was very unpleasant.

title: Novi Belvoir
comment: I had a very confortable room. It was clean, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was second to none.

title: Beautiful again!
comment: Everything was terrific, except the club lounge in the evening. From free to $5 a beer and $8 for wine? I personally saw the abuse of alchohol a month ago, now we all suffer because you had zero control? It makes zero sense to pay extra for club access. Poor decision by management. Other chains offer 2 free drinks, then pay. BReakfast was average.

everyoneShouldKnow: Traffic out side, also pets seem to be allowed here......stray away!
title: Trouble sleeping, Lots of road traffic in area
comment: This is a hotel that locals call the Safari. I guess this is a hotel that has been rebranded too many times. Road noise is impossible to get a solid night sleep. The pillows are too too soft. the bathroom configuration is weird.

title: Nice building, Lack of Hospitality
comment: The mumbling amongst the front desk staff when I checked in was the first indicator. Area near front door is cramped; Any interaction was like a retail store. Vending machines on two floors had water, but nothing else. Refrigerator and microwave are essentials for me.

title: Room Temperature
comment: In a August [YEAR-0] stay at the hotel the room temperature was too cold and couldn't be adjusted. We set the thermostat to 70 deg. The fan cycled between the loud high speed and low all night but the temperature didn't go up. The engineer came to service it and said that the default setting had been changed from 72 to 68 deg and at 68 the fan would remain on low speed and wouldn't cycle to high speed. He said all the room thermostats defaulted to 68 deg and there was no way to increase the room temperature. So there was no point in switching rooms during our six day stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service, ideal location and very clean
title: Both the staff and hotel accommodations were excellent
comment: We reserved 4 rooms for 13 people, all who were family members. My wife and I requested a suite so we could have a little more room to have everyone meet to converse and mingle. We were upgraded into the Presidential Suite much to our surprise with an oceanfront room. It by far exceeded anything we would have ever anticipated or expected. The staff were very polite and were able to meet or exceed any request we had. I would like to recognize two people in particular...Robert who helped immensely with loading and unloading our vehicles and finding us places to park. He also helped with suggestions of where to eat and what was going on in Virginia Beach in case we were interested in attending. The other was Tia at the front desk who resolved an issue with my vehicle in the parking lot. Both employees acted professionally yet treated us like they've known us for years. Both employees should be commended for their representation of Belvoir.

title: Great Location
comment: Great location in downtown Stamfrod, Ct. Convienent to transportation, dining, shopping and let us not forget work. Staff is freindly and always pleasant.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay in a room that has a connecting door to another room
title: Sub-par Grandbourne
comment: I travel often both for business & pleasure. I've stayed in several Grandbournes all over the world & this Belvoir was by far the worst of them all.

title: Mixed impressions
comment: The front desk, everyone near the front desk, and the restaurant were wonderful. The rooms were normal and beds lovely of course. We stayed four days and had to swipe towels from the hall cart to get new ones and our room wasnt always made up (also room service apparently dlesnt take dirty dishes away). The club lounge is pretty minimal in offerings and as I had a baby with me who needs milk, when I asked for milk they were distinctly rude. during interem hours at the lounge there is only water and espresso. (No milk for coffee available..) I learned to take the milk in the morning for the cereal and store it in the rented fridge.

everyoneShouldKnow: They are chronically understaffed and the staff has no leadership.
title: I'm back, but not happy about it.
comment: Well, kids, I had to come back to the area on business, and gotta say, again..not a great stay. The bedside lamp fixture (closest to entryway) is broken...why is it left like this? Anybody who walks in can immediately see this. I had to fix my toilet twice (what IS that contraption?)...I reported the toilet upon leaving, but this lamp issue should have been caught by the cleaning staff. Speaking of staff.....you seem to have one diligent pregnant woman waiting tables AND doing all the room service deliveries????

title: Shuttle Drivers Were Great, But There Was A Glitch
comment: This was a business trip for me and I needed to get to and from my meetings each day. The shuttle drivers were helpful, friendly and knowledgeable of the local public transportation options. BUT the front desk staff couldn't fix a glitch - on my last day I did NOT have access to the 6th floor Club Lounge (my card did not work to open the door). I was counting on that for breakfast before my meeting and couldn't wait around for them to investigate and send a replacement. That was frustrating.

title: tthis hotel was great
comment: Hotel was clean in good locationi

everyoneShouldKnow: Be sure to bring your AAA card! 20% discount is available at the counter service restaurants!
title: Dolphin is a winner
comment: Ideal location for a Disney vacation! The staff was very friendly and attentive, the room comfortable and the amenities extensive. We'll surely be visiting again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Convient and a great place to stay.
title: this hotel has great features
comment: The exercise facility was excellent and above the standard of most hotels. The food was very good; i will look forward to the opening of the new restraurant and bar.

everyoneShouldKnow: Average accommodations and food. Beautiful grounds.
title: Dirty sheets
comment: Disappointed that one of the beds in my room was dirty, the sheets had clearly not been changed from the prior guests! Hair, stains, other items made that clear.

title: Amazing hotel
comment: We really loved everything here, great value for money, nothing to compain about except this huge flying cockroach which sometimes hovered around the balcony. Get rid of them!

everyoneShouldKnow: Not on the beach, but very close to it.
title: Good for off the beach in Santa Monica
comment: The Delfina is a nice hotel! The staff was courteous and friendly, the room was fine, the lobby has a great bar, and it's located within just a few blocks of the beach. Also walking distance to Main Street, home of Urth Caffe and some fantastic shops and small restaurants/bars.

title: Musty smell all over
comment: Most common areas, and especially my room, smelled like a moldy wet basement. When I came in from outside it hit me every time. A renovation is seriously in order.

title: Great location
comment: Great place very accommodating and helpful

title: Always nice to come back to!
comment: We've stayed at the Belvoir Suites Columbus a number of times and we always look forward to coming back. The suite rooms are really a treat with two living spaces, each with a nice big flat screen TV.

everyoneShouldKnow: It needs improvement. $10.00 fee to self park is a crock.
title: Needs Improvement
comment: The lobby looks nice; the hallways and rooms are shabby and worn.

title: Exceptional Service
comment: Many thanks to the Belvoir staff for exceeding my customer service expectations. Everyone made a busy week "worry free" once I stepped foot into the Belvoir Lobby. My only comment would be that the rooms need a little updating. Drapery, furniture and beds were a little worn.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't pay extra for a view! You won't get what you expect.
title: Terrible city view room
comment: I paid extra for a city view room, but was placed on the 10th floor of a 25 story facility. My view consisted of the bases of the skyscrapers and 1 lone neon sign. Yes, I had a view of the city. But a crappy one at best. Complaining seemed to do no good either. Staff apologized then just looked at me. No offers to try to accomodate me at all. I'll never stay here again nor recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Clean & Comfy
comment: We took a quick 4 day get away to tour Washington DC. While I was told the nearest Metro was "around the corner", it was actually about a 7-10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel does offer a shuttle service to Ronald Reagan International Airport, where there is a Metro stop, however the shuttle runs on the 1/2 hour. The hotel and our room was clean. There are no safes in the room, the "safety deposit box" is at the main desk. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Bed was comfy, especially after a day of touring DC and being on our feet all day. Aside from construction at a nearby site, the hotel was very quiet. The room was very clean. Be aware that the shuttle runs on the hour after 8 pm and the last pickup from the airport is 11 pm. Overall, we would definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The ocean-facing room with a big balcony was really nice. Made me feel like I was on vacation, even though it was a business trip.
title: Where is the coffee?
comment: I know, it sounds petty, but I was here on a business trip, so gotta have my cup of joe! They told me the hotel was out of coffee packets for the rooms' coffee makers. So we'll bring you some. Never showed up. So I got dressed and went down to the Club Lounge. No coffee there either!! Weird...

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not on the Lauderdale water, but it is a
title: Great Place
comment: We had a great stay here. It was during the Isaac storm. The food was very good

title: President
comment: The location was good, the club floor was a big plus,

title: A stay to remember
comment: We had a little hassle trying to get checked in, but it was well worth it, it's a beautiful hotel. Very peaceful and quiet just exactly what we were looking for. I look forward to staying here again.

title: Above and Beyond
comment: Let me start by saying, both the resort and BPG are Awesome! They went beyond for my family to correct a reservation error. I truly can't put into words how much we enjoyed and enjoy this property , we stay here all the time. Pool area is great for kids with activities, the restaurant has great food, and the bar makes great drinks. But front desk is who I want to thank, Lisa went out of her way for our family. Thank You,

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location for walking to points of interest in Boston
title: Two days in Boston
comment: Spent two days sight seeing Boston. This was a great location for beginning our tours.

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally located to midtown and subway
title: some comments
comment: A large comforter is not necessary in the summer time.It just gets in the way.The little radio on the nightstand was unusable(poor reception).Bathroom was very clean and nice.Staff was helpful and did a good job.The room even had a fairly good view of 7th Ave.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a hotel which has great service and rooms !
title: A great location and facilities
comment: We had a fantastic stay. Checked in and were upgraded. Hotel had good club lounge and excellent location . Great link to shops and restaurants . Enjoyed swimming pool. Great pillows and bed.

title: POOR SERVICE
comment: Maid did not clean my room and requested for towels after never arrived. Did not even care about being a GOLD member. The front desk staffs are not friendly.When I check-out the only thing she said was "your balance is zero".

title: Staff was very helpful!
comment: I was leaving on vacation right after my business and had an extended vehicle. The staff was gracious to find a place for my vehicle while I was on business for the day.

title: Very Impressd
comment: The room was very clean and seemed to be recently remodeled.

title: This is a great hotel.
comment: This hotel and it's staff are amazing. The rooms are great the heated pool is fantastic and the breakfast buffet is wonderfull. I have never meet such great staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's the best place for a family vacation
title: Best Summer Ever
comment: The Dolphin is the best hotel I have ever been to in my entire life. The food was great the, staff was very nice, the pool was fun and hot tub was very relaxing. I have been to many of hotels and this one was the best so far. Also the resturants were amazing my favorite was the Fountain and Picabu. i hope I can come back very soon.

title: hate the fee
comment: I was surprised to find that a parking fee had been added. This additional cost will influence any future decisions about where we stay when visiting the Baltimore area.

everyoneShouldKnow: The way your staff responded to our every need.
title: Staff
comment: We were so pleased to be upgraded. We too value our Grandbournes recognition.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to highways and downtown Burlington
title: Conveniant location with a nice indoor pool
comment: Our daughter loved the pool while we loved the ease of getting into Burlington.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are very clean and the food is very good.
title: The hotel has great features
comment: My stay was so enjoyable I hated to leave. The room was so clean, pretty and comfortable. The staff was very helpful.

title: Wonderful stay
comment: This hotel has a great location walking distance to parks. Room small but comfortable. Enjoyed lounge, good staff and plenty of food and drink. Microwave would be helpful for own food.

title: Wonderful experience
comment: Hotel room was ok, outdated tube tv's, wireless Internet was spotty, but the staff was outstanding, felt like an extended family which will makeit my first choice to stay whenever I retuned to San Diego.

title: green movement
comment: When I selected a "green movement", room was not cleaned and no coupone was provided.

title: excellent
comment: Everyone was wonderful. The staff was very accommodating. The facilities were clean, comfortable, and spacious.

title: This hotel is everything you want in a hotel
comment: Thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. It had lots of eating shops & shopping. The pool Area was very busy but still nice. Close to all other shops & restaurants & bars. Would highly reccomend this hotel

everyoneShouldKnow: Look for parking discount on line if you do not want to pay $46 for one nite parking.
title: A little disappointed w room
comment: Staff and service was wonderful at hotel. I was disappointed with room on north tower. As a star wood preferred floor it was nothing to write home about. Tower is old. Our bathroom had peeling paint from ceiling and vent in bathroom was filthy. Never cleaned. Just not what I expect when I stay at Belvoir

title: Excellence all in one hotel
comment: Excellent rooms, amenities, service, and location.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is located near everything
title: Hotel staff was very friendly and in great location
comment: The only comment that I have is related to the bar. There was a golf convention when we were there on vacation and one bartender and you could not even get a drink at the bar. They should have had more assistance when there were so many golfers at this convention and at this hotel as it was crazy. It was not fair to the individuals on vacation.

title: Love the Belvoir Pasadena
comment: I will stay only here when in Pasadena. The staff treat everyone like they are royalty. I especially love Juan in the restaurant. He has the best customer service to rival any 5 star restaurant. The cleaning staff are efficient and very friendly. They go above and beyond for those staying there.

title: Great room and meeting spaces.
comment: The staff was fantastic during our conference. The meeting rooms were great and the hotel rooms were very nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: The cost of the car parking
title: Hotel
comment: Good stay! But room was some what small with no refrig. Or microwave.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff sets this hotel apart.
title: A great experience.
comment: We arrived at this hotel for the Repiblican National Convention and immediately were greeted by the best front desk staff we had ever met. Brooke took care of our needs professionally. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We enjoyed the meeting rooms and breakfast buffet, as well as the restaurant. Bus service and drivers to local venues were exceptional. The manager's personal attention was appreciated. We loved having a top-quality hotel for our stay in Tampa.

title: Great location
comment: Contemporary style of rooms is very pleasing. Central location to all major sites and highways. Very pleasant public areas.

title: Great to stay with kids
comment: We had our two children with us. Our son is 4 and our daughter is 1. The entire staff was so accomodating to our needs. Our request for a microwave and refrigerator was met without a problem. From the time you arrive and are met by Ray when you exit your vehicle till the time you leave, the Belvoir at the Inner Harbor staff is first class!!!!!

title: A big thanks!
comment: We have a child in Vanderbilt Hospital and we live 1.5 hours away. He was scheduled for an early procedure and we were not looking forward to the early rise and traffic it would take to get to the hospital. The hotel has an agreement with the hospital to accommodate, when possible, (with a hospitality rate) parents of children in the hospital. This is a wonderful gesture and made our stress level manageable knowing we did not have to make that early drive.

title: All Good
comment: Your location couldn't have been better next to the Marine base (Veteran). The room was very nice. Your just a short hop to the city (DC). Your staff bent over backwards to help us. Thank you.

guestFrom: Buenos Aires, Autonomous City of Buenos Aires, Argentina
title: Location
comment: Excelent location for a Mahanttan midtown hotel.

title: The staff was Amazing!
comment: From the moment I checked in the staff was so Amazing. I was staying on business and the staff made me feel relaxed and at home. I felt like I was top priority. The Valet parking staff as exceptional. They always greeted me with a smile and knew my name. Held the door for me as I got in and out of my car. Asked if I needed directions to anywhere.

title: Room for improvement
comment: I stayed at this hotel over 25 nights over a few months this year.

title: Getaway Weekend
comment: This was a nice stay and the staff is eager to accomodate all needs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Dallas. The pool and fitness facility is incredible!

title: Nice location but needs to be updated
comment: Our room was right by the laundry room, noisy all night. Plus on wed night their was a luau and that was noisy as well. We are Grandbourne preferred members and I would have expected a nicer room.

title: Very friendly staff
comment: The staff was helpful with everything from room service to making suggestions for running routes. The front desk staff always greeted me with a smile. The suite rooms are a plus when making an extended stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Club level services are world class.
title: Your Belvoir was first class -- again!
comment: Thank you again for the class, comfort, customer service and consummate courtesy!!

title: Condo was great!
comment: All aspects of my 6 night stay exceeded my expectations!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's great. The pool area, spa, and fitness area are excellent.
title: This is nice.
comment: The service was excellent. I'm willing to go back for another vacation in the future.

title: This hotel was a great disappointment to us
comment: We had stayed in this hotel in years past. However, this time was very disappointing. The hotel was dirty. We had to change our rooms twice since the ceilings in the bathrooms were seriously damaged from water leakage. Once we changed rooms, we were charged a higher rate and had to bring the overcharge to the staff's attention before it was corrected. The hallways were not vacuumed during our entire stay and were filthy. We were very disappointed and are now looking for an alternate place to stay during our visit to Philadelphia next month.

title: TV changes
comment: I had made the Belvoir Crystal City my primary selection when in town over the past couple of years. However the TV channel selection has been changed and it is now abysmal. Multiple MTV blah blah channels. No A&E and no Foxnews, no Fox Business. I understand that for some that is probably a positive. For me, a political junky, the change is reason enough I will stay elsewhere.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location and property is located on the Beach!
title: Romantic Getaway
comment: My significant other and I stayed at the Belvoir Hotel in Poipu Beach in August [YEAR-0]. We had a wonderful time and can't wait to go back.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel had a lot of construction going on which made for a very unpleasant stay, loud drill noises woke up up every morning. Also hotel charges large fees for incidentals on your credit card along with daily room rate
title: Loved hotel BUT!
comment: I love staying at the Belvoir but was really uspset that the hotel charged my credit card huge daily fees and then also charged my credit card for my over all stay. I have no problem with the overall charges just not happy with a company also charging my credit card a high 200 dollar per day rate on top of it all!

title: Poor Management
comment: I have stayed at this hotel many times and typically enjoy it very much. My most recent stay was a terrible exception. The hotel is under renovation and the staff clearly was not prepared to handle the problems renovations can bring. The day I was there, some sort of housekeeping problem prevented rooms from being ready at check in. The staff did not handle the situation well at all. I was repeatedly told my room would be ready in an hour and when I returned to the registration desk, I would stand in line for 20-30 minutes with other angry guests only to be told it would be another hour. I watched while one guest after another left the registration desk in frustration. What added to the frustration was the nonchalant attitude the staff seemed to have. They seemed completely unconcerned that guests could not get into their rooms even though check in time had long passed. I finally had to leave for a 7:00 dinner reservation and on the way to the restaurant I received a call indicating my rooms were ready. I had specifically reserved 2 rooms with 2 beds each and asked them to be sure to hold those as I had 5 people in my party, including adults who did not want to share a bed. By the time we returned from dinner they had given one of the rooms away and only had a king room available. After a conversation with the manager and several trips to various rooms (none of which had 2 beds), I finally gave up and took a king room. By this time it was 10:30 PM. The manager was apologetic, but clearly unequipped to address the situation. He offered no compensation, so I took it upon myself to suggest that he comp one of the rooms. He agreed to do so, but the fact that I had to ask after having arrived at the hotel at 2:30 and not getting into my room (and the wrong one at that) until 10:30 PM was ridiculous. Grandbourne typically provides a high level of customer service. This was not the case at all the Belvoir New Orleans. I would not recommend staying here until all the renovations are complete.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is easy to get to from I-81
title: Great Hotel in Roanoke
comment: My daughter and I had a very pleasant stay at the Belvoir Roanoke. The hotel was very easy to find off I-81 and offered free parking. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable and we had a restful nights sleep!

title: Overall Experience
comment: The hotel was easy to find, the check in was smooth, the staff was friendly. The lobby was spacious and comfortable. The room was clean and comfortable. The TV remote needed a change of batteries. The dining restaurant was well staffed and great service was provided, but at times the staff all disappeared. Instructions to get to walk to downtown was wrongly provided by the staff, but the map with dining suggestions was helpful. The swimming pool needs a scrubbing of the inside lining. This is a really wonderful hotel. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Missed expectations
comment: I stay here a lot (probably close to 100 nights over 2 years) and there is always something wrong every time I stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to UWM and the Hospital
title: This hotel needs to be updated
comment: Stayed on a first floor room and thought the room was quite dated. The bed was soft but okay, rugs needs to be replaced, decor was old and needs to be replaced. The shower curtain was not enough to keep the water from getting the bathroom floor all wet. The bathroom was as average as one can get. Overall, if you need a place to stay that is close to the hospital or UVM, then this is probably your best option, otherwise I would suggest staying at one of the bigger two names down on the lake.

title: Room selection
comment: Asked 4 months in advance for ocean view room which was not available when I checked in for my 7 night stay nor was I ever asked whether when a room was available would I consider changing.

title: Nice property
comment: I would definitely stay here again.

title: This hotel never lets me down!
comment: It's always a great exeperience

title: The locks on the room doors need to be changed out.
comment: The very first night in my room was fine. After that, I was getting a bit irritated. For the next 3 nights in a row, I was locked out of my room. The card keys would not work. Security was pretty good about coming up and opening the door for me, but I felt rather silly having to have them come up three different times. I did inform the front desk, Isiah and Jackie, so they are aware of what happened.

title: What Went Wrong
comment: Arrived at 12 midnight from flying all day. Shuttle service great! Check In Great! Door to room kept sticking...Green light came on but door would not open...After several tries all ok....Bed was Great! ...Next morning no coffee pot...spoke to staff...no coffee pot....went to take shower and pulled back curtain and discovered bath tub full of dirty water that had been sitting for some time...drained water before shower....went to shave/brush teeth and water very, very slow in draining...I love Grandbourne but this hotel needs some help. Desk on way out offered me some Grandbourne points which was nice...Not sure how many.

title: Great Place to Stay
comment: The staff, bell men, valet, front desk, and maids where all friendly and accomodating. They make you feel like you are special. Great job on the managments part. Hotel in great location. Rooms on the small side but it is New York and that is the norm. Thanks for the nice stay.

title: Clean, Fresh & Convenient
comment: This property was fantastic! Room was spotless and new. Close enough to Disneyland but just far enough from the bustle & traffic. Would most definitely recommend!

title: WOW great place to stay
comment: first time staying at this hotel - we were so impressed. great room, exceeded expectations

title: This hotel was convenient
comment: Hotel was close to the convention center and resturants, shopping and entertainment.

everyoneShouldKnow: I would tell guest not to walk to the metro especially at night and use the Regan Airport metro stop
title: family from Mass.
comment: The shuttle service to the metro needs improvement. We were left waiting 45 minutes @ Reagan airport for the shuttle back to the hotel. The driver forgot us and three times I was told 10 more minutes.

title: Disappointing
comment: Sold out weekend and hotel was very understaffed. Calls to front desk took 4-5 minutes to answer, front desk always had line. Ceiling in bathroom was rusty and peeling and badly needed painting. When we asked if we needed reservations for airport shuttle we were told no, only to find out we did and shuttle was fully booked. Hotel is convenient to Cowboy Stadium and shuttle service to nearby resturants was very good.

title: This hotel has terrific amenities.
comment: Whenever I come to Atlantic City I stay at the Belvoir Hotel even though i have many options. I feel I get terrific value, personalized and courteous service and I love the option of the club floor and all it offers as well as the state of the art fitness center. Its proximity to the shopping and casinos is also a plus.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't pay for self parking! Spend the extra money and valet they go above and beyond to accomidate. they even hooked up my GPS and made sure I knew where I was going top notch team
title: Eight Days and it felt like home
comment: My first impression on check in was not great The staff at the front desk was not overly friendly. The Valet staff was the best I have ever encountered. And I travel monthly. The bell staff was excellent as well as the bar staff and servers. The room was perfect for me as it had a walk out patio with an ocean view even though it was in the older building and needed a little upgrading in the shower area. Other than that it was great.

title: great hotel and staff
comment: very happy with your stay in Belvoir Suites Columbus, room was large and clean and comfortable.

title: 1st time visit
comment: Arrived really late and was taken care of by Mr. Manuel, who made my check in quick and simple.

everyoneShouldKnow: print off reservation, be prepared to wait if they can't find it.
title: Lost reservations
comment: Made reservation 5 weeks out. Showed up, was told they couldn't find it. Took 25 minutes and 2 trips to computer to show them I wasn't lying about reservation. Wife and I had to sleep in separate beds. Manager Cory finally appeared from behind the door to announce he was sorry. Used to stay here every trip I make to OKC. Not any more.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenience to the shopping and beach. Many diner options also.
title: Hotel Staff was great & Chef was very good
comment: We will stay hear again. The staff was wonderful and were always helpful.

title: Great proximity to Disneyland
comment: We had a great stay. The walk seems short in the morning and long in the afternoon.

title: Family Staycation
comment: WE had a great time staying at the PK overnight. We enjoyed the accomodations, buffet, pool and service.

title: Awesome Stay
comment: I had the best stay at this hotel. I upgraded to a suite with the Marina view. It was all spectacular. Amazing...Room was very nice. Bed was extremely comfortable. Awesome Stay. I'll be back for sure!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Breakfast in the restaurant was very pleasant because of the helpful staff.
title: Well updated but dirty
comment: Carpets were filthy, but everything else was up to standard. Me and my family all had black socks from the dirty room carpets.

title: Great value
comment: Great staff, very friendly and helpful. Rooms could use some updating, general mantaince ,more electrical outlets and better lighting. Had two meals in the Indigo pretty good. Our room faced the mountains that was great. Had drink at the bar great service.

title: This hootel is our preferred.
comment: We like its location, interior of the rooms and the Starbucks in the room.

title: Great customer service and amazing club lounge staff
comment: the friendliest and hardest working club lounge staff we have ever seen. Sandy was great and Joy was amazing.

title: Best thing about the Waikiki is the location
comment: we could walk to all restaurants that we wanted to. We used the gym daily but very frustrating to have the gym be on the 4th floor and no bathroom facilities...very unusual.

title: Great location. Great staff.
comment: I stayed here for 10 days while having to be at Stanford University Hospital every day for my son. The location is perfect to the hospital, the campus, and downtown. Room was just renovated, so it was nice and clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and view of DC
title: Excellent location and view of the DC
comment: Ecellent accommodations and service even with construction going on.

title: average
comment: average hotel, average hotel

everyoneShouldKnow: Club level service was not worth the extra money. At night, the food selection was minimal.
title: Excellent staff
comment: My family and I stayed at the Belvoir hotel in New Orleans following a hurricane. The staff was excellent. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. The staff worked to make our stay very comfortable.

title: Great Hotel, Nickel and Dime Charges
comment: Very comfortable hotel, with great staff and excellent service. But it is annoying that they charge for in room internet and make you come down to the lobby to get free internet, in this day and age. It's penny wise and pound foolish, since it makes for a lot of bad will (as opposed to good will).

everyoneShouldKnow: Terrible service nd rude service at check in
title: Horrible Experience
comment: We had stayed at the Read House before so we were shocked by the incredibly bad experience we had at the front desk. Heidi was rude, abrupt and ectremely unhelpful. We upgraded to have the Club-only to find out that it was closed Saturday and Sunday. I was given a card to the Club and fround that there was nothing there-not even a glass of water. The person at the front desk did not inform us of this and was extremely acted extremely put out when I asked about it. It was nothing less than false advertising. My wife and I were so upset by the treatment that we received that we left the hotel. We would never stay there again nor recommend it to our friends and associates.

title: Charming Castle
comment: The room was spacious and extremely clean, and the club lounge was very nice. In-room ethernet and wireless access provided great connectivity. The elevators were a bit clunky, but didn't detract from the quality of the stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's unbelievably close to Universal City, literally a 5 or 10 minute walk.
title: Better than I expected...
comment: I chose the hotel for the location, as I was working on the studio lot. The decor was lovely and much more "boutique" than I had expected. The staff was exceptional and genuinely friendly. I didn't have time to try the facilities, but the pool looks nice. Just as an aside, it is very family/tourist clientele, so if you're looking for sophisticated, or adult oriented, not your hotel. Walking distance to the Universal Theme Park and City Walk.

title: Room was not up to Belvoir standards
comment: Our room had a large red stain in the middle of the floor. there was also had a makeshift wooden box under one of the bed wheels to keep the bed from moving which stuck out enough to stub your toe as you walked by. The bed skirt had some stains and the TV reception was not great. The location and staff were good. Parking is not convenient. because you need to go through the convention center to get to the parking garage.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location with easy access to public transportation into City Center
title: Thank you Belvoir University City
comment: Hotel was as expected great. Several employees made a difference during our stay. Evan & Ruben were friendly throughout my stay. Theresa and Sanjay in the concierge lounge were always accommodating even when busy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location but out of date facility
title: Facilities grossly outdated
comment: This Belvoir does not meet the standard I have come to expect from Grandbourne hotels. The room in which I stayed was very outdated in terms of facilities - dirty AC with pieces falling off it was shrouded by skimpy wood paneling, the desk was sticky, bathroom felt 20 years behind in style compared with most Belvoirs. Also, as a business traveler, I was hamstrung when the internet went out for an entire evening during my stay. I will not be recommending or returning to this hotel.

title: Very Pleased
comment: It has been a while since we stayed at the Belvoir. I am very pleased that we went back. The young lady at the front desk was eager to assist us. While her name tag indicated she was in training, you certainly would not have known this. Kudos to the staff that trained her. In terms of the room, it was ready prior to check in which we appreciated. The bed was comfortable and the shower had plenty of hot water, two features that can often make or break our stay. The location while not where we usually stay was a good choice. The Top of the Hub with its spectacular view and reasonably priced wine and appetizers was a big hit.. If you are staying at the Belvoir I would recommned it as a must see.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its high level of service when staff interacts with guests.
title: Staff
comment: The doormen were very patient and helpful, particularly a young man named Josh whose last name I do not know. He is from Birmingham. He was very helpful when I was tired and cross and not finding how to get into the parking garage.

everyoneShouldKnow: They attend to everyones need and available for assistance at all times. very courteous and polite staff.
title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE
comment: The hotel room was very clean, csr service was amazing and very helpful with all needs, the restaurant food was great and overall the place to be in Columbia at any given time. Highly recommended.

everyoneShouldKnow: luch was great!! dinner was terrible,food choice and quality are sub par and do not coiusncide with the quality of the hotel.service was terrible and you are better off leaving the property.22.00 for cold chicken and 4.00 for soda is outragio
title: very nice hotel
comment: clean and comfortable rooms are well appointed

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfortable Beds and Schula's is a great choice in restaurants.
title: This hotel has great beds!
comment: Wonderful beds, friendly staff, and a great restaurant (Schula's).

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to convention center and Old El San Juan
title: The hotel is a good meeting hotel in a tropical destination
comment: The hotel is conveniently located to downtown San Juan and old town as well as the convention center.

title: GREAT STAY
comment: FROM THE ARRIVAL; ALL SMILES AND GREAT SERVICE. ROOM BEAUTIFUL, CLEAN AND AMMENITIES.

title: Great hotel located in Times Square
comment: I read some of the reviews before checking into the hotel which concerned me. However, my trip to NYC was great! The hotel lobby was simply georgeous. The entire staff was great and attended to all my needs and requests. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. To my surprise the room was larger than I had expected, very spacious.

title: Final stay at this hotel
comment: I travel to Seattle often and stayed at the Belvoir Bellevue to be close to my team this trip. I returned to my room after my first day of meetings around 6 to find that the room had not been touched. I know there is a program to receive more points if your room is not cleaned but I did not put out the card to participate. I called the front desk (dialing 0 as the quick call buttons on the phones in the room do not work). The response I received was "your room was missed, that happens sometimes". Neither apology nor even any apparent concern that this would be a problem. I told the agent that this was not the level of service I expected and suggested it may be time for me to stay somewhere else. The response was I'm sorry to hear that. I would have expected at least some effort to keep a customer and resolve an issue. The agent finally did offer to send someone up to the room and that did happen quickly and the room was cleaned. I don't mind having issues when I travel but I do expect the hotel to have some accountability and concern over missed service and make some attempt to keep my business. If the housekeeping staff at the hotel does regularly miss rooms and the management does not think this is a problem then they will be losing more business than just mine. I have a lot of hotel options in the Bellevue area and for my next trip I will staying at a different hotel.

title: Great Hotel for conferences at BJCC
comment: Very convenient when attending conferences in the Birmingham Jefferson Conference Center.

title: Great location and staff
comment: This was the second time that I stayed. It is very continent from airport. I got a room on 12th floor,which was really nice. I had a little time in the morning, but I was able to enjoy breakfast. On the other hnd, my husband woke up little later and there were not breakfast left, which was disappointing for him. Due to labor day weekend, there were more guests, I believe. Overall, I really like the atmosphere and had relaxing time.

title: This hotel is an excellent conference facility.
comment: The rooms were attractive and comfortable. The staff was very responsive. The food was interesting and excellent. The price was reasonable for a resort location.

title: Great Location
comment: We had a great stay before the Labor Day. The location is on the ocean front and the self parking is very close. Two issues for improvement opportunities: 1) at 10th floor, the water (cold) at the sink needs more pressure. It takes a while to collect one cup of cold water in the bathroom sink. 2) they promise you 500 starpoints if you forego the room services each night. However, I reminded the staff twice and both time they told me it is done! Unfortunately, it was not done and points still hasn't shown up in my BPG account.

guestFrom: 610 W 42nd St, APT N43F, New York, NY 10036
title: good
comment: good place good place good place good place

title: Great service, exceptionally clean
comment: Very courteous staff, they even kept us separate from a large soccer group that was staying in the hotel to minimize noise. And the beds are just so great for my back.

title: Great Business Hotel
comment: Why this hotel is a catagory 2 I have no idea. One of the best Belvoir's I have stayed in, with out a doubt.

title: Super service
comment: Came for Baltimore Grand Prix; I asked at check-in whether we had a good view of track from room, super nice woman clerk double checked and concluded that we needed a better room so she changed us to a corner room with stunning view. Awesome.

title: short walk/drive to beach
comment: This hotel is not located on the strip but you can still see the ocean from room and it is centrally located and close to everything. I would stay here again for sure.

everyoneShouldKnow: good location to Palo Alto and Stanford U.
title: This hotel has good features
comment: Overall features good. Wifi should be free not

everyoneShouldKnow: Not anywhere close to what you'd expect from a Belvoir
title: Extremely disappointed
comment: I've stayed at the SLC Belvoir in the past and the ammenities offered to gold club members have changed. When I asked for an upgrade and access to the gold room I was told it wasn't available to me. No explanation. Bathroom had mold in shower and old toothpaste on sink area. No linens for the hide-a-bed. View was a brick wall. The overall experience was far below Belvoir standards.

title: Great Hotel, Especially when you are planning on going to Hershey Park
comment: This is the second time that I have stayed at this property the night before I went to Hershey Park with my children. I found this property to be perfect for what we needed. The location to Hershey park is perfect. The indoor/outdoor pool was a hit. The only problem I found was the negative attitude I received from Dan at the Front.

everyoneShouldKnow: service from hotel desk staff is excellant
title: Staff was excellant
comment: The staff was very helpful and eager to help. Kelli and Joey were very nice

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very large with lots of walking required to get from parking deck to hotel lobby and rooms. Plus: Skyways to BJCC.
title: Perks
comment: Even small hotels/motels provide refrigerators and microwaves in the room - I had to bring a cooler in order to have some special foods. The price of the room does not call for an extra payment for a fridge - and no microwave.

title: AC broke multiple times
comment: Stayed in Governor's Suite.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best place to stay in Portsmouth, but the hotel does charge a parking fee.
title: Portsmouth -excellent
comment: Great place, the staff was wonderful, especially Erin, the restuarant hostess. What would have made the place perfect would be spa facilities on the premises as many Grandbourne hotels have. Appointments can be arranged and an affiliated spa sends people, but nothing beats having it on-site for last minute needs. Also it charges for daily parking. But still no place in Portsmouth is better.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The staff at the Belvoir Universal went the "extra step" at every opportunity. They made me feel like a cherished friend. The food was excellent and the room was comfortable, clean and well appointed. To me the only negative is in this day and age of free WIFI in so many locations there should be no logical reason charging to use the internet in the rooms.

title: This hotel could be spectacular with a little more maintenance
comment: Paint was chipping off of my bathroom ceiling. The hotel is nice on the inside but looks very tired on the outside.

title: Great Staff
comment: I usually stay at a Belvoir when I travel & I have never been so pleased with customer service. The woman at the front desk was helpful & delightful, the bartender at the hotel restaurant/bar was very nice & friendly, & the valet guys were wonderful. Very impressed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Extremely friendly (guests and pets) with a high level of service
title: Above and Beyond
comment: At first I was worried about the location being so far from downtown. What I found was: Great friendly staff. Regularly scheduled trips to and from downtown Charleston. Great pool. Being Gold, I had access to the club level. This is one of the few Belvoir locations I have found to continue club services on the weekend. That was great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to explore Charleston

title: Good Value
comment: I choose to stay at this hotel during monthly biz trips to SD. For the price, it's hard to beat. Yes, most of the rooms are in need of updating/renovating, often times they are understaffed after 8pm, and the elevators are on the slower side. However, I've stayed at other hotels in the SD area and no other place will get you the amenities and comfort at this price. BTW, the Belvoir Heavenly Sleeper beds are the best!!! I'd put them up against your 4 and 5 star hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't go there! It is new and looks great but the service is highly questionable. Two pools...didn't use either one.
title: Augusta GA hotel
comment: The front desk staff were very nice BUT the next day could not get the room cleaned. Maid brought towels only and left a pile of dirty ones in bathroom, no bed made or trash emptied. Nothing to drink in lobby area what??? Charged $10 for a refrig in room....no other hotel does this. Food prices out of sight and didn't eat a thing there....dining room/ breakfast area ALWAYS empty of people. Weird furniture in room...too much of it. Had to crawl over desk and stand to find an electric plug...Poor lighting in BR for a woman trying to put on makeup. One of the worse experiences in hotels I have ever had.

title: Facilities improvements
comment: TV would not work. Called engineering and it was repaired.

title: Devil is in the details
comment: Check in was easy and the front desk was well staffed! As BPG platinum we were upgraded to the club floor. The club lounge was easily the nicest Belvoir club lounge I have visited! Evening hors d'oeuvres were above average and included well stocked charcuterie plate, two cheese platters with a wide variety of cheeses, nuts, and fruit, and then two hot options. This was above par for Belvoir club lounges and I was very impressed with both the offerings and the actual lounge itself.

title: Great
comment: Room was three times as large as expected. Too bad I arrived late and left before dawn to enjoy the hotel better

everyoneShouldKnow: A good location for visiting San Diego.
title: Felt like I am on a secluded island!
comment: We had a room over looking the marina. Sitting on the balcony after a day of meeting is wonderfully relaxing with the view. The staff is exceptional in customer service. Location is excellent whether you choose to hang around the hotel or go see places.

everyoneShouldKnow: Skywalk to the Birmingham Civic Center
title: Upbeat hotel
comment: This hotel is very upbeat with a stylish atmosphere, gift shop, coffee shop, and comfortable rooms. However, the Atrium restaurant has very slow service. I would recommend it if you are staying in downtown Birmingham.

title: Very Nice Hotel
comment: Nice and comfortable, close to Universal Studios with shuttles to take you there. We really enjoyed our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very friendly and tried to be helpful.
title: Club Lounge
comment: I just want to commend Pat on the Club Floor for making us feel extremely welcome during our recent stay 8/26-30.

title: Club Lounge Closed
comment: To be told the club lounge is closed because it is a holiday weekend is unacceptable. The hotel is open, the lounge, for which we paid, should be open.

everyoneShouldKnow: very clean rooms, location to Sesame Place is great. Lots of places to shop and eat within walking distance.
title: nice hotel, great location
comment: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nites and was more than satisfied. Staff was excellent (kids loved their rubber duckies they received at checkin) . Room was very clean. Shuttle to Sesame Place was very convenient (drivers were very good and helpful with my daughter's wheelchair).

everyoneShouldKnow: has a walking bridge to access shopping mall. Has adjoining parking garage.
title: a great stay in Baltimore
comment: Hotel stay was excellent. Room was clean and comfortable. Location to campus was convenient. We will return to visit our college student.

title: Lots of activites
comment: This hotel has a water slide, volleyball, basket ball, and tennis. It is a fun place for a family get-a-way. It has a nice big pool and a very friendly staff too. The water slide was not opened very much and the pool was a little too warm, but otherwise great.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a long walk to everything, including trom the parking lot to the hotel.
title: The accomodations are too spread out
comment: I attended the recent AZSHRM conference. My first impression about the facilities was the great distances from the parking lots to either the rooms or the conference hall.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service and staff are wonderful and always willing to go above and beyond to make certain that your stay is pleasurable.
title: Service
comment: I am truly impressed by all of the incredible improvements that have taken place at this hotel since my last stay in [YEAR-7]. The staff, the service, the guest rooms and overall makeup of this property is fabulous. This is truly the work of outstanding leadership by the General Manager and all others in key management staff. I love this hotel and look forward to all of our future meetings at this property!

title: Everything You Need for Business Travel
comment: They take extra care to keep the rooms clean and not the Florida dampness that can creep into hotel rooms. The bar / grill has terrific food; no need to go out if you don't want. And I don't say that about many hotel restaurants; this one is creative, fairly priced and a fun atmosphere. They used to house a Shula's here and many of the restaurant staff remember those recipes! Craft beers also. Terrific location nearly right on top of St. John Towne Center for nearly everything you can think of for food and reasonable shopping too. Very close to Univ. North Florida. Easy to get to any part of Jax or St. Augustine from here.

title: Friendly, Clean, will visit again
comment: The hotel in Novi Michigan was very clean, friendly, and beautiful.The staff was very professional during check in and check out, they should be commended on how well they represent the company! I will recommend it to all my family and friends!

title: Comfortable hotel, great location
comment: The hotel was nice and had nice, helpful staff. The suite was well-designed and comfortable. The hotel is well located near the airport, with frequent, free shuttles to the airport. Easy meeting center, and good food at the meeting meals.

title: Not great
comment: Not a great business hotel. Constant screaming kids in the hallway not appreciated. My Payroll Dept. is also going to be pissed at how you nickle and dimed me every single step of the way!! Staff also misquoted daily parking fees to me -- that was a huge surprise (in not a good way)

title: Excellent Stay
comment: The Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Sheldon, the bartender and Eugene your security officer were my most memorable staff members at your property.

title: Outdated hotel.
comment: Old fashioned layout. Old fashioned colours. No kettle even for boiling water. No utensils not even a bottle opener.

title: Hotel has a great view
comment: Regardless of the mix up in communication, I really enjoyed the stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Easy access to hwy and downtown burlington.
title: Staff was Great!!
comment: Hotel nicer than expected. Staff was courteous and friendly. Ate at restaurant. Service was good but food could be better. Husband ordered mac & cheese it lacked flavor. Cheese in onion soup was hard and flavor was odd. .

title: ltroche
comment: The only regret i had was Friday night the pool area/hot tub was closed for s pin up party.

title: VeryDisappointing
comment: I've stayed at this hotel several times and was very surprised to discover upon check in that wifi wasn't working for apple products. I called the front desk and they said yes, it was a problem and had been and they had been working on it. It's unacceptable to have a known situation go on for this long - I was there for 3 nights - this should have been fixed in less than a day and it was obvious that the issue had been going on previous to my arrival. Having to sit in the lobby in order to get the wifi to work is ridiculous - I expect more from a Grandbourne hotel.

title: A wonderful place to stay
comment: we love the hotel and staff we love to stay there and appreciate everyone there

title: good location
comment: The staff is great.

title: Disappointed...
comment: I am writing due to my disappointment with the cleanliness of the room and the poor service we recieved. Primarily, the cleanliness of the bathroom was very bothersome. The tub/shower was very old and had areas of mold and mildew. It also took about 10 minutes of running the hot water for it to even become warm. The bathroom had a commerical toilet which was extremely loud and seemed out of place for this hotel.

title: Location & Grounds Great
comment: Spent 4 out of 11 nights at this Hotel. Great access to pool or ocean and close to many activities. We did the last three nights and wound done after many activities earlier.

title: NIce on the Outside
comment: Well, as a Grandbournes member I would have to say I was greatly disappointed. The elevators seemed never to be vacumed. We had food that they would not remove unless we put it by the door. Then it would stay there all day. A pipe busted and flooded the bathroom. There was blood on the shower curtain that was not changed until we said something. This was blood you could see instantly from the doorway of the bathroom. The mirrors were never cleaned until we complained about all the hand prints. One shift manager just took care of things like a professional. The other kept making excuses and seems not to know how to handle things.

title: Awesome hotel
comment: Friendly staff, very clean room. You'll have the small town hospitality in the big city.

title: Lack of professionalism
comment: Never again! Staff was rude and gave misinformation several times. Prices had hidden fees and no one staff gave correct pricing on valet parking, rates and Check in info.

title: Good way to stay in Anchorage
comment: Great location; as BPG Gold received upgrade to Club Floor (thanks!) ... room was spacious and comfortable. Bathroom small but functional (door doesn't open fully due to bowed shower curtain rod .. strange) and hot water took awhile to get there. Club lounge was nice, but would have been nicer to have it open 24 hours. Location is super .. everything downtown (mall, good restaurants (Cafe Paris .. best steak in Alaska!) within walking distance).

everyoneShouldKnow: Very central location and free local shuttle is great.
title: Good quality property
comment: This is one of the nicer Belvoir's that I have stayed at. The free local shuttle service was extremely helpful and convenient. The rooms are very modern, well-equipped and beds are great! Excellent value for money, I would definitely stay here again!

title: Confusing internal process
comment: I received a UPS package during the stay. I can understand the charge of packet processing fees, but I an confused by the message hotel gave me. My bill list at the time of checkout (2-3 days later) doesn't have the packet processing item, but it is charged couple days later which is really inconvenient to me to claim the cost etc..

guestFrom: ph?, Quang Trung, Bim Son, Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam
title: OK
comment: Overall my stay at the Belvoir was ok. I really like the beds in the room. Very comfortable. The bathroom was decent except for the leaky faucet. I'm undecided about the restaurant. The tortillas were hard, but the breakfast yoplait was good. Overall the service was very good, but I think Belvoir could improve the quality of the food in the restaurant. Staff was very accomodating.

title: Convenient location and pleasant staff
comment: We had stayed at this hotel in May, [YEAR-0] and were lucky to be upgraded to the Club Level. Not this time, because the hotel was completely full. The stay was very good, with a large, comfortable room and a bed to die for. So so comfortable. But we had 2 issues: one had to do with the cleanliness of the room. There was a pill under the desk and a hair in the bathtub. The other issue was that when we returned late at night, the parking lot was completely full except for the spots all the way in the back. We had accessed our room through the conference center earlier, but those doors were locked. We did not see any other entrances and had to walk all the way around to the front lobby. We later found out there were side entrances near the front, but we could not see them. The staff did add BPG points to our account because of the cleanliness issue, which we were satisfied with. We will stay there again, without question.

title: Do not recommend
comment: At 8pm my room was not ready (check-in was at 3pm). I did not receive any assistance from the hotel staff, so I had to contact a Belvoir manager who was not even at the hotel to receive assistance and he had to contact the service manager on my behalf. I finally had a room at 9pm. The shower was gross and the drain was slow, leaving you to stand in a pool of water when showering. Nothing spectacular about the room. It was very warm and stuffy. The air conditioner was not working well. Although it's a smoke free hotel, as soon as you walk out the door, there were consistently a line of smokers within one foot of stepping outside. So you had to walk through a cloud of smoke to get out the door and stand in it while waiting for the valet to retrieve your car.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and service is excellent
title: Excellent stay
comment: I'm a repeat guest at the Belvoir in Framingham and prefer the Club Floor. Service and accommodations are always superb!

title: Comfort and location
comment: Outstanding beds and service. The location on the Pedestrian Mall couldn't be better. Dinining and weekend entertainment within feet of the front door.

everyoneShouldKnow: Magnificent Crown Ball Room for any Wedding, excellent wedding staff, Melissa and Joan, Wedding Planners at the Belvoir Atlantic City, NJ Hotel
title: This hotel has great weddings
comment: We had our daughters wedding at your hotel and the staff was excellent. Over 100 people stayed at the hotel that night and the rooms were clean, comfortable and pleasant, I would recommend your hotel in Atlantic City NJ to everyone.

title: Superb staff
comment: Staff was very friendly. Michelle in the executive lounge was hospitable and made considerate nightlife suggestions when I asked. Brian at the front desk quickly accomodated my suite-night request and assigned me to a room overlooking the ROM -- a very personalized and special nod to my art & architecture trip.

title: Restaurant
comment: The Buffet area needs more light. the bathroom light in the guest room bathroom is too dark for showering.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location on Disney property is great.
title: Business siminar stay at Dolphin
comment: Was disappointed for the $15 parking and $10 a day fee for water, internet and gym facility. I did not use the internet or gym and paid $5 dollars per bottle water.

everyoneShouldKnow: 4 mins to Epcot/7 mins to Hollywood Studios. Heavenly beds large rooms. Great pool.
title: GREAT LOCATION LARGE ROOMS
comment: Great hotel facilities and room size. Breakfast very good at Fresh and staff were excellant. Shop and laundry downstairs very useful. Pool great. Transport by boat to Epcot and Hollywood studios very quick and being close to Boardwalk good. Downside Resort Fee for 2 small bottles of water wifi and closed health club $14.75 we refused to pay it and were refunded. Petty no Magical Express especially for UK guest who have spent nearly 1,000 on park tickests and over 1,100 on hotel shocking had to get taxi !!!!

title: Great Stay
comment: Our room was clean and the beds were comfortale! We had supper one night at the restaurant, the food and the service were excellent. We would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to Disneyland and Convention Center
title: Stay here on a regular basis
comment: Consistent high quality hotels, pleasant and clean common areas and rooms, attentive staff, conceirge level beyond expectations,

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not a stellar Belvoir property.
title: The hotel needs improvement
comment: I was very surprised and disappointed by this property. My room did not have a pen and pad of paper (which I needed), the closet door was broke, there was no room service menu in the room, the room was poorly cleaned (hair on the commode and in the shower, water stains on the faucets), and the maid knocked on my door in the morning and woke me up even though I had a DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door.

title: I'd like to take a shower please....
comment: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times. The location is perfect. On a previous stay in April I had some really loud, partying neighbors until the lady in the room on the other side told them to quiet down at around 3:30 a.m.

title: An overall unsatisfactory experience
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Atlantic City Convention Center Hotel and overall, I was not impressed.

title: Needs a lot of improvement
comment: The rooms and facilities need updation.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Had a great stay. Nice room.

title: My Stay for a few days
comment: The hotel was beautiful, food servers were top rate, ate in every spot, outstanding. The housecleaning could of been better, toilets ran slow, spots of mold on shower curtain..our view was nothing, with empty rooms we could of had something to look at instead of a rooftop. I would stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Knowing our family & friends will enjoy their time at The Belvoir because it's just like home.
title: Just like home
comment: We are locals and love staying at the Belvoir King Suites. The rooms are so clean & have all amendities of home & more. The rooms are solid so we don't hear other guests. The front desk, acctg, & dining/bar staffs are very approachable & professional. Even ALL the guests we meet each visit are friendly. That's important.

title: Unhappy Guest
comment: I booked a room at this hotel about a week to a week and a half in advance. Apparently, I was no better off. As soon as I got there to check in, the front desk clerk told me that since they were so booked up, they had to put us in a tiny room (pinching her fingers with about an inch of space between); stating there was that little space between the bed and tv (and bed and wall). She offered us free breakfast to make up for this. Now had she just welcomed us and made it sound like they were giving us free breakfast without mentioning the room was tiny in comparison to others, we never would have known! Then the air unit was showing 60 degrees; well it was more like 76. It was humid and the floor felt damp. We called and they sent an "engineer" to fix the unit. He told us to wait 30 minutes. It was just as bad off as when we got there. They offered us free Starbucks, however that does not make up for paying for an expensive room to sweat all night and barely move past the tv and bed to get to the bathroom. After entirely too much back and forth on the phone, they offered to move us. So they did have a regular room available?! It took them a good hour to move us. Will not stay here again! Book elsewhere! Somewhere with updated units! They need customer service training as well.

guestFrom: Van Nuys, Los Angeles, CA, USA
everyoneShouldKnow: A hotel that fits well with the Disneyland experience.
title: Outstanding Service
comment: I came to Anaheim with my wife and two daughters for the Disney Half Marathon. The weekend also happened to be our 19th wedding anniversary. The staff at the front desk really took care of us. Charming yet professional, Len made sure our stay was memorable. German our server at the Garden Bistro also took extra good care of us.

everyoneShouldKnow: the suite I stayed in was laid out perfectly
title: Services are lacking
comment: completely surprised that guests of an establishment of this caliber are made to pay for computer and internet..especially considering the high rate of nightly stay. Also no shuttle service, again truly disappointing. The fact that there was no pool, was yet another disappointment.

title: Excellent Dog Friendly Atmosphere
comment: Beautiful neighborhood, beautiful room with a view, and a dog friendly staff that went above and beyond to fully accomodate our every need. A genuine safe and friendly atmosphere.

title: Being Picky
comment: Overall a nice hotel, comfortable, clean and friendly. As a person who does inspections for a living though, I couldn't help seeing several minor maintenance items needing attention - in my room, in the conference areas, in the ballrooms. Also, felt the shower was too dark having no direct light in the space, only that above the sink. Thank you!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff will go the extra mile to assure you have a positive experience.
title: My stay at Belvoir Birmingham
comment: The staff were great...always a smile and greeting and they were patient as well as competent. They provided directions (I overheard this) to visitors from out of town and repeated directions often. The room I had was clean with enough towels and stuff. I was near the ice machine and elevators but the sound proofing was excellent so I slept peacefully.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice hotel amid vast array of mediocre suburban hotel options.
title: Low key luxury
comment: Enjoyed my stay in this newer high rise hotel in Overland Park. The hotel has a nice indoor pool, outdoor patio with bar, a small exercise room, a full service restaurant, Starbucks coffee bar, and a club lounge -- all are very nice, but the club lounge is too small for how many rooms it serves. Valet parking is offered, but free self parking is convenient. The hotel is separate from other commercial development, so you'll need a car to drive, but lots of good restaurants and newer shopping are nearby. Weekend rates here are a great value; I would highly recommend staying based on my experience.

title: Conference stay
comment: Wish I could of stayed longer!

title: Great but...
comment: The pool, Villa size and location are the best you can get! Our kids loved the pool and the activities offered on site. The proximity to Broadway at the beach is the best and the room is very well sized and furnished great. As in most reviews, the staff does not care about your BPG status (and I am gold and a Maui villa owner) and therefore will not accommodate requests. The staff also seems abit more like a time share mgmt and less like a hotel and that needs to change. Customer services is job one. The staff needs to be more friendly and treat customers better.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Everything was wonderful -- our trip was very enjoyable.

title: Two nights of no sleep
comment: Friday night, roudy/intoxicated men were staying across the hall from me and kept the entire hallway up all night. Saturday night, the PA system went off in my room for almost an hour at 4am in the morning. Also, why do you not offer Wi-Fi for your guests? Less expensive hotels offer free Wi-Fi.

everyoneShouldKnow: Situated right off the interstate so easy to get in and out.
title: Getaway VS Business
comment: Nice place to visit for a weekend getaway to a business meeting. It has qualities for both. Would make a nice getaway for two on a Fall weekend.

title: Needs renovation
