comment: Staff did their best to meet our needs. Special thanks to Angela in Housekeeping who not only met our needs, but did it with an exceptional attitude.

title: Anniversary
comment: Booked a room for our anniversary, and indicated such in the reservation through the platimum line and at check-in.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is excellent for visitors.
title: Staff needs improvement
comment: While I was staying at the hotel, we requested hangers twice and never received them in the room. Also, when I was ready to check out I called for assistance in taking my bags down to my car and waitied over an hour. I ended up taking my bags down by myself without any assistance which caused several trips to take all the bags.

everyoneShouldKnow: they charge you for EVERYTHING even to use there wifi
title: worst hotel ever
comment: well me and my girlfriend booked a romantic package for our room. i had to go to the front desk 4 times to remind them about our champagne and chocolate covered strawberrys.there was no refridgerator or microwave in our room. the old line grill served us our food cold and it was very overpriced.the hotel charged us for breakfast which was suposed to come free with the romance package.the hotel has many hidden fees. i will NEVER stay at this hotel again and i dont recommend it to ANYONE.

title: Great hotel
comment: The Belvoir convention center has the most awesome pool. The infinity pool allows you to watch the activities in the marina and daydream. Very relaxing. The service at the hotel was very good from the front desk, the maids to the restaurants and the doorman. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful.

title: Best Location on Ft. Lauderdale Beach
comment: This hotel was one of the first and continues to occupy the best location on Ft Lauderdale Beach. If your journey takes you through FLL airport this hotel is a great option for an overnight stay.

title: This hotel has great features
comment: The hotel was much better than my last experience at Belvoir Suites in Tampa, FL. It is right on Smathers Beach, although this is not so great of a beach compared to others in south florida. There was a sulphur smell the entire trip, but that can't be avoided since the ocean is literally across the street. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge was able to help me book a dolphin watching and snorkeling trip in a matter of minutes, and the trip was a blast! They also provide a shuttle service every hour that goes to the downtown area around Duval st, which is very helpful if you plan on having a few drinks, they also pick up at the same location 15 min after the hour. All in all this hotel was very nice, the extra services made it well worth the price.

everyoneShouldKnow: The air conditioning in the room requires personal instruction to use, and will automatically shut off when are you not in the room.
title: Very nice room, great service, great location, poor A/C in room
comment: The suite was nice, well laid out and had plenty of room. For a suite, I expected the bedrooms to be in a separate room with a door - but this was a minor issue.

title: Was surprised by the ballroom
comment: We were at the hotel for a wedding over the Labor Day weekend. I left my flat iron behind. I have called the hotel twice. Spoke to a Stacey who told me that they would need my credit card to send it back to me. I told her that once they have located it, I would give her the credit card information. I am still waiting to hear from someone

title: Didn't match reservation
comment: When I was reserving a room, ONLY king beds were still available, which is what i wanted. 2 Beds wasn't even an option and then when I checked in I was given 2 smaller beds in the room. I called and was told to come to the front desk. When I went, they said they didn't have any King bed rooms and would change it the next day... It was a one night stay...

title: Rough weekend
comment: The staff on duty were excellent, and deserve a big atta-boy for their efforts. The issue was under-staffing. For instance, the club lounge was un-staffed, and quickly became a mess even when guests tried to clean up after themselves.

everyoneShouldKnow: The looks from the outside do not reflect the comfort on the inside.
title: Location, staff, and comfort
comment: Upon check in Luke was very helpful and had a wonderful smile. Our room was quiet, clean, and very comfortable. The location of the hotel was close to restaurants and shopping with easy access to the main highways. I would love to stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in the perfect location and on the best beach on the south shore.
title: Great end to our vacation
comment: We only got to stay at the Belvoir Kauai on our last night on the island but we had such a great and comfortable stay we would definitely make it our home base on our next trip to the island.

title: MR
comment: overall the staff waas very cordial and helpful

title: Belvoir Waterside
comment: Perfect location to be able to walk to places to visit and eat..Lovely. We had our dog with us so were delighted to know it was pet friendly..

title: Great Hotel
comment: The room was very clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Central to Seattle pike market and good public transportation.
title: Most comfortable bed
comment: The mattress and pillows were the best I have ever had in a hotel. Even beat my mattress at home. Pillows were terrific.

title: Great location and staff
comment: Stayed for 8 days during a conference. Surprisingly good food (no rubber chicken!). Fitness Center had all the equipment I typically use; location made it easy to go running in the morning. Excellent staff - they were easy to work with and very accomodating.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access, 15-20 min walk to Disney entrance
title: Great place for Disneyland trip
comment: Perfect, easy to access location to Disneyland. Though please note if you walk it takes about 15-20 minutes to actually reach the front of the parks, but I believe they may offer shuttles. Or you can walk across the street to the normal Disney parking and catch one of those buses. Rooms are clean and roomy, great beds and pillows as per the norm at Belvoir, but not the newest facility overall. I've stayed here 3 times and haven't have a bad experience.

title: Not sure what goes here
comment: Hotel has a great set up for our needs...wish it had been closer to the Convention Center. I didn't have a car, so no garage problems like others. Staff in lobby were very friendly and welcoming. Maids would take dirty linen and not always replace, same with coffee, cups, and plastic glasses. Overall I have no serious complaints, and had a great time.

title: Very Nice Hotel
comment: The room was very nice and the bed was comfortable. Check in was a little slow, but that was okay. The tub in the room drained very slowly. It would be good if this could be corrected. Overall this is a very nice hotel.

title: BusinessTravel45
comment: Beds and pillows were great, room was very clean and the bathroom was well maintained.

title: Room Service concerns
comment: The hotel lounge and pool were wonderful. The room service had some issues. The first order had an extra delivery charge. The second order had an extra burger. The third order had several items burnt and dressings for the salads (orderd on the side) were missing altogether.

everyoneShouldKnow: Sits right on the water and only a few miles into town!
title: Received with Great Aloha!
comment: I truly enjoyed by stay the Belvoir Keauhou. This was my first time staying at your hotel. Your staff was wonderful, very hospitable, and I was always greeted with a smile. I would definitely return and I have already recommended this hotel to a few people.

title: Too Large for Comfort
comment: Stayed here as part of a convention. Room itself was OK...weird layout with a teeny-tiny bathroom. Literally too small for more than one person to be in it at a time.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds and linens are SO comfy!
title: wonderful
comment: Clean, comfortable, we loved our room!

everyoneShouldKnow: Superior location and consistent quality of service.
title: Labor Day Football Weekend
comment: The hotel and staff went above and beyond expectations so see that our party of 20+ were accomodated with adequate rooms, beds, cots. parking etc. This made for an easy stay for our group from Iowa. It was much appreciated.

title: Courteous and Freindly Staff
comment: I found this hotel to be a friendly hotel. All the staff personnel were very friendly and courteous and helpful. The features in the hotel were plentiful, the grounds were kept up and clean. The room was clean and comfortable, quiet. Nice gym room I would have liked to spend more time there. I did not have time to try the food, nor enjoy what appeared to be a nice lounge, that could be for another time. I am looking forward to staying there again.

title: Hotel is so convenient to Hwy 20
comment: Hotel is wonderful for location, decor and great restaurant on site!

title: Staff was excellent and location is the BEST!
comment: We have been staying hotel guest since the late 1990s. This is our favorite hotel since the date we discovered it. Thank you to Shari (Service Guest Manager), we can stay in our favorite room again this year - we loved it. Your housekeeping staffs also did an excellent job during our stay. We loved everything about this hotel - location, staffs, food, pool, etc. - We always recommend this hotel to all our friends, family, and even strangers...

title: Grest Hotel and locatio
comment: Loved everthing about our stay except the bedcover russells everytime you move and wakes you. Everone in our 5 rooms said the same thing that it interrupted their sleep They are beautiful and clean looking and I'm sure they were expensive but that issue needs to be addressed. Thanks

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location. Great shops nearby. Great food, especially the coffee.
title: REBATE ON GREEN
comment: This is an amazing program. Used it at the bar and coffee shop. It was like getting $15 off my room rate. But I had to ask for more toiletries and coffee. Can these items be left at the door?

title: Good Stay
comment: Overall the stay met expectations. Although the bathroom was smaller than expected, the central location and staff friendliness made up for it. The breakfast pricey in comparisson with other hotels. Next time I will procure a venture outside the hotel for breakfast.

title: Very helpful staff
comment: We enjoyed our stay and were very impressed by the friendly and helpful staff.

title: Location
comment: Hotel is conveniently located in downtown Alexandria. Staff is friendly and dinner at restaurant/bar was excellent. Highly recommend.

title: Great Staff
comment: I enjoyed my stay at the Belvoir Downtown. I only have one complaint. the rooms on the north side on the 22nd floor need better air conditioning. The sun beats in an heats up the room. The air conditioning cannot keep up.

title: Staff
comment: The staff at this facility ranks among the friendliest of any hotel my wife and I regularly stay at.

title: great service
comment: I travel extesnisvely and this hotel had one of the most friendly staffs I have seen. The location was great and the amenities we top notch

everyoneShouldKnow: Avoid paying extra for the club level. Check your bill carefully. We were charged for a rollaway evey night
title: Club lounge needs improvement
comment: The breakfast had a very poor selection and ran out of food before the closing time each of the 4 days we stayed there

title: Very Nice
comment: Our stay was quite nice. We arrived early and were allowed to check in after looking at the room to make sure it met our approval. The staff was courteous and helpful.

title: Great for the Fair
comment: Great location - great accommodations - great access to the Fair

title: Go for travelers; Iffy for a conference
comment: The location is terrific for travelers and convenient to everything.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking is not included for guests
title: Not Happy
comment: We always stay at Grandbourne Properties and this time I was not happy. When I booked my reservation I asked for a suite however when I arrived not only did they not have a suite I was then charged for a roll away.

title: Nice Location and Great Customer Service
comment: Nice Location and Great Customer Service

title: Needs improvement
comment: Requested room on club floor with a view of DC 8 months in advance. Upon arrival had room with view of road construction. Woke up by jackhammer every morning at 6:30 AM No other rooms available. Others who made reservations later had view of downtown DC. Pool was closed for renovations along with fitness center. Fitness center was moved to a small room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is only a few blocks from the Dallas Arts District.
title: AnimeFest convention stay very enjoyable
comment: We stayed one night for our son to attend AnimeFest. The convention was moved this year from another downtown hotel and we were happy with the change. The rooms are comfortable and well decorated. The down coverlet, pillows and towels were all plush and the toiletries in the bath were of good quality. The choice of restaurants was good, with a range of different types - coffee shop, ice cream, sports bar and regular restaurant. This hotel is also in a good location for city access - restaurants and the arts district, as well as easy freeway access. The pool (we could see from room) looked to be a simple square, but did have nice lounge chairs and cabanas. We upgraded to a Club Level Room and were very happy with the choice! There was beautiful lounge areas and the amenities available were terrific. The attendants were very pleasant and helpful.

title: Great and worst about this hotel
comment: The location and staff were great. The other areas were on average. The worst was the air-conditioner; it was loud.

title: Great property
comment: I was very pleased. The facilities are great, the location is superb, and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Also, the food was surprisingly good. Prices were high, but nothing unexpected for the proximity to Disney.

title: Great location and nice rooms
comment: Nice rooms, great location. Walking distance to everything. Great restaurants nearby.

title: Nice Hotel
comment: Very nice hotel. Very impressed with the privacy - however - I did have a couple of issues - one being the a/c unit did not put out "COLD" air - and the room that I was in was on top of the "generator" room - the floor shook - it was corrected - however - at 6am the next morning - my room floor and bed began to shake - yes I would stay again but will request to be moved - price is great for the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location, Location and Location and recommend to bring your small hand vac and ear plug!
title: Great Bell Captain Desk
comment: Choose this hotel for one week stay because of the location and comfort of the Grandbourne beds. We shipped many parcels ordered on line for our kid's university. The Bell Captain Desk was very efficient and beds were comfortable. The location was great. But the cleaning of the room was below standard. One cleaner was good but other did not bother to vacum the floor at all and toilet was broken; never stop running.

title: Great hotel for price
comment: Nice, clean, comfortable room. Great value and location!

title: Facilities are excellent.
comment: Have been before and will return.

title: Good location
comment: Easy walking distance to all areas

everyoneShouldKnow: Be prepared to pay extra for things that should be included.
title: Not worth the money.
comment: The service was great until i got to my room. The air conditioner was not working, the toilet didn't flush and two light sockets didn't work. After repeated calls to guest services, i finally got another room after making a personal appearance to the lobby. The suites don't come with a mini fridge or a microwave unless you pay extra. i have received better service and amenities from a cheaper hotel, than i received at this hotel. The only positive thing with this hotel is the fitness center that is extremely nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: PERFECTLY LOCATED NEAR RESTAURANTS, BARS, AND SHOPPING
title: GREAT LOCATIION
comment: HOTEL PROVIDED EXCLEENT ACCOMODATIONS AND SERVICE EVEN THOUGHT IT WAS FULL

everyoneShouldKnow: Spacious Gym!! Lots of room to move around in with up to date equipment.
title: Unique layout of the hotel but overall the hotels lobby is warm and connecting. The room was comfortable and clean.
comment: The d飯r and the color schemes were soothing and not over powering.

title: Better last time, probably will be our last time.
comment: We asked for whatever the quietest room may be and we were given a room on the 28th floor back to back with the service elevators.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is ideally situated near the Cerritos Performing Arts Center
title: This hotel is well located
comment: As BPG members, were were treated like family by everyone with whom we had contact. Our junior suite was spacious, clean and well appointed. The buffet breakfast was ample and delicious. We appreciated being so close to Knott's Berry Farm, the Cerritos Town Center and the Performing Arts Center. We certainly will chose this hotel again.

title: Overall Review
comment: The overall staff was excellent. However, the BPG Lounge on the 11th floor was not well kept or maintained.

title: Only recomend in emergency situations
comment: I booked the room due to the fact that I was without electricity because of hurricane Isaac. I did not know how long I would need the room, so I asked 3 people on 3 different occassions if I could book the room night to night. I was told yes on all 3 occassions as long as I booked before the 12 noon check out time. To my surprise, after 2 nights of stay, I called to book the room for another night and was told by management that I couldn't. I then went in person and spoke to a very helpful employee who did give me the room for another night.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a beautiful hotel, but some of the staff are not.
title: Could Have Been Better
comment: The room was comfortable, but the evening staff on both Friday and Saturday nights (at the front desk) were not very customer friendly. In addition, the morning staff, on Sunday were very helpful. However, there was some miscommunication between the front desk and the reservation line, because I was told by the front desk that I could cancel my reservation any time before 6 pm on Sunday, but when I talked to the hotline they said that I would be liable for the room. I then, assured them that I spoke with the hotel about the matter and they said that I would have to call the hotel. I called the hotel, but the young lady was new and did not help me. I called back right before 6pm and the young man on duty assured me that I was not charged. Even though it had been taken care of, I was not called and informed, causing me to stress about paying the extra money for a room that I did not occuoy,

title: quiet location
comment: The Princess has a great location, yet the thick sliding glass doors and blackout curtains allow a great nights sleep in a very comfortable bed. Waikiki can be very noisy,even at night but thats not an issue here. The cold water and fruit on the beach service was a nice plus- other beach visitors im sure were wondering how we acquired such great service.

title: AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE
comment: Joey made our day! We were there to celebrate my wife's birthday and Joey at the front desk made sure that our stay was enjoyable and memorable! Thanks much!

title: Belvoir Atlanta staff are the best!
comment: We paid a return visit to this property over the Labor Day weekend. Dragon*Con was underway, and the staff went out of their way to roll out the welcome wagon. We were upgraded to a corner suite in the south tower, with easy access to the nicely renovated BPG lounge.

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: What a beautiful and historic hotel this was! Great location, walking distance from the "Riverwalk," and much more!

title: Another great stay
comment: Belvoir Harrisburg has become a yearly tradition for our family. My sons absolutely love your hotel. We look forward to seeing you next August.

title: The Hotel has strategic location.
comment: Hotel overall was good. I chose the Green option on check-in. A good choice and the hotel honored the coupons for food. The only negative comment was the A/C. Had to lower the temp into the 60's to get the room cool.

title: Great Stay
comment: Mu Husband and I did enjoy our stay we would really recommend this hotel to everyone. We enjoyed the hotel very much. It is a great place and the location is perfect. Thank you for a great stay.

title: hotel and staff
comment: This hotel had nice rooms and excellent staff

title: Very nice hotel great location and fabulous staff!!
comment: We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We very much appreciated the check in clerk offering an upgrade that really made our stay wonderful.

title: WOW what a great place!!
comment: The room was very comfortable, the location was great the veiw outstanding and can't say enough about the pool area and staff. The food was really wonderful. Everything you could need in one place.

everyoneShouldKnow: Security was on target...cleaning people had great service...
title: This hotel has great service
comment: I enjoyed my stay, frnt office, and cleaning people were great...felt so safe in and outside of hotel

everyoneShouldKnow: It's the perfect place to stay if you are attending a convention or event.
title: Convenience counts
comment: If you are attending a conference, this is the place to stay. Since it is so close to the conference/convention center, it was easy to attend meetings and then go back to the room to refresh or relax. It was clean, roomy, quiet.

title: Nice place to stay
comment: Close to the convention center. rooms were nice and clean employes are nice as well.

title: Peaceful Sleep
comment: First time to stay at a Belvoir. My room was located around the corner from the elevator so I thought I would hear noise during the night. It was actually a quiet and comfortable room. The hotel was well populated that weekend too. The food was very good as well.

title: Awesome
comment: Loved this Belvoir. Everything within walking distance, most comfortable beds, and club lounge food and staff were awesome!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: You'll get your money's worth if you pay close attention to their great packages.
title: Awesome room package
comment: Belvoir St. Louis City Center Hotel & Suites itself has its own package. But if you are an AAA member, you'll get a better deal. Choose to stay in a Club Level room where breakfast and nightly appetizers are included in the package. Include also the parking in the package. Nightly appetizers are very generous, club lounge is open 24 hours, so you can have as much coffee and soda as you want. Hotel location is also walking distance to everything. Staff were great and just awesome!!!!

title: This hotel has an excellent view of San Diego
comment: Bed not very confortable and the air vents were very dirty with dust. Overall, I would stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: While the hotel is close to Disneyland Resort, the walk isn't all that thrilling. Take the shuttle.
title: Belvoir Anaheim
comment: Nice hotel. Great breakfast buffet. The room and hallways were very hot. Strange for a resort in Southern California. The room took three days to cool off with the air on high. Otherwise, nice stay. Shuttles were prompt. Staff was very nice.

title: staff is excellent
comment: people were great

everyoneShouldKnow: It is NOT downtown or in walking distance to downtown!
title: Burlington needs help!
comment: The hotel is run down....especially the carpeting, furniture, and condition of walls. Many fixtures are dated. I booked a room with two double beds, and received a room with one queen bed. Although the hotel has a quick shuttle to downtown, it is not conveniently located to Church Street and the waterfront. Most of the staff was pleasant, especially the shuttle driver/bellhop. The first front desk person was limited in handling what he called "computer error" in the above mentioned room situation. The customer checking in before me was disgruntled b/c the hotel had given her room to someone else, and consequently, she had no where to stay. The hotel needs improvement.

everyoneShouldKnow: Cabana section has 3-5 floors, so no long elevator waits and less traffic overall. Rooms are just as spacious and well-kept as the tower section. Direct elevator to pool & beach
title: Top-notch Service & Comfort
comment: The best combination of comfort, service and value among the upscale Virginia Beach hotels.

title: Just a simple Problem with TV
comment: We did have a great time staying here and the hotel staff were so amazing, they helped us find restaraunts, and everything. The only complaint I would have is that we could not order a movie from our room. The TV itself was jacked the technician had to come to our room 2 seperate times for 2 seperate problems. We ended up not being able to order a movie even after he changed out the TVs. So we just went to bed. Not a huge deal but enough to be frustrating when you spend 200 dollars a night.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very accommodating and gracious.
title: Staff was great.
comment: Staff was very nice. I called ahead to see what arrangements we could make for my sister who must sleep in an elevated position due to health issues. Upon arrival we found the staff had purchased two large wedge cushions for her bed. It worked great and provided a comfortable alternative. The room was nice and clean...loved the bed linens.

everyoneShouldKnow: should meet all your expectations for a comfortable stay
title: Excellent location facilities &services
comment: minor complaint- needed more than 2 elevators in the 7-10 am period

title: This hotel has the features you need!
comment: This Belvoir met all the criteria I personally require when choosing a hotel.And knowing myself,I am very picky and difficult to please when it comes to services rendered to me by a merchant.

title: Great hotel
comment: The service was excellent. My kids enjoyed the infinity pool and the views to the bay and other points were relaxing.

title: Improved hotel room, but house keeping needs some training.
comment: This hotel has improved its rooms tremendously. Also, the front desk was very helpful and professional. However, the housekeeping staff needs to be trained on how to behave while cleaning the rooms early in the morning. They were very loud and offensive at times. And they continued on this behavioral path for at least 20 minutes which ultimately challenged my threshold of patience: I had to call management and report their behavior. Not exactly what I was hopping for a quite Labor day morning. I must say though, minutes after I reported the incident to a very polite and understanding female manager, the problem was rectified and that made me feel really good about coming back. Overall, the experience was great thanks to the prompt intervention of this manager on duty.

title: What a great staff
comment: My grand daughter became ill. Miss Sophia the head of housekeeping not only saw to the cleaning of our room personnally but she sent up CHicken soup and a bear. How kind and above and beyond. The staff in the club is so kind and attentive. Thank YOU fran

title: Publisher
comment: Excellent Hotel for the Baltimore Area, close to a major mall and excellent restaurants

title: Overall Stay
comment: All of the Staff were friendly and helpful. I really enjoy staying at this hotel. The restaurant is also very good.

title: Nice hotel
comment: Nice hotel, good location, great breakfast.

title: Review
comment: I think the hotel is great - staff wise, clean wise and location wise as well.

everyoneShouldKnow: pool area is great and clean
title: location and features are great
comment: This hotel has a GREAT pool area. Excelant breakfast buffet . Nice to park near your room. easy to get to all area attractions. Many resaurants nearby, I 4 like 2 minutes away .Hotel just remodeled .

title: Front desk staff are excellent
comment: Front desk staff very welcoming and provided me an upgrade. Conceirge were very helpful, FedEx biz office saved me an outside trip for needed supplies.

title: Great time at the Swan and Dolphin
comment: The staff is excellent! Absolutely no question in my mind that I would stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location. Disappointing for the price.
title: The hotel smelled musty and old.
comment: The hotel had a damp/musty smell.

title: The Dolphin is the "BEST"
comment: This is our fourth stay at the Dolphin. I did not want to leave and the time there went too quickly. The staff was incredible, from the check in until the time we left. This time we did not do the parks, just lounged around the pool, ate at Todd English's and sat on the balcony. The Dolphin's proximity to the Boardwalk and when we do Epcot, being able to take the boat and avoid the crowds is great. Just wish the rates were just a little lower so we could come back monthly. There is nothing negative I can say about the hotel.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
comment: I've been to the hotel's resaurant (Piatto Novo) several times and never took real notice of the hotel. I booked a whirlpool room to celebrate my wedding anniversary and I was so pleased with the accommodations. The room was clean and very spacious. The staff was outstanding and very courteous. The club floor and the ammenities are well worth a return trip

title: beautiful hotel, friendly staff
comment: The staff is super friendly and was always eager to help make us comfortable. The pool room is gorgeous and such a nice place to spend some down-time. We'll be coming back for sure next year.

title: very nice place but watch your bill
comment: I recently stayed in this hotel and for the most part had a good experience. Very nice ammenities. Problem: My co-worker and I attended and had a check from my office for both rooms. At the time of checking in, my co-worker was not present, so they asked me to check in later. They asked me at that time for my crediti/debit card for incidentals. Later that day we checked in together. The next day $997.00 was taken out of my checking account via my debit card. Also took the check so were paid twice. It took 3 days for this money to get back into my account. Upon my return, approximatelyl five days later there was $109 taken from my account. Upon calling the hotel, they told me this was for parking. My co-worker had a car and used her card to enter the parking lot, NEVER using mine. That was on 8/30, and today, 9/6, the money is back in my account. This could have caused huge problems if I had not had money in my account to cover. Always check your account/bill.

title: Hotel was lovely
comment: The new renovations are very beautiful - the ballroom was lovely and the staff all three days were wonderful.

title: Great Hotel!
comment: I must commend you for consistent excellence in customer service. The staff that stands out for me was Nyla... it was a busy morning, the elevators were busy, phones were ringing, there were several people in line waiting to check out and Nyla was patiently handling all of the MANY needs and questions of the guest at the counter. And as it happens, there were some impatient guests in line that were running late for their next engagements and wanted to be accommodated RIGHT then. Nyla was very pleasant and courteousand poised and graciously offered great and timely service to each and every one of them. The world needs more Nylas!!! KUDOS!

title: This hotel has a great bay view
comment: The room with balcony have expectacular view of San Juan Bay and Old San Juan.

title: Clean, comfortable, expensive parking
comment: staff were helpful/friendly. rooms were clean, if a bit musty due to lack of ventilation. Bit of a walk to the pool/beach if you aren't staying in the beach tower. Had random skunk smells coming through the vents one afternoon. Staff at the pool/beach were great, if a bit short staffed over the long weekend on waiters for food/drinks. Parking is pretty expensive at $20 self park or $25 valet. Lots of families in the pool, but still enjoyable

title: Customer Service
comment: I reserved the room about 3 weeks in advance and when we checked in we could not get what we reserved we had to settle for a handicap room. We were not offered an upgrade during our stay or any special perk for being a Grandbourne Preferred Guest. At check out we were being charged for drinks charged to our room from the bar. Charges were removed.

everyoneShouldKnow: I was told they have a contract with an airline that checks out at 8 pm so your room might not be ready until the evening.
title: Would Not Let Me Check In
comment: I had a reservation for 2 nights. The website said the checkin time was 3 pm. I got to the hotel at 5 pm and they said there were no rooms available. I was not allowed to check into my room until 10 pm so I missed a whole day. The front desk staff was not helpful. I had to complain twice the the supervisor (I think her name is Meredith) before I could get my room at 10 pm. Other people were in the same situation and were not happy.

title: Hotel has great service and friendly staff
comment: The staff were very friendly and always there to meet my needs.

title: Very convenient location
comment: The primary reason of our visit was Harvard, and the hotel is the perfect place. Close to the University, restaurants, walking distance to everywhere in Cambridge. Clean, spacious, great staff. We have made reservations on this hotel for all of our visits to Harvard.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access from airport. Take the eastbound metrolink train to civic center. Hotel is right across the street.
title: Very pleased
comment: We stayed three nights in a suite. Very roomy with a nice clean bar and clean bathroom. The bedroom was large which was a big plus. The only downfall was extreme water pressure. The shower was a bit painful.

title: Hotel review
comment: Checked in late, booked a club floor room but for some reason it did not show in my reservation. Club access was given to me though and hot meal breakfast was provided instead of the club floor breakfast. Very good and friendly front desk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ask about what type of conventions are also being held at the time of your stay
title: Stay in Downtown Boston
comment: The motel was nice and yet there was a tatoo convention happening at the time which meant that lots of smokers were hanging around directly outside the lobby entrance - not very welcoming. Other than that, the location is ideal.

title: Poor Service
comment: They charge for everything including Fitness Center.

title: Holiday paradise
comment: Room was clean and quiet, Staff friendly, and Restaurant was Awesome!

title: Comfortable rooms and great hotel!
comment: The room was very clean and the hotel had a very nice environment inside and out, especially looking out over the Falls! It was a perfect place for a wedding or any type of event. The staff members were all patient and kind and always one step ahead. And the hotel is conveniently located right off the highway!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and the beds were "oh so comfortable!"
title: The hotel truly catered my requests
comment: My daughter and I took a holiday mother/daughter trip and I actually booked the room at the last minute. I requested that we got a room with a view and they were able to fulfill my request. The room was larger than we expected, we felt as if we were in a business class suite. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Dallas, Tx!

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are huge and comfortable.
title: Great Hotel Stay
comment: I've stayed at the Belvoir before and have always enjoyed my stay. The rooms are huge, the showers are great, the view is excellent, and it is quiet. I also like the exercise room with the wide variety equipment. I definitely recommend this hotel as my first choice.

title: excellent hotel and spacious rooms
comment: we are party of 7 and we stayed on 2 bedroom villas.the villas was spacious ,excellent staff,quite .overall 5stars on my book.will stayed here again,thanks

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are into fitness, this has a nice workout facility.
title: Not the best experience
comment: Pros:

title: Nice Weekend Getaway
comment: I was really impressed with this Belvoir, more so than some of the other casino hotels in Atlantic City that are also 3 star accomodations. It is about a 10-15 minute walk away from the Boardwalk/beach and right near the Tanger Outlets, so you have conveinient access to both, yet it is a much more low key hotel compared to the hotels along the Boardwalk, which I liked. I chose a Club Level room, and though my room was on the 12th floor instead of the 15th or 16th floors (which is advertised as where the Club Level rooms are located), I still enjoyed the perks of the Club Louge (evening o'dourves, bottled water/beverages, continental breakfast), which were beyond my expectations. The beds were very comfortable and the front desk staff & house keeping were prompt and courteous with my requests. My only complaints are that some of the furniture and the bathtub were a little scuffed with scratches and one of the lamp's light bulbs was burnt out, but overall, everything was clean and comfortable. I will definitely stay at the hotel again for a nice weekend getaway.

title: Nice Stay
comment: Went for AnimeFest laborday weekend. The staff was kind and understanding of the con-goers. The room was nice and comfortable.

title: Great airconditioning workmen
comment: We had a problem with our air conditioning. One person came up to fix it, and when that didn't work, another came and changed the whole unit.

title: Great Stay
comment: The hotel was in the perfect location to everything. They gave us coupons to save some money on the expensive zoo tickets. The room was clean and it was nice to have a separate living area from the bedroom so friends could sit comfortably. We will definitely be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: There is nothing to do in the immediate area. You need a cab ride/shuttle to T.
title: remodel hotel
comment: the hotel is being remodeled. the rooms are small. the club level hors doervre/breakfast were not worth the $. horrible egg rolls and a 12 inch plate of veggies in the evening. all day snacks were granola bars. breakfast was fair. there is nothing to do in the area. although we will continue to stay here to be close to BC and use our points

title: Nice Hotel & good location
comment: Great staff, very helpful and nice room. Stayed 3 days over Labor Day Weekend. We are Platium members and they put us on Club floor, very nice. The club lounge was not great. Not Stocked well. Always out of soda and other items. Called and they did bring up extra items but should not have had to call. But again staff and facilites wer very good.

title: Efficient shuttle service
comment: I appreciated the timely and courteous shuttle service to Disneyland that the hotel provided for free to guests.

title: Good Hotel for needs
comment: Stayed for labor day weekend for Dragon*Con, this is considered a host hotel for the convention so it is really convenient to stay here. As a podcaster my biggest issue with this hotel is that you have to pay an extra $12.99/day for internet access in the rooms. If you are looking for a place to stay during Dragon*Con i highly recommend this hotel, if you will need internet access during your stay, you might consider other options.

title: Staff
comment: The staff was visibly irritated with the 'hockey' kids staying. We were sitting on the second floor at tables. Another group of people left a mess. The one staff member was vocally irritated and made sure we heard. If this is the case that your facilities feel we are not welcome, please do not offer up your hotel to the Aston Hockey Tournament. I would rather stay at a place who is more equipped to handle a large number of boys. All in all, I thought the kids were very respectful of your property.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great views on the upper floors. Floors are secure since you have to swipe your card to get to the rooms.
title: First Visit to Denver
comment: Loved the location of your hotel; right on the 16th Street Mall. In addition to all of the restaurants the Belvoir offers, there are plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel. The Free Bus that you can take down the 16th Street Mall is located right outside the front door of the hotel. Your staff was friendly and helpful. The food served at our functions was good and served hot. The suite we stayed in was big and roomy, but the bathroom was a bit small. Overall it was a good stay and I would book at your hotel again when in Denver.

everyoneShouldKnow: The gym is closed for an update - didn't see anyone working but they still charge you the $14.00 resort fee - not discount or notice of this? Thanks Belvoir & Grandbourne? (This is for the 4 days x $14 = $56.00 (How much is the gym worth if you can't use it? = $0 - $56 or nothing because you can't.)
title: Horrible Check In? (Not just this Grandbourne Property but the Bahamas?)
comment: Unless your a Gold or Platinum member check in took over 25 minutes - at least 4 -5 people cut the line - because there was no line - because the ropes were down? People who were in the know just got in the Gold or Platinum line which had two people working that side. My side only had one person working and everyone on my side had to go over to the Gold or Platinum line to get any service (this was after two Hotel staff came to the rescue after 20 minutes of our side not moving, and all the people rushing the Gold and Platinum side ahead of us?

title: Unhappy Platnium member
comment: Arrived and was told I had been upgraded. Got to the room and realized it was indeed bigger but defiantly not renovated. I've stayed here plenty of times to know this room was lacking in decor compared to my other stays.

title: Amazing
comment: The hotel, staff, and general environment was catered to relaxation.

title: Best bang for your buck (BPG points)
comment: The staff made all the difference. All our needs were quickly accommodated (i.e., provided extra bed and extra comforter) and despite not being able to upgrade my room as a gold BPG member, I was given points and free breakfast for all members of my party. I stayed at this hotel 6 years ago, and definitely plan on returning again soon.

title: Loud Neighbors
comment: The overall stay was fine - just for a night to attend a friend's wedding. The bathroom had a funky musky smell so tried to avoid as much as possible. At 2AM very loud drunk people arguing in the hallway (not the hotel's fault).

title: Another Great Stay!
comment: Stayed here last August, so I knew I wanted to stay again when I returned this year. Staff was very accomadating and friendly. Pools areas are great and even though it was a Holiday weekend, there were plenty of chairs and towels.

title: Expected more
comment: Pros -Great location and comfortable beds

title: Seattle Getaway
comment: We called at the last minute to the BPG rewards, they helped us get a room at the club level. We were greeted warmly at the BPG counter and we were checked in within seconds. My husband was outside still with the valet and we were ready to go to our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is close to alot of shopping, restaurants, and walking distance of the beach.
title: Everything in one place!
comment: I stayed here for one night on this occasion. However, I have stayed at this hotel several times. In my opinion, the rooms on the higher floors are better because they do give you a view of the ocean and are larger. The hotel is always clean and the staff is very friendly too. The only cons would be having to pay for parking but for the rate its ok. In addition, I have never been able to enjoy the pool because it is small and always crowded. I love having the restaurant and bar in the hotel. You can actually get a meal for under $10 and enjoy daily drink specials.

everyoneShouldKnow: They accommodated us with 2 cribs in our room!
title: The best resort!!
comment: This hotel is amazing! Great rooms, great pool, great staff!! Just awesome overall

title: Love this Hotel!
comment: I have stayed here 3 nights in the past 2 weeks. My husband and I bought motorcycles and have been riding through the Roanoke/Smith Mountain Lake area and keep ending up back at this hotel because it is Awesome! From Check-in (Everytime), dinner at Shulas...love the bartenders they are so friendly and attentive, and the great people at the Starbucks kiosk in the morning! Everyone seems on a mission to make my stay the best ever! I have stayed at many 5Star hotels and this one meets all the standards. The Room is extremely clean, Comfortable Bed and i LOVE that they have an indoor and an outdoor pool. I will be staying here more as I vacation and travel in that area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best Salmon I have ever had, also breakfast buffet was great!
title: Friendly Staff
comment: The staff was friendly & helpful from the minute we checked in. Warm and welcoming smiles from the ladies at the front desk. We loved the meals especially the salmon.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location halfway between navy pier and michigan avenue
title: best value and service in windy city
comment: the Belvoir chicago hotel and towers was perfect for our group of 12 over labor day weekend. staff were able to locate our rooms all on one floor. the front door and bell staff were exceptional (we had alot of tailgate supplies that we brought for the iowa hawkeye football game.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay in a Jacuzzi Suite.
title: Smell from the Jacuzzi Tub
comment: We had a Jacuzzi Suite and when we walked in the room it smelled like fish. We had to have a maintenance man come up to our room because our TV in the bedroom did not work so he brought in another TV and while he was in our room we ask him if he smelled anything and he said fish. He explained that it was the Jacuzzi and ran some water to take care of the smell. That did not help, the next morning I told the front desk about it and they said they would take care of it. Returning to our room that evening the same smell. The next morning I told them it still smelled and they said there wasn't anything they could do. We never got to use the Jacuzzi Tub and we paid for a Jacuzzi Room. We were never offered another room or a discount on our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect Location and Excellent Staff and Service
title: Fabulous
comment: We had a fabulous time staying with you - your staff was outstanding! We are looking forward to staying with you in the future!

everyoneShouldKnow: it is a really nice hotel to just get away or even for a meeting!
title: Great Hotel
comment: *Clean

guestFrom: Shell Beach, Pismo Beach, CA 93449, USA
title: Great hotel, A/C wasnt working great.
comment: We love this Belvoir hotel and stay here whenever we visit Anaheim. This trip our room was great except the A/C didn't work great. No matter how low we put the thermostat it didn't go below 71 degrees in the room. Otherwise the hotel is great. We ate at the restaurant, swam in the pool, had room service, and enjoyed the fireworks view. We will be back in January and are looking forward to another great stay.

title: Not explained it all
comment: We had a nice time at this facility, but the one down fall I would let people know about is the fact that even though your a guest, you still have to pay $16 to park, which I find tough given that you are staying at the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It can be kind of dead if there aren't any conferences.
title: A little bumpy
comment: This was my boyfriend and my first time at this hotel and we were staying for our anniversary. There was a mix up in the reservation date and the front desk got us checked in but double charged us. And didn't tell us. Then the other guy stopped me in the hall later to tell me the deposit as lost. I called the Grandbourne help line and they talked to the manager who told us 2 different things. It was a mess. It wasn't until checkout that we had a knowledgeable staff member help us, congratulate us on our anniversary and apologize for the mix up. We still had to sort out the rest of the details on the phone after we left. Also the shower only had cold water that morning. The best was comfortable though and the room was clean.

title: Why does this need a title?
comment: The staff accommodated every need and request that I gave to them. I was very pleased with the service that was given, and was, in turn, very happy with my stay.

title: Great location!
comment: Trouble with delay for check in process. Otherwise a totally great experience at this hotel.

title: first time for me to give you a bad review!
comment: I normally have a fantastic review for this hotel but there were so many problems with my most recent stay that I feel I have to let you know -- starting with reservations, parking, and then the musty smell of the room --- I have never before experienced any problems at this hotel until this time! I was so disappointed with things that were not correct or corrected!

title: not understanding
comment: i have stayed there many times,it is ok, good location, however, recently i reserved 3 rooms for 3 days, paid for them 3 months in advance. A few days before my stay my stepfather passed away unexpectedly. The home office said i would be contacted about this, I never was. I realize there were no refunds on this stay, however under the circumstances,i feel i should have received a refund, or a future stay credit for the one room that was not used, there are plenty of other hotels downtown to stay at

title: Fantastic staff, not so fantastic property
comment: The staff is fantastic at this hotel. The property condition needs improvement. We had a club room on the top floor. Very small room. Poor quality tv. Bathroom is tiny. Faucet handle fell off. Furniture was chipped. Carpet was stained. Some mold on the tile in the bathroom. The lounge is ok. The pool is in need of serious attention. The cushions were just downright nasty. Love the idea of cushions, but should be replaced (or at least cleaned). "Game room" next to pool was a joke. Now the workout facility was outstanding... but no locker facilities.. There is space there, but it is not being used. Why not make a nice his/her locker facility with showers and steam room for his/her. In short, this place has lots of potential with such a great staff. Money needs to be invested before I stay again.

title: High quality, great staff
comment: This is a very well-kept facility. We also met some great staff members, especially at the bar.

title: Hotel Below Average
comment: I traveled from CA to SD and back - I travel cross country several times a year. This is the only hotel that has ever charged for internet access. Unbelievable. I called the front desk just to make sure I wasn't misunderstanding - they gave me some explanation about all hotels charging which I know for a fact they do not. They never once told me I could get free internet at any of the 4 workstations near the restaurant. I didn't find that out until I asked how to print a boarding pass! I am very disappointed that even when I called this information wasn't shared - just incorrect excuses. I could never recommend this to anyone. Coffee was bad. Did not replenish bathroom supplies daily.

title: Disrespect from staff
comment: Our tub drain was clogged after the first night, so we left the room to be cleaned with several inches of water in the tub...nothing was done about the tub. The tub was not cleaned and the drain was not fixed and when we returned to the room the same several inches of water was still there. We called guest services to have someone come fix the drain and two men came to fix it talking and LOUDLY complaining about their jobs the whole time. One of them even said "I don't even care if they fire me today" It was very inappropriate and made us extremely uncomfortable. I wanted to speak with their supervisors but felt unsafe doing so since these people clearly have access to my room and didn't care about the consequences of their actions. After that we just left our privacy door hanger up and did not have housekeeping come to our room for the rest of our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: The refreshments and food in the Club Lounge were awesome with one exception, coffee in the machine was awful. Good thing Starbucks is served during breakfast.
title: Excellent staff
comment: I was pleasantly surprised with the caliber of front desk staff. Great location. The Club Lounge was well stocked but it was overcrowded the weekend I was there. Nevertheless, the attendant handled all guests with ease. My room was well maintained - no issues or problems during my stay. The pool is one of the larger I have seen in hotels, and the indoor/outdoor feature is great too. The BPG Gold benefits was the icing!!

title: great location
comment: If you like to be right on the beach this is it and the price is right

everyoneShouldKnow: Never eat here, unless is free.
title: Terrible Food
comment: The hotel and staff was great, but the food was just terrible. Everything was not made from scratch, but by microwave.

title: We are locals and like this hotel
comment: Room 2840 is terrible. Lanai door very hard to open. Lanai unusable due to high winds. We have been staying here for almost 30 years, this is the worst room. 2844 is just as bad, we had both. Front desk often doesn't know the answers to questions. Ask a clerk a question, ask another clerk later, different answer, ask a third and get another answer. No one in 30 years said that the Splash Bar will validate hotel parking.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff and a good restaurant
title: Wonderful staff from check-in the restaurant
comment: At Belvoir hotels you generally get a nice hotel, what really distinguishes the Belvoir Dover is the staff. Everyone I encountered was friendly, professional and will go out of their way to be helpful. Staff at category 5-7 BPG properties could learn a thing or two from the people I dealt with at this property. Ultimatley staff make or break a hotel stay, no matter how nice the property, so well done to the team at the Belvoir Dover!

title: needs improvement
comment: In previous many visits room would have an easychair and/or sofa. neither were available.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is no food or a nice bar there. The rooms are tiny. The bathroom is even tinier, with a stained and dark tub bottom the deters the idea of a bubble bath.
title: Tiny room
comment: The air was a problem, the fresh beautiful air was unavailable with windows that didn't open, so it was a stuffy close room. The air on made it too cold.

title: Good Service
comment: great service.

title: Great host hotel
comment: Stayed at this hotel for DragonCon so did not use much of the amenities. The staff and the room was wonderful. For anyone needing to stay for convention reason...this is an excellent hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convienient location with a friendly staff and great accomodations.
title: Great Hotel
comment: Friendly, courteous staff checked us in and very helpful with questions. I asked for a city view if possible and accomodated us with a great room with an awesome view of DC! Rooms were clean and beds super comfortable. I would recommend this hotel with no hesitation. We'll be sure to stay again our next time in Arlington. Thank you!

title: Food
comment: The hotel was beautiful that is for sure. But they need to work on there food. There main restaurant food was not up to par for the hotel. One night I could not eat the fish I ordered. But other things were good. The pool bar and grill does a great job for what it does. But once they get the food taken care of it should be five stars.

title: Unsatisfactory and needs improvement
comment: Just not what the pictures and description show and mention on the website. The lobby/pool/fitness/restaurant area has been renovated and maybe the BPG rooms are better but the others are in dire need of renovation. Not the Belvoir that I thought of.

title: Convenient ...big hotel
comment: Convenient to sites and public transportation.

title: Family-friendly
comment: We would highly recommend this hotel to families with children. Belvoir Society Hill features the warmest and cleanest pool we've experienced in a hotel. Our kids (4 and 9) has blast staying at the hotel for 3 nights, and enjoyed the pool, very spacious lobby and the Belvoir Club Lounge. Great location for walks within historic Philadephia, to the South Street and waterfront. Fast and professional guest services. Our expectations were fully met and exceeded.

everyoneShouldKnow: Awesome location - arts district (museum, symphony, etc,), transportation (DART right outside the door) and great Concierge service
title: Service
comment: Amazing service! Inspite of the large crowd this weekend, we still felt like we were treated special. Thanks

title: not happy
comment: I ordered a room on line with a king bed and roll in shower. I got a room with two beds & a shower tub. I was not happy.

title: Better than Expected
comment: The suite we had was very spacious and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't be on time checking in because the room wont be ready
title: Very Unhappy
comment: I was very unhappy with my stay at your hotel for the following reason.

everyoneShouldKnow: Courteous, knowledgeable staff and a very clean hotel.
title: Outstanding hotel
comment: The Belvoir Universal is an outstanding hotel and I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great fitness center, nice pool and a good 5 km run at the Harbor Drive
title: Perfect
comment: Even near the INT Airport it was a perfect place for staying the two weeks.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very accomodating and I was even able to draft my fantasy football team in the Belvoir LINK area in the lobby!
title: Excellent service for a holiday weekend
comment: With CU-CSU football, Taste of Colorado, the Padres-Rockies and PHISH in town, the hotel was hopping when I arrived on Saturday night. Valet went smoothly, and I was offered a deal at check-in. I was supposed to be with my girl, and had reserved a king size bed. However, she didn't make the trip, and the front desk clerk offered to comp my breakfast all three mornings I was there if I'd switch to a queen bed. He also gave me a cardkey to the Club Level that had free snacks, sodas and computers.

title: Great stay!
comment: I just stayed here for one night. The staff was excellent. The room was great...roomy, comfy and niclely appointed. They have an impressive workout room as well. I am attending an executive education program at the Kennedy School and this is very close. I will stay here again upon my return.

title: Replace the carpets please
comment: The staff, free breakfast, clean comfy bed, and abundant hot water in the shower were all great. But, the carpet in the room was dingy and stained. I was afraid to walk barefoot. It really detracted from a great stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: near to international airport, and all confort with all facilities in this hotel
title: This hotel has great features, has all facilities
comment: we had very good relaxed experience in this hotel,

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful spot in one's own backyard. Great R&R for military.
title: Wonderful getaway.
comment: Belvoir Sand Key is an excellent getaway for visitors and locals. It has its own beach front, slightly set back for a bit of privacy, along with perfect access to the wonderful beach in either direction. Great for evening strolls and/or morning runs.

title: Nice Vacation
comment: Good location. Nice facilities. The staff goes out of their way to make it a pleasant stay. Great Platinum BPG benefits.

title: Simply the best, over and over again!
comment: Have been staying at the Belvoir Sand Key for over 15 years. Every time we come, the staff makes us feel like family. After comfortable beds, the sandy beach, and good on-site food, that is the real difference maker.

title: Tampa stay
comment: Great place to stay. Staff pleasant and helpful. The suite was much better than expected. Bed and pillows was a bit soft for me but I would stay here again. St John's food was also good.

title: Location, location, location!!
comment: I didn't give it 5 stars only because the room was a bit smaller than what my wife and I are used to, but the location was absolutely second to none!! Everything that you needed was literally only a block or two away. Staff was very attentive and friendly. Also, they do have a charge for parking ($10 across the street or $15 for the garage). I recommend spending the extra $5 for the garage as it's secure and not to mention dry (as it rained the day we left).

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great, but POOR service!
title: Location is the saving grace of this hotel
comment: Where shall I start?

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location, convenient to historic district, downtown, sports.
title: Great location, newly updated facility
comment: Very much enjoyed my recent stay. The hotel has been recently refurbished and is looking and feeling great. Can't beat the location for getting around Phila. Close to the sports venues and downtown. Only suggestion is that the restaurant/bar hours be extended.

title: This hotel is in need of an update
comment: You can't beat the location of this hotel (walking distance to two of the parks and Boardwalk entertainment), but this hotel is in need of an update and the service was not what I would expect from Grandbourne. Had to get a replacement refrigerator and hair dryer. Neither of the replacements worked. Found a very large bug in the room. We were awakened late one night with a room service order that wasn't ours . . .and the charge still showed up on our bill. Furnishings are in our room were definitely showing their age. Not planning to stay here again until they renovate.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can't go wrong with this hotel. If you need something ask for Marcus. He rocks!
title: Marcus Rocks!
comment: Great hotel, exceptional customer service by Marcus. Room is spacious and relatively clean. Restaurant is nice and the servers are great. Always check up on you while in the facility. The hotel ran out of towels in the pools and the cabana. We waited 2 hours for the towels to delivered other than that our stay at this hotel is nearly perfect.

title: excellent staff
comment: The staff uniformly, but especially the folks who park cars and the bell staff were excellent-friendly, competent and without a "tip me or else" attitude. They helped deal with an unfortunate elevator breakdown that lasted throughout the holiday weekend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice and conveniently located utilized the shuttle service
title: Great Location Stay Here
comment: My kids and I stayed at the Walt Disney resort and we had a great time. The resort is very nice, very family/single/kid friendly. My kids enjoyed the pool and the game room. The shuttle buses were on time, I like that you can hop on the shuttle to Downtown Disney for a day/night of fun and to Disney. Conveniently located to other restaurants on 192 if you chose not to on the resort. I will be staying here for upcoming trips.

title: An awesome experience
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir while attending Dragon*Con and have to commend the staff for handling tens of thousands of visitors over Labor Day weekend with aplomb. Everyone on staff with which we interacted were fabulous and upbeat, even at two in the morning. According to my wife we are not allowed to stay anywhere else while in Atlanta. Thanks for a great experience. Keep up the awesome work!

title: great location-friendly staff
comment: This was a very friendly, clean hotel. The location was very convenient from all points of interest and the conference facilities were good. {would have been nice to be able to order something other than Starbuck's Coffee, though}

title: Missing the Club Room Amenities
comment: I have always loved the Belvoir on 7th! I stay there every time I am in the city which is usually 3-4 times per year. I have always had a good experience, the staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating particularly Mohammed and Tomas and the ladies that work the bar in the evenings in the Club Room. I am, however, extremely disappointed that the Club Room Amenities have been so reduced as I discovered on my last stay, this past Labor Day weekend. Bring back the selection of fresh fruit in the mornings, the hot appetizers, potato chips and cookies in the evening!

everyoneShouldKnow: Good value for price and location
title: Mission
comment: A rough start- my rez was for Bay tower. Checked in, was given room keys and sent to 8th floor with whole family-but I was given room in Marina tower and not told this. Agent was clueless at first, then told me we had to stay at Marina tower, b/c Bay would be closed on our last day. Had to reload car-onto Marina to unload again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Belvoir was so upscale. This wouldn't be expected being in what appears to be such a small area
title: Splendid
comment: On Labor Day [YEAR-0], I flew into Roanoke Regional Airport, which by my surprise was a small airport. It only had 6 gates. Coming from Atlanta, I thought every airport in the USA would be congested, but not this one. I arrived at the exit doors in a jiffy. I called the Belvoir for the shuttle as I was instructed to do upon arrival to the airport. I was told to go to door 4. Too my surprise the shuttle was already there waiting. I was very impressed with Mr. Fox.

title: Excellent services
comment: Quality service and excellent attention todetail regarding customer service..

title: Very classy hotel
comment: My family and I had a terrific stay at the Belvoir in Atlantic City. The Belvoir is one of the few high-quality locations there that are not ugly or cheesy. Everything seemed elegant and well-run. The beds were especially comfortable. We would definitely return to this property.

title: Enjoyed the view, but . . .
comment: Extra for parking (which was confusing and we ended up over paying), extra for wifi, changed tower w/o notice which made check in confusing, just not very welcoming overall.

title: Excellent Service
comment: The staff was courteous, well informed, and helpful. Maid service provided extra towels and sent up fruit & cheese trays which my twin 8 year girls loved. My family was visiting DC to tour the museums and this location was less than 1 block from the Metro as well as the restaurant and shopping area. The concierge was well informed and helped us find our way around DC & the Arlington area. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families vacationing in DC.

title: Pleasant surprise
comment: Hotel far exceeded the 2 star rating. Bed was very comfortable, staff was extremely helpful and friendly.

title: Great staff
comment: One of the most delightful stays I've ever had. The staff was warm, friendly, and very professinal. All had a "what can I do to help" attitude. I was given an upgrade on request, allowed to use the business center AFTER I had checked out, and was given printed directions to my destination by the front desk, when my GPS malfunctioned.

title: Lovely and pleasant hotel.
comment: We have stayed in many Belvoirs in different places and found this one tops the list. Beautiful location and facilities. Greeted warmly by the desk person and later, though he was the one who also handled the coffee and snacks, took time with us to answer questions. He was courteous and pleasant. The greetings and courtesy were repeated by the a.m. clerk, the maid, and the workman we saw.

title: atl airport
comment: Everything was great the room had a strange smell.

title: This hotel exceeded my expectations
comment: We had the most wonderful experience.

title: good base for exploring
comment: room was fine, comfortable bed, lots of towels and pillows, but kitchen was "being renovated" - breakfast was a small boring tasteless buffet. And 18% servidce charge tacked onto the bill. Cold eggs covered with cheese (my daughter is lactose intoleranbt), half-empty fruit platter which was not refilled until we were leaving, minimal choice of bread. Portland is known as a foodie heaven and this was a stark contrast to the rest of the food we were eating on our trip. Very disappointitng to have to start a day this way.

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure to get a room on the side with reception. The other side seemed more removed.
title: Perfect South Shore Location
comment: The hotel is perfectly located on the beach with easy walking distance to other hotels and 2 shopping centers. We got upgraded to a room that looked out to the pool and beach, due to my platinum status. Favorite part of the room was opening the door to the balcony and hear the the waves crash. Bathrooms were okay, showers were still a bit outdated, but overall good hotel with a perfect location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very comfortable beds and great staff. Very clean rooms and the club floor is excellent.
title: Friendly staff
comment: I love this hotel. I have stayed here several times now and each and every time the staff make you feel welcome and so friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: great restaurant staff and lunch selections
title: Nice experience
comment: Great restaurant staff and food. Front desk not quite up to par. Check-in forgot to stamp parking, caught by check-out staff. But then did not apply credit voucher as part of stay - somewhat argumentative. Follow-up bill which was e-mailed corrected it.

title: ddressed problemsolved a problem
comment: Visit began ominously with forty minute wait to check on. Long line at start of labor day weekend and only one (and sometime a second) person to check in. Spoke with Grandbourne representative who connected me to yolanda of hotel managemeny who explained that hurricane isaac had made it difficult for employees to return to work and that they were shortstaffed. Also we saw that there had been water aeepage that affecyed some rooms. She then proceeded to offer us breakfast daily and evening happy hour and Grandbourne offered us bonus points.. i appreciate how well they handled a difficult situation.

title: The Best weekend stay ever !
comment: This is the second time that stay at this wonderful resort, the hotel staff is great, very friendly and always aware of your immediate needs, from the moment that I arrived, to the check-out time. Due to some inconveniences that I experienced during my stay, the nice FD clerk gave us 2 Breakfast vouchers to make us forget them

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel pool is not as nice as the picture appears online.
title: OKAY stay...
comment: Would have been nice when booking this hotel to know that not only was there a convention going on but college fans from another state would be staying here. This hotel was BUSY.. parking was ridiculous we had to park a ways away. Even though I requested an early checkin and was advised the day before by a staff member of the hotel that I could come a few hours early that they should be able to accomadate me, what they meant when I checked in was they were willing to put me in a less suitable room although I paid for a larger suite. They were not even going to refund any money to me if they put me in a smaller room... that surely doesnt sound right?!?! Also after 3 requests for a refrigerator we finally got one sometime between 7pm and 1pm (reminding you I checked in at 3), which meant the medicine we needed to put in there had to be kept in the ice bucket. Also upon arrival, we had to unload all of our belongings and pushed our luggage on the cart ourselves. It wasnt until we reached the elevators a staff member notivced and helped us. Dont plan on sleeping on the pull out sofa either, because if you are like us there wont be any sheets available when you call down and request them nor pillows. About an hour before bedtime we finally received 2 comforters.

title: Location!
comment: The location is awesome. Right in the middle of what is happening. Views are incomparable! Food is outstanding!

title: $20 a night to park...
comment: Came in late and tired. Drove into parking garage and was informed it was $20 a night to self park! What a surprise. Too tired to fight about it. Got to room, tired and thirsty, note on bottled water advised it was $2.00 a bottle! No map of facility in room indicating where soda/ice machines could be located; or anything else for that matter. Entered bathroom to take a shower and realized that the lock on the bathroom door was on the wrong side! Good thing I didn't have small children in the room that could have locked me in the bathroom, major safety hazard. Guess after the $20 a night parking shock I couldn't find a lot good about this hotel. Oh, and let's not forget about the $15 continental breakfast...give me a break.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have an issue all you have to do is ask for help and it will be handled quickly and with a smile.
title: Just perfect!
comment: Room was very comfortble and very clean, everyone was very welcoming and cheerful as well as ready to help with any little issue we had. There was only one blip when we found our room key was programmed for one day instead of three but it was handled quickly and efficiently. The hotel is logisticlly positioned perfecty for all activities - we cannot wait to go back!

title: Best Staff!
comment: We stay here a lot & staff is always great. Rooms are all suites & have great beds.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good ambiance, clean and nice room, friendly staff and close to the main attraction in Santa Monica.
title: Very Convenient and Nice Geataway
comment: The room is small but very nice, heavenly bed and welcoming. We got accomodated for a free water bottle in replacement of the coffee for the 1st day and a free valet parking on our 2nd day of stay since the the self parking is full. Great Staff! LA is now on my getaway list.

everyoneShouldKnow: You have to pay to park...........
title: Wonderful Front Desk Staff/Wait Staff
comment: I would recommend this hotel, however I would suggest having management look in the room prior to going to the room. I found hairs in the tub and was told by the housekeeper that it was not there prior to me opening the door....Richard (front desk) and Maurice (supervisor) were very accomodating and understanding and rectified the situation wonderfully.

title: Disappointing!!! Attention Grandbourne!!!
comment: We booked 3 months ahead, used thousands of additional points to upgrade to a Club level 2Q+sleeper suite and arrive to find they'd given us standard 2Q room. Ashley(desk clerk) tried, but found all comparable rooms unavailable. Finally agree to a K+sleeper(1 child now staying elsewhere w/friends instead). Room condition poor-multiple stains on carpet and furniture, sink drain handle missing(non-functional stopper), door lock latch was completely missing.. Ashley graciously compt us parking and a battered old refrigerator(no shelves or bars on door). Why doesn't Club Room serve bottled H20, just sodas?

title: Great Location Good Value
comment: Kids really enjoyed the pool - could clearly tell some updates had been done but much of the decor appears cheap and sheets and towels appeared clean but stained - room service was TERRIBLE - but staff were friendly and helpful

title: Parking
comment: We left Sunday at about 4:45pm and had to pay $32.00 - $24,00 for the overnight and $8.00 for the extra 45 minutes. This amount of money is beyond ridiculous!!! Since we had 2 rooms and 2 cars, that was a total of $64.00 for an overnight stay - not sure we'll be back

everyoneShouldKnow: You will not be treated as a BPG Platinum guest, you should be happy if the staff notice you are there
title: This hotel was a disappointment
comment: I am a BPG Platinum memeber, but was not treated as this:

title: Both staff and facilities were excellent.
comment: We found the room to be as advertised (excellent) but the hotel restaurant server made our stay special. He went out of his way to ensure we were enjoying our evening.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is a good value but sadly did not recognize me as a Grandbourne Preferred Guest and couldn't find me in the system. Oddly, they could only find me in the system to send me an email to fill out this review but NOT at check in.
title: Good but A bit out of the Thick of things
comment: The hotel has a scenic location, the rooms are clean, the food is ok, they have on ok pub, and a really nice pool area. The only downside (but could be upside too depending on your preference) is that this hotel is further away than the "hot spots" so one needs to find transportation if you are looking for a more action oriented area. For some, the quiet is nice. I like both.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is incompetent and not truthful, put charges on my account that I didn't authorize and they said at that time it was a mistake and it was taken cared of. But it wasn't and then the office manager won't take time to fix it because she was talking to a hotel guest (although she told me she was researching my account.)
title: This hotel is sub-par
comment: I was billed for something I did not purchase. Hotel said it was taken cared of and no charge to my amex was done. Come to find it, the charge went to my amex. I called the hotel and the office manager on duty on 9/7/12 around 5pm said she would put me on hold while she access my info. I was on hold FOREVER, come to find out she wasn't checking my account but speaking to a hotel guest. She wasn't being truthful to me. They put me on hold some more because obviously I am less important than a current hotel guest. I got tired of waiting and finally contacted my amex. Also, during our stay, the silverware and dinnerware at the club lounge were not clean. And the gentleman in charge was very aloof. The lady who was on duty on the Monday we checked out was very very friendly and accommodating - things you expect at a minimum in any Belvoir. She was the only good memory we had from this Ann Arbor hotel. Never again will we stay there.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is perfect for first time visitiors to Seattle.
title: This hotel was excellent in every way.
comment: The hotel was all we expected and more. It's location was excellent---close to all major attractions in which we were interested. The cleanliness and comfort of the rooms was wonderful. Even the make-your-own coffee in the room was delicious. The concierge was always avaliable---and the computer to obtain and print boarding passes was easily accessible. All in all, we couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience, and will gladly recommend this Belvoir Downtown Seattle.

title: Decent hotel but...
comment: My comforter wasn't clean...it looked like blood but I'm unsure. I think they only change the sheets but not the comforter... The staff was really nice about it.

title: disappointing for conference hotel
comment: air conditioning didnt work in room , bar was not open in hotel in day time . gym was barely acceptable for size of hotel

title: Outstanding Property
