comment: Great stay during the Labor Day weekend. Check-in staff was particularly top notch. Great job Belvoir Chicago!

title: Great location
comment: Hotel is in great location and nicely spread out. Rooms are clean and staff friendly. Biggest issue I had was regarding the call rates. 2 calls back to Australia for around 3 minutes each cost me over US$70!!! Robbery!!! Can't understand what the $25 a day compulsory charge covered. After this hotel I stayed at the Belvoir Waikiki whose compulsory charge covered an hour of international calls a day. Why aren't all Belvoir hotels uniform in the services they provide?!?!

everyoneShouldKnow: it is a great hotel i would recomend any one to stay
title: this hotel is a great place to stay
comment: i enjoy my stay it is a very nice hotel iam planning on coming back again the only thing i didnt like was the parking fee was to high

title: True Dump!!!! Not up to standard of Belvoir name!!
comment: My husband & I stayed here for a week for a National Convention. It was very disappointing!!! Our reservation was for a KING size bed. Instead we had 2 FULL size beds (not even Queen size beds!!!). The carpet was just plain filthy in the lobby area, halls & room! The door to our room had to be slammed or it would not close at all. Coffee packets and tolietries were refilled only twice during the week. The ice bucket bag was NEVER CHANGED!!! There was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. You could hear people in rooms on all sides of you, & above & below talking. We were on the 4th floor & you could hear music playing from the lobby starting at 2 a.m. daily!!! The bathroom toilet ran for about 5 minutes after it was flushed each time. The hallways were very warm. The lobby furniture was old & worn out. The tiny pool closed on labor day even though it was 104 out!!!!! There was no spa. The exercise equipment was great except it faced a painted over window. The food was over priced. No microwave or refrigerator in room. TV reception was spotty. Internet did not work. Free water was available in the lobby only a few times. The location was good. The pillows were great!

everyoneShouldKnow: Find another hotel to stay in!
title: Subpar experience
comment: From start to finish I was underwhelmed by this particular hotel. First off, the room was fine, but I really disliked how the beds were made. There's a fleece lining underneath the sheet that made the mattress surface lumpy and uncomfortable. On the plus side, the pillows were nice.

title: not worth the money
comment: no review, just wasn't worth the money

everyoneShouldKnow: so much to do and experience - 1 week is usually not enough.
title: covers the spectrum!
comment: WHPass Resort & Spa continues to bring us back, multiple times a year, mainly due to having such a variety of things to do (Rawhide, Casino, Boat Rides, Horseback Riding, 2 Golf Course, Great [and secluded] Spa Facility, Cool Pools, Best Kidz-Klub in the Valley "Adventure Club", Last of the Best 5-Star dinning experiences in the State "KAI", practical and fun onsite shopping, library, coffee shop, awesome live music, and some fantastic people [talent] that create a unique experience for us as a couple, a family or a group retreat! )

title: our stay was awesome
comment: Wonderful location, great staff always available and professional, breathless city view from our corner room at the 37th floor

title: Traffic
comment: I would only recommend this hotel if there was a room available in the interior. Facing the pool. Our room was facing the street and parking lot and we heard the traffic and maintenance crew all night long. The walls were paper thin. So we heard our neighbors all night long too. The neighbors alarm went off at 6 a.m. and woke us up too.

title: Great hotel!
comment: Very clean and modern. Hotel staff is Rey helpful. My favorite in Houston!

title: Wonderful!!!
comment: Couldn't have been better. GREAT location, easy access. We will go back and stay!!! BPG member but have not recieved any paperwork?

title: Great comfort in Times Square
comment: Great location, renovated comfortable rooms, helpful and smiling staff.

title: Pastor
comment: Was charge for parking and dinner on my bill that i'm still waiting back from accounting department on!

title: Very disappointed!
comment: Did not meet our needs. Family reunion - Belvoir was supposed to block rooms - all on the same floor - but did not. We had to put up with nasty guests that were annoyed by the noise. This could have been avoided. Children make noise! Especially when they haven't seen each other for a long time. Very disappointed.

title: OK only
comment: Broken ice machine. Crying baby next door. No pool since they were remodeling the exercise area. Endless elevator waits. No apology. No recognition of BPG status.

everyoneShouldKnow: The in-house store has excellent selection (including Starbucks) excellent restaurant (breakfast/lunch) excellent proximity to Disneyland and other restaurants.
title: Comfortable relaxing environment
comment: The facility has a very comfortable relaxing ambiance. The garden/pool side rooms looking over lush landscaping made me feel I was in Hawaii. The bed, pillows and bedding are first class. The Fitness Center has deluxe equipment in a contemporary ultra clean space large enough to accommodate many users.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location for exploring and wandering is ideal.
title: Great Place to Stay in Cambridge
comment: I would likely have never foudn this gem if Boston hotels hadn't been sold out. A friend and I were stopping in Boston on the way back from other New England travel and couldn't find a room in Boston but got a room here. We were very happy when we saw the beautiful hotel! It is in a wonderful location and allowed us to do a lot of exploring around the local area. It is also very close to a Red Line stop so we could go over to Beacon Hill with no problem. The staff was friendly and we had no problems during out stay. The only thing is the elevator is REALLY small...like a closet. That was a little nerver wracking but certainly won't deter me from staying here again.

title: Cheap deceptive practices
comment: They have 2 water bottles in a room with a free sign on one but no sign of $3.81 on the 2nd one. The guest end up thinking that they are free and you get an unexpected charge of $ 3.81 on ur card. I really disliked this deceptive practice of charging $3.81 for 2nd bottle to innocent guests.

everyoneShouldKnow: The fire alarm was triggered twice by other guests. The hotel made a small adjustment to the cost for the inconvienence of being woken up in the middle of the night.
title: Very nice hotel.
comment: The hotel and meeting rooms were very suited to the size confernce that I attended (380 attendees +/-). The sleeping rooms were very close to the conference meeting rooms and this allowed for trips back to the sleeping rooms in between events. The roof top swimimng pool was another awesome feature.

everyoneShouldKnow: Use the shuttle to go to and from downtown. Great service and Ed is the best driver you could ever have. Book the shuttle early as it fills up early at the sunset hours.
title: Another Fabulous Week At The Belvoir Key West
comment: We have been coming here for many, many years and keep coming back. The facility and the staff are A1. If you want laid back, relaxed and no strain this is the place to stay on the "quiet" side of the island. These folks know how to run a resort area hotel and they know how to treat their customer. Thanks Belvoir Key West, see you in a few months.

everyoneShouldKnow: not a bad place to stay for the price.
title: indoor pool and hot tub a great plus
comment: great staff, just had a very slight disappointment when calling earlier for an early check in, said it was ok but did not acknowledge when we were there. but no biggie.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful decor, nice bar in the lobby, friendly staff, comfortable bed!
title: Excellent stay, too short
comment: I stayed here after driving cross country in a 26 foot truck with my daughter. The night before my flight home I stayed here, my other choice was the floor of my daughter's apartment! I had a wonderful king sized bed in a large room with a patio that led out to the pool area. The bed was extremely comfortable had a great night's sleep. I'm only sorry I couldn't stay longer to enjoy the amenities available.

title: Taste of Colorado Perfect
comment: We stayed at this location every Labor day for the past seven years because the views are wonderful and the location to the festival is phenomenal. Plus, the bar has an excellent happy hour!

everyoneShouldKnow: THE FRIENDLINESS OF ALL THE STAFF
title: BEST HOTEL EVER...
comment: FOR THE LAST 7 YEARS EVERYTIME WE TAKE A FAMILY VACATION TO HAWAII, WE ALWAYS STAY AT THE Belvoir WAIKIKI...THERE'S NO OTHER PLACE.. ALL THE STAFF STARTING FROM THE TO ARE VERY FRIENDLY AND REALLY GIVES YOU THE ALOHA SPIRIT.. THANK YOU SO MUCH AND SEE ALL OF YOU VERY VERY SOON....

title: cleanliness
comment: The hotel has a very fresh and clean appearance. The room was warm and inviting.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to be near Disney, but not overtaken by Disney
title: GG Belvoir inept staffer
comment: I have stayed here before and excellent service, but this trip room and facilities were great but the desk staff was inadequate, they could not give me the room requested "near the elevators", but The staffer told me that the room I was in was just a 'few doors' from the elevator. I actuality it was 11 doors away, but with a bum leg the extra distance is painfull, especially when you go to pool, then dinner, then to Disney, etc. The staffer needs to take a basic math course and map reading course s

everyoneShouldKnow: Executive rooms are worth the upgrade
title: Executive Bldg Rooms are great
comment: We got an upgraded room for 8,000 points a night and it was great. It had a mini-kitchen with fridge and microwave. It also had a separate sitting area that made it easy to put the kids to bed and still enjoy some light!

everyoneShouldKnow: You definently need a car, and it's a far walk anywhere.
title: I said I wouldn't recommend it, and I won't
comment: My biggest issue is the total LACK of management contact. I've left a phone message and sent the GM 2 emails about the sewage smell that occurs throughout the day. Additionally, the housekeeping is poor, and room was dirty, including a pair of kids socks left under the ottoman, that house keeping missed. There is a spider web in one corner that is huge. Further, there are A LOT of mosquitos in the room. We kill 20-30 a day, and are not opening the doors. The seem to get in another way.

title: Wonderful Beds
comment: This hotel was clean, nice, great room, wonderful beds, and great pillows. I really enjoyed our stay here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not expect an privacy in your room.
title: House Keeping
comment: Housekeeping proceeded to let themselves in my room at 9AM while the do not disturb sign was on the door. If I had not used the inside security lock, the maid would have found me getting dressed.

title: Wifi
comment: When is Grandbourne and Belvoir going to stop charging for wifi. Makes you uncompetitive.

title: Lovely & well-located
comment: Very pleasant & helpful staff, very well-located close to Universities & other amenities.

title: Rough start !
comment: Worst checkin ever at a GOLD desk.

title: Very Bad Experience
comment: I never got a chance even to get in my room.. After two and a half hours of being told that the room was not clean. Obviously you hotel overbooked for the Labor day weekend. I am extremely dissatisfied and will find other accomadations in the future. I do hope that my credit card was not charged in any way. I am a senior citizen, with poor health and I am disabled. I am a retired teacher with the Board of Education. I have served my students ,my school and community for almost thirty years, and think I deserve some respect rather than what I received from your manager.

title: Outstanding Stay
comment: We had the pleasure of staying at the Belvoir Sunnyvale while we were playing in a baseball tournament at Twin Creeks. The room was clean, the buffet breakfast was good, and the service was friendly.

title: Details
comment: Missing wash clothes and toilet paper. Had to go to the front desk and pick up becasue we didn't want anyone entering our room. Food service was a plus. Evedrything is getting old looking and in need of repair.

title: Love this place!!!
comment: This was our second visit to Belvoir Keauhou...and we LOVE it! With a 2 and 10 yr old, the pool is our landing spot for our stay. The vast size and various stages of the pool accomodate every swimmer's ability. With a special Kama'aina rate and BPG privileges, this is the perfect weekend STAYCATION. We're certain to be back soon...and are sure to tell everyone about the perfect getaway spot!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff has a bad attitude about service.
title: Loyal Disappointment
comment: Diane, I always stay with you when visiting my daughter but I have to say that this may be the last time. I was relieved to see that the renovation was almost complete but the staff and service that I did not receive made this visit very unpleasant. My room was not cleaned until the third day even after I inquired, I was told that your hotel was out of regular coffee by someone with little english skills and they would not provide me with any so I had to purchase coffee and the overall atmosphere was rudeness. I don't know what has happened there but I did not enjoy my stay.

title: Excellent Customer Service
comment: The staff was very helpfull and professional - from the front desk at check-in, to the waitress at the breakfast buffet, to the bellman who gave us driving instructings to Temple Square, I reccomend anyone going to Salt Lake to stay at the Belvoir.

title: Not what you would expect from a Belvoir!
comment: Run down! Nice lobby area but the hallways are terrible and they stink! Room is okay but bathroom is disgusting! Bed is okay but that's about it! Tub drain is missing and has a big glob of hair in it and drains too slow! We will wait and shower at home! Can't complain about the price because we used our BPG points! Waste of 3000 BPG points! Worst Grandbourne property we have ever stayed at!

title: Great Hotel
comment: Had a great stay at this hotel. Thought I would only be one night, needed a second night. The staff was great in securing that. Rooms are very comfortable, and the location was very convienient.

title: Great service and value.
comment: This hotel is very comfortable, and the staff is very very helpful. When sttaying her, I was recovering from a fractured bone in my foot and was therefore in a boot and on crutuches. The staff was very helpful throughout my stay, and I didn't have any problems.

title: Hotel has a great location
comment: Nice Facility. The room was nice, but the bathroom was way to small and cramped.

title: Great hotel
comment: This is a fantastic hotel that is affordable yet luxurious. It is also in walking distance of Disney Land which was very important for us. I highly recommend and will return to the Belvoir on our next visit to Anaheim. We had been traveling for two weeks in california when we arrived and the Belvoir had first decent bed so we could get a good night sleep.

title: beautiful hotel
comment: The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Harvard square, so location is excellent. The hotel is exactly what one would expect from Belvoir...immaculate and excellent service. The beds are exceptionally comfortable.Rooms are spacious enough for a roll-away. The fitness center is well equipped.

title: Nice business hotel
comment: We stayed here 9/5/[YEAR-0]. First on the 10th then the 7th floor. Lobby is attractive.  Check-in staff polite and attentive.  Although located in the suburbs (Overland Park KS), the hotel had a sophisticated city vibe. It is showing its age slightly, but is well maintained and clean. Rooms are attractive, well lit and roomy. Bathroom was well lit and had a nice shower head with multiple settings and strong pressure.

title: Terrible Service
comment: On arrival I had a very unpleasant experience with the parking staff, & when I complained on registration, both the front desk clerk & then the front desk manager failed to take any responsibility, stating merely that the parking valets did not work for them, in spite of the fact that I was paying the hotel for the parking. The general manager was supposed to call me but never did. They appear not to realize that this is essentially a service industry. This initial experience soured my entire stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Personal service is a winner in this big hotel.
title: Excellent Service
comment: Even though there were many events at the hotel, parking was easy, the staff was attentive and the room was fantastic.

everyoneShouldKnow: They're going to hit you hard for self parking. Downtown Indy just ISN'T that crowded.
title: Great Hotel- Expensive (For Indy) parking
comment: A group of colleagues and I stayed at the Belvoir City Centre hotel for two days in early September, [YEAR-0]. We found the lodgings to be convenient and comfortable, although the $25 per day self parking charge seemed a little excessive for Indianapolis.

everyoneShouldKnow: Major need for rennovation-- planned but many months from completion.
title: Frequent Visitor
comment: The experience is always good thanks to the staff. The hotel itself needs major rennovation-- planned but not started yet. Elevators are a real problem-- at least one out of service every time. Convenience is the main reason that I stay there.

title: Great Location
comment: Sits at the edge of the Country Club Plaza, so it is easy to walk to great food & shopping. It was a surprise to have a couple of towels that had such ragged edges - clean, but really sad looking.

title: Two people in my room with the bolt on?
comment: I checked in a 4 pm. I went to my room and the inside bolt was on. There was a man and a woman in my room with the bolt on.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location (off highway near airport). Solid staff always helpful and friendly
title: Realiable stay and value
comment: Always freindly staff, willing to assist. Starting from the check-in to the staff at the restuarant Shula's and check-out. Willing to accomidate my requests in a polite and professional manner regardless what time I check in.

title: NOT Belvoir
comment: Below my Expectations.Rooms are old and the reception is not professional.

title: Great Service for Breakfast
comment: Barbara was my server for breakfast during a recent stay. I was in a hurry to get in and out. I also ordered an omelet to go. She made sure that my breakfast was served quickly and my to go order was hot and ready to go just in time. She made sure that everything I needed was there. Not only was she a joy she was very professional. What a great asset to your team.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fine for guest just passing through. Problems for large conferences
title: Adequate
comment: Hotel is adequate for small numbers of guests just passing through, but not so good for conferences. Serious lack of readiness in main dining room. Staff unwilling to seat guests even thought seating available "because kitchen is behind." Multiple latches non-functional in ladies rooms near meeting areas. .

everyoneShouldKnow: Food and beverage staff is unprofessional
title: English
comment: When I visited the club lounge for breakfasts I saw 2 ladies running around like school girls running in and out of the kitchen door one approached me and asked if I needed any thing I said no then she giggled and turned and ran off talking in Spanish to her friend and laughing , then from time to time they would pop out from behind the door laughing out loud talking in Spanish then run around the club I'm not shure if they where making fun of us in the club but I know they speak English I heard them the bad part was they where not even cleaning or doing there job I was very uncomfortable in there and it's not the way to start the morning , they where very childish and rude

title: Exceptional
comment: Truly exceptional experience! Room was quiet, VERY comfortable beds, and extremely clean. Wonderful staff, concierge very helpful and accurate. Valet helped with cab needs; restaurant food quality excellent, artwork on display (glasswork) was stunning! All guests should visit the Chihuly Glass Exhibit by the Space Needle! Unbelievable! I am booking a return visit to your hotel next week. Can't wait!

title: Not worth it
comment: The staff was friendly but this hotel needs a refurb. The halls look and smell dank. The rooms need an upgrade. We had to switch the first room we got because there was hair in the tub and the bed looked slept in. The beds are not the same comfy Grandbourne beds that you usually find in a Belvoir. Breakfast was included with our room and the potates tasted freezer burnt. Overall this hotel gets a thumbs down.

title: Belvoir Kauai
comment: The room was nice, but smelled a little musty. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were always clean. The huge bathtub was awesome, and we loved the double sinks! The pool area was nice, but the beach area was a bit small. The breakfast buffet was really good at Rum Fire, but we didn't care for Lava's food at all. Overall, it was a pleasant stay for a good price.

everyoneShouldKnow: How beautiful the hotel is; room is clean; and service is quick.
title: Comfortable Stay
comment: Belvoir Mahwah Hotel is a beautiful building--inside and out. Spacious parking lot. Room we had was nice and clean. When we called for extra towels service people provided to us asap--awesome! Thanks for a wonderful stay.

title: Across the bridge, but just a stone throw away from town. Excellent starting point...
comment: This Belvoir with several subway stations within a few minutes walking distance and several different lines, gives perfect and fast access to Manhattan. Besides location and connectivity, the rooms are above average in comfort en cleanliness, for sure against Ny standards. A great place to stay which I can recommend.

title: Great Location. Cozy Environment. Close to Business.
comment: Excellent location proximity to all Phoenix downtown has to offer.

everyoneShouldKnow: They charge for parking although they have so much parking space!
title: This hotel has great view
comment: The view is nice but no complimentary parking for customers.

title: Hotel met my expectations
comment: Staff was efficient. At one point, all computers were in use, and I was unable to access internet on the one I was using. Concierge let me use his.

title: Staff was awesome!
comment: Ok - it has been a couple of weeks - but still - I recall many of the names of folks that supported me to deliver 4 days of training. Mariana - pure and simple - she was exemplary - there early and what an attention to detail and her friendliness went above and beyond. Having her was an absolute delight! Many folks supported me - Janice, Anna {?}, Franklin, Miss Bobbie, and Ben. Folks were excellent and quite supportive which made a long week away from home far more productive for both myself and for all our attendees. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

title: Great Airport hotel
comment: Very pleased with this hotel. Stayed on the club level in a Pure room. Room was a great size and had a view of the golf course. Wish we arrived a little earlier from our long deive from Key West would have loved to have used more of its amenities and seen the manatees.

title: Back again
comment: Loved every minute of the three days we were there.

title: Great stay
comment: We had a great time. The staff was extremely helpful. Would stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Caveat Emptor when they try to get you to pay for an upgrade...otherwise great hotel!
title: Great Hotel but...
comment: I would love to give this hotel a 5 star rating and just based on the resort itself and the new restaurant it would receive it....however I felt like Belvoir was trying to take advantage of me at check in.

everyoneShouldKnow: From the valets, front desk and even management, they missed the class on customer service. None to be found except for 1 Bellboy on Night 4
title: On-site manager Danielle needs to go!
comment: There was so much wrong with our stay, beginning with check-in (waiting 45 minutes in line because of under-staffing), the on-site Manager D (evening of Sept 1) has NO concept of customer service, false advertising for what we get if we pre-paid, lying and telling us the manager left a message for us (housekeeper left a message), completely moving us to the 2nd tower for THEIR convenience (on our last night of a 5 night stay). I would like a call from the general manager who sent this survey. We will NEVER stay at a Belvoir again.

title: Loud trains at night; smelly elevator
comment: Platinum BPG but I don't think I got an upgraded room or was offerred one (stayed on 3rd floor, club level on 2nd).

title: Public Areas
comment: The lobby and the restaurant/lounge are beautiful!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Exceptional Service that is provided at this property. Everyone is so attentive.
title: Attentive Service
comment: From the moment I made the reservation until the moment I checked out of the hotel the service was exceptional. Great Work Reservations, Front Office & Housekeeping.

title: Double charge for the room
comment: It's being more than one week since I check in in the hotel and they double charge the room fee. I'm still waiting the cancellation of the second charge. I would never recommend that hotel.

title: PM Retired
comment: Great Service and location

title: Location is perfect
comment: - Overall maintenance/painting necessary. Several scratches on the wall, doors and elevators.

title: Excellent service and amenities.
comment: The Denver West Belvoir is conveniently located for meetings at the Federal Center. The amenities and service are excellent.

title: Imporvement needed
comment: I have stayed at the hotel a few times in the past and have seen the decreasing services year over year. The check in was awefull. No sense of urgentcy and poor communication. Felt like I was someone walking in from the street asking for a room. The hotel is very run down, there was a weird smell in my room (from smoking I think). There was no room service when I tried to order, no laundry service avail and had to go to an outside laundrymat.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poipu beach is amazing. Soft golden sand and clear water!!!
title: Beautiful hotel, excellent beach!
comment: We had a great time with my family at the Belvoir Kauai Resort. Rooms are big and clean and we were upgraded to an ocean view. By the way watching the sunset from our balcony was phenomenal! I received a free breakfast for 2 and complimentary vallet parking. A drawback is that there is no club lounge. The pool is beautiful and cabanas need to be rented if you want some shadow by the pool area. The beach is amazing and good for snorkeling. Food is overpriced in my opinion but we received a complementary discount for lunch or dinner in either restaurant. Staff is nice and attentive. Overall very good experience.

title: Beautiful renovated hotel.
comment: We had a great experience at the Belvoir Fairplex Hotel. Staff is great, very professional and attentive to all our requests. Rooms are big and clean and the club lounge offered great food selection. Late checkout was offered to us.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking is not free and the hotel will charge $100 to your account at checkin in case of incidents.
title: Great hotel, but has a few issues
comment: The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly. One issue I had was with parking, both my sister and I, as well as another guest we met up with, were under the impression that parking and the shuttle service were free. These important deals were part of the reason we chose this hotel. Much to our dismay, we arrived at the hotel and realized that we had somehow been mistaken, and while the shuttle service to Disneyland was free, parking was not. Not only was parking not free, it was $14 per night! I find this price completely unacceptable. Also, you have to take a ticket when entering that parking lot, but instead of being charged based on this ticket, the parking is charged to your room based on the number of nights you've booked. Because of this, when you leave the parking lot the gate is open and you do not have to turn your ticket in. My issue with this is that any person that is not a guest at the hotel could drive in, take a ticket, park, and then drive out for free since the gate it always open. While they can park for free, I have to pay $14 because I'm STAYING at the hotel? This, to me, is not alright. My other issue was that they took $100 out of my account without any notice at all. I understand that any hotel is going to want to have a credit card on file in case of any incidents, this is pretty standard. Which is why when I arrived at the Belvoir Anaheim and they asked for my card, I was not surprised at all. Since we had paid for our two night stay in advance, I did not expect to see any additional charges on my card. Much to my surprise, when I checked my account later that day, $100 had been taken from my account. When we returned to the hotel that evening, I asked someone at the front desk about the charge and they explained that it was for any incidents and would be returned to my account after our checkout as long as there were no damages or additional charges to the room. I can understand why they do this, my issue is that no one told me about this charge when I checked in, nor was I warned about this charge when I booked the room or in my confirmation... and yes, I did go back and check it. I just think that someone could really be in trouble if they are not planning on an additional $100 coming out of their account, and therefore the staff needs to be sure to inform the guests of this charge. Even better, the guest should be told before booking the hotel that this charge will be taken out at time of checkin. My last issue was that our toilet in our room was difficult to use. We had to flush 2-4 times every time it was used in order to get everything to go down. We decided that we could live with this, so I did not inform staff until we went to the front desk to checkout. When I informed the assistant manager that was checking us out, he only said "ok" and did not thank us or apologize for the broken toilet. He did not seem to be concerned with it at all. Other than the parking, $100 charge, and toilet, I would recommend this hotel. It it beautiful, comfortable, clean, and is the perfect distance from the park.

title: Great Property in an unexpected place
comment: Stayed here a few nights ago on a AAA rate.

everyoneShouldKnow: You should expect there to be freight trains passing by in the nigth and blowing their horns. Also, the Club Suite breakfast is only open a very limited amount of hours. 6:30-8:30. We thought it would at least be open till 9.
title: My Expectations Might Have Been Too High
comment: I was a little displeased with my stay. When booking, the staff warned me that the sound of the rushing water might be too loud (it was not) but they did NOT warn me about the train passing by and blowing it's horn a few times through the night. The jacuzzi tub was also the shower which was awkward but overall the hotel was clean and comfortable.

title: guest experience
comment: worst hotel experience in years...room key didn't work...when AI went down to get a new key there was someone already in the room...had to go down a third time to get a new room and key. no services in concierge lounge at 5:00 pm on a thursday evening...the previous time I stayed at this hotel I was overbilled...they just don't run smoothly

everyoneShouldKnow: nice hotel at a good value
title: very nice & good value
comment: Everything about the room and hotel were nice. The bed was comfortable. The room was large and nicely decorated. The staff was responsive and respectful.

title: lacks current information
comment: The concierge needs to keep current on the downtown area surroundings. I was told 2 things I wanted weren't available such as a store(which was just a few minutes walk away from hotel) & a tour. Knowing there WAS indeed a JFK bus tour.could've helped me plan my day better because I ended up missing them since the last one left at 230. I was told there wasn't such a thing when in fact a new tour started a month prior 4x a day.

title: An 'A' for effort
comment: Just returned from two separate stays, both very nice. I appreciate this Belvoir has issues - as to be expected with older, larger properties - it's clear the staff and management are dedicated to addressing them. Renovations are well under way. We stayed in the newly done fifth floor, and the room was execellent. So was the lounge. One thing we noticed is this property is very well staffed, from Front Desk to the restaurant to the pool.

title: 9/1/[YEAR-0]
comment: For being a Belvoir resort Hotel - this was one of my worst stays.

everyoneShouldKnow: Try not to book during a convention. Too many people during the evening and the convention guest are selfish and rude .
title: Dolhin experience
comment: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. we watched this hotel being built many years ago when we visited disney and we wanted to stay at the Dolphin some day. We have lived in Las Vegas and stayed at many hotels there and I was expecting a Hotel as beautiful as a hotel such as many of the hotels on the strip which would be classified as a 5 star hotel. Even though the dolphin was nice but might expectations did not get met.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is good but in an office park area.
title: Very good Belvoir, Tampa East
comment: Very good hotel with a great amenities! Highly recommend.

title: Hot and dusty
comment: When we arrived at our room the air conditioning was not working. That made staying in the room quite uncomfortable. After calling the reception a technician came within 10 minutes and after an additional 10 minutes he had fixed the problem and the room started to cool down.

everyoneShouldKnow: The comfort level is out of this world. Great place to stay.
title: This hotel is Wonderful
comment: This hotel exceeded my expectations. What a wonderful place to stay. The comfort level here is A1.

everyoneShouldKnow: The parking is really horrible so if you have bad knees you will be doing a lot of walking up and downhill.
title: The price was the cheapest
comment: Too much noise from outside (sirens and garbage/delivery trucks) and the HVAC unit was so loud in the room. Didn't get the King bed I had reserved or the free internet my company had negotiated and I wasn't recognized as a BPG member and even though the desk clerk could clearly tell I was overheated from having walked the long way from the parking lot with my bags he didn't even offer a free bottle of water even though I requested one, he said he would charge it to the room. I was disappointed this trip.

title: Wonderful, Friendly hotel staff
comment: We had a wonderful stay at the Belvoir Orlando North! The room was perfect, clean and fresh. We enjoyed a warm welcomed and can not wait to come back!

title: NICE
comment: Stayed here 3 night for on site meetings. There were 30 of us and everything was great.

title: Quality Hotel, Terrific Service
comment: The staff at this hotel are helpful and courteous. BPG recognition here is better than most. I would return to this hotel if I was in the area again.

title: great BPG option in Orlando
comment: This property is operated by BPG. This was my third time staying here and it is greatly improved from 8 years ago. Nice rooms, good food, quick service throughout the property. The only neg. was that they never answer the phone if you dial 0 and the maids beat on your door very early each door.

title: customer service lacking
comment: The air conditioning stopped working at 1 in the morning. I had to try to sleep in a hot room. I alerted the fron desk of the problem and they did nothing to make my stay better.

title: This hotel was very convenient.
comment: The staff greeted me with a professional and cordial attitude. Assisted me in getting to my destination. Very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: its just a great place with friendly service
title: Great Hotel
comment: The Hotel is great location ,one minute from airpot and 2 blocks from car rentals..

everyoneShouldKnow: Great locaton, great value for all of the ammenities available.
title: Hotel More Than Met My Expectations!
comment: This one night stay for business exceeded all of my expectations: clean, comfortable, modern, nicely appointed room. Helpful and courteous stay from valet/bellhops, concierge, to front desk personnel. A great location for business, meetings, and enjoying downtown Ft Worth and beyond.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be very careful with the gluten free options.They really do not understand the being "gluten free" and gluten friendly. I have a celiac daughter that was served a dinner with gluten. Nor do they understand cross contamination.
title: Very disappointed in this hotel
comment: I have stayed at this hotel many times. I was saddened to see that a lot of the changes were not in the best interest of the customer. I like this hotel because of it's view and peaceful tranquility. When I return to the island again, I will seek out other options.

everyoneShouldKnow: Room was musty, moldy and mildewy. No follow-up to my complaint.
title: Musty Room, no follow-up
comment: From the moment I arrived in my room, I noticed a distinct musty, almost moldy smell in my room. It was coming from the air conditioning unit. I called front desk, and they said the would send somebody up to change the A/C filter. When I came back from my day of meetings, the room had a medicinal smell, almost like Vic's Vapo Rub. The next day, the musty, moldy smell returned. Very unpleasent room. Choose a newer hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great food. Friendly and Nice Staff.
title: Great Location
comment: clean, comfortable almost like home.

title: Short but nice stay.
comment: A quick stay after a concert. accommodations were great.

title: Very good Resort
comment: The hotel is huge, well located and spacious rooms aand facilities. The service is good, very clean and everything is easy and friendely. I'll strongly recomend!

everyoneShouldKnow: 9.95 charge for internet service per day
title: Florida
comment: Great hotel, but the charge in this day and time for internet service is a deal breaker for me.........

title: Great location, great hotel
comment: A great hotel in a great location to be able to walk the windy city. Well maintained with good updates.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect for business and family travel.
title: Excellent Service
comment: The hotel staff was very pleasant and personable from the front desk to the restaurant. It is clear that they were very focused on creating a perfect guest experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful hotel, comfortable room, great views, freindly staff
title: Multiple stays, some inconveniences
comment: Nice upgraded room after writing the Hotel. During my July stay earned Gold level and on this vacation I earned Platinum level 1st night. Guest Services Laura, Amber, Precious and Johnson were great! Only issue no complimentary water left each day and water was brought up in a reasonable time. House cleaning staff were responsive to requests. Excellent view of the marina and pool area. Self parking fee is a little excessive but is well publicized and is not a surprise. Check-in, even at BPG Desk is quite long. Additional front desk staff would be ideal to get people checked-in in a timely manner instead of having a winding line through the lobby. My wife and I love the facility and plan on staying again many times since it's only a 90 minute drive from home.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for business meetings and overnight if miss flight connection
title: Great location for business reunions
comment: The hotel facilities are well equipped for business reunions from small to large groups. Rooms are good , clean and well maintained. Must improve its wifi service and telephone equipment mainly at room floors. Excellent at the business center and lobby. Staff always available to anticipate needs.

title: Friendly Staff
comment: My flight did not arrive until late and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful upon my arrival. They also secured a taxi to my destination with only 15 minutes notice! Very clean and inviting rooms. Best sleep I've had on the road!

title: Need to improve a lot
comment: This hotel is a large one, with very little service and not great with cleanliness, etc. The green initiative is great, but people eat, there should be a way, where they provide someplace to collect trash. People eat in their rooms and leave the trash outside. No one picks them up. The corridor starts smelling due to this trash there. Tried calling room service to order food. No one picked up for over 10 minutes. Reception also did not pick up. I was a platinum member, there were no information on internet. They did not enquire about or give choices of welcome gift.

title: Great care of guests
comment: It was a great to have a place to come back to each day during our business stay in Pomona CA that knows how to treat their customers and always made us feel welcome.

title: Disappointing
comment: The hotel was clean, but overall outdated and service needs improvement. My electricity on one side of the room when out (no TV, no outlets for ironing, etc.) and it took an hour to fix it. I was not offered a discount or even an apology even though I had to go downstairs to the front desk twice.

everyoneShouldKnow: This Hotel is an excellent hotel and the staff is very accomodating
title: Uss Ly Spear AS 36 Reunion
comment: Great Hotel Excellent Staff

everyoneShouldKnow: If your comming to a hotel to sleep and away from the craziness on the board walk and casinos its perfect!
title: Great Location and amenities
comment: The rooms are pretty clean but needs to be updated a little more even tho i had the delux room and the bath sink needs to be fix makes a loud noise like horns are being blown when turned on just a little. I loved the beds which was the most important reason for taking a room. They were like sleeping on clouds. I really disliked how early the cleaning staff come around one day at 6:30 in the morning!

title: Wonderful bed and friendly staff
comment: We loved staying here. After enjoying the room and staff, be sure to walk around the Falls area -- one of the awesome creations of God!

title: GUNTER Room 620
comment: Great Room and view...WE didn't seeeee anything! Slept like a baby. Close to everything. We will recommend to friends and family. See you in the future. Remember the GUNTER!

everyoneShouldKnow: That this hotel has access to computers and a printer
title: This hotel is great for conventions
comment: I was able to make my revisions without bothering my roommate by going down to the business center until 2 am. It was very helpfull.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are lots of conventions here so if you don't want to be part of a convention you may want to trip somewhere else.
title: OK but needs some improvement
comment: I've stayed at this swan and dolphin over the years and I find it to be an average experience. This is mostly due to the high volume of visitors to the hotel. On this trip, I did check in fast on the BPG line but the keys didn't work after 2 attempts. I was told to meet an engineer who could not get into the room so after a lost of 40 minutes back and forth I was moved to another room. Also, late checkout at this hotel is 12PM not 4PM which you get if you are gold or higher. So you only get an extra hour which didn't help me either.

everyoneShouldKnow: The airport is very close but there is still ample room to relax and enjoy the surroundings.
title: Beautiful location and convenient!
comment: This is the second time I have stayed at this Belvoir. Happily I had the opportunity to use the pool this visit and there are actually several pools which is nice. The grounds are very pretty and it is enjoyable to walk around the marina paths. I also enjoyed the updated fitness room, it had everything I needed. Downtown is 10 minutes away,, the airport even closer.

everyoneShouldKnow: simply a great hotel for location, comfort, cleanliness and affordability
title: This hotel was nearly perfect
comment: Fantastic location - it is a small stroll up to Central Park and a brief walk to the heart of times Square - with plenty to see in between - and all those deli's, pastry shops and pizza places!!! you'll want and need to walk <smiles> the room size was larger than I expected, with a full bath, table with two chairs, awesome flat screen TV, but who really goes to NYC to watch TV?? plenty of room for one and enough for two ( I had the traditional king room) very clean, and the cleaning staff were extremely friendly and helpful. One of the best nights sleep too on a great bed. The Belvoir is my new favorite place to stay when in NYC and is very reasonably priced - close to the subway too (N/R lines) - but shop around and you'll come back to reserve here and NOT by one of those "discount" websites but direct worked far better - This hotel should be booked solid every night! P.S. I was NOT paid to write this recommendation... I did my homework and I am very fussy and a perfectionist - Thank you for providing a great hotel in a great city

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to all amenities, Restaurants, vineyards, perfect place for a vacation stay!
title: Vineyard & Wineries
comment: excellent ! Easy access to restaurants vineyards and outlets!!!!!!

title: Excellent Hotel in Downtown Philly
comment: The staff at this hotel were very professional and very helpful. I was thoroughly satisfied with this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Belvoir Boston is weak on customer service.
title: Customer Satisfaction v. Making a Quick Buck
comment: In my recent stay at your hotel, I paid the additional money for wifi access. I was there on business and had a rather sizable amount of work to do. I was very disappointed to learn that the wifi I was paying for was only available in my guest room. The trade show I was attending took place largely in the ballroom, so I needed to gain access to the locked wifi in that area of the hotel. When I approached the concierge, she was icy at best and said I would need to speak with someone at the registration desk. I patiently waited in the registration line for twenty minutes, and when I finally was able to speak with someone, he stated that I couldn't gain access to the wifi (despite my offer to pay an additional fee) because the trade show organizers hadn't purchased it. He suggested I speak with the hotel's event coordinator - however that person wouldn't be back in the office until after the trade show was over. I am deeply disappointed in your hotel's policy and weak customer service. I have suggested that the event move to another, more customer-centric venue in the future.

title: location location location
comment: I stay at this hotel once a month. Fantastic hotel with a Great location and very good staff both at reception as well as club lounge.

title: Food needs work
comment: I had lunch once, breakfast twice at the hotel and room service one night and all I have to say is that the food was very disappointing. Especially the breakfast buffet. The waffles were hard as rock, the eggs tasteless and the coffee undrinkable.

title: I love this resort!
comment: This is a fabulous resort that I cannot say enough about. The rooms are extremely comfortable and quiet. However, I do wish that they had refrigerators in the rooms. I love that they pipe Native American music throughout the property. It is so soothing and pretty. The staff has always been more than accomodating and seem to genuinely care about their guest's needs. It is also located near numerous shopping and dining choices. I can't wait until the next time I can stay here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Take the Disney shuttles from across the street!
title: Good Hotel - Great Location
comment: My wife, 4-yr old son, and I stayed 3 nights in a room with 2 queen beds on BPG points. The room was VERY clean. I've been Gold for 3 years and was upgraded to a high floor (11th floor is the highest without getting on the upper two floors - for Club Level only). I requested a suite (willing to pay extra) but they only have 4 suites and are held for Platinum members (what the front test told me). I was not offered the Club floor or access to the Club Lounge. I didn't ask for the floor or Lounge because of earlier reviews of less-than-awesomeness on the Lounge. I was a little disappointed an upgrade to the Club Level (either complimentary or by paying) was not offered.

title: Above & Beyond
comment: The staff in this hotel was excellent! I had excellent service at the reception desk upon my arrival and all of my requests were granted with the exception of a room with a view.....there weren't any available. However, there was one individual that stood out above the rest, the Front Desk Bell Captain whom worked 1st shift provided so much insight on getting around the city....what to do, where to go, how to get there. He was just AWESOME! He helped my husband and I create memories for our 4th wedding anniversary that we'll never forget.

title: Great location
comment: Very nice hotel, clean, and in a great area. Definitely met my expectations for comfort and relaxation during a business trip. Only disappointment was after my departure - I left my electric shaver behind and have called 4 or 5 times, but have not gotten a return call. Other than that, no complaints at all. Great place to stay.

title: I like the location of this hotel.
comment: We had trouble with the cooling system. It was

everyoneShouldKnow: nice friendly hotel with great transpotation to Disneyland
title: great hotel
comment: Love this hotel! Great shuttle service to Disneyland. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The poolside rooms are my favorite. Parking is good. I would recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service staff is very friendly.
title: Website images not comparable w/facilty
comment: Staff was friendly, but accomodations were disappointing when compared to how wonderful everything looked on the website. Suite did not have a fireplace as advertised.

title: Noisy corridor
comment: I was pleased with this hotel during a recent business trip. The only complaint I have is the door to my room was misaligned and had a large gap under the door which let in hallway noise. I had to use a towel under the door muffle the noise.

title: Could not have asked for anything more
comment: We stayed in a double double and both beds were large and oh, so comfortable. If you like pillows, 4 each and even more in closet. Nice to have separate living area to just relax. Very clean and quiet. Hotel staff were exceptionally polite and curteous. Very nice breakfast buffet and we did the fair package, just steps from hotel to entrance. Was second time and will do again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to disneyland, resturants, and shopping.
title: Nice, Clean
comment: Staff was friendly, room was clean. Had a little problem with housekeeping leaving enough towels for 4 people. Front desk personnel very accomodating willing to resolve towel issue quickly. Carpet was damp and sticky when we arrived.

title: Good suburban hotel
comment: Good view of downtown denver city scape. Every worker I passed said hi (I love how friendly mid western American are.

title: Great place to stay
comment: We were pleased with everything about the hotel except the dining room. Of course, with all of the opportunities to eat around the hotel, i can see why it is not top priority. From the reception staff, to maintenance, to the room maintenance we were pleased. The LINK cafe staff was friendly and attentive. Thanks for a nice stay! It will be one the top os our list to return.

title: Very accommodating and helpful.
comment: Hotel was very convenitent for the hospital where wh have loved one. The service was great, the shuttle very helpful. Very comfortable beds and good sized rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms have been given a "face lift."
title: Face lift
comment: It's been years since I was last at this Belvoir. The improvements are remarkable. I do think that that rooms are still a little small, especially considering the size of the bed (which, by the way, was very comfortable). I will look forward to my next stay--and hopefully a larger room.

title: this hotel is very peacful
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at the Belvoir the room with the patio facing the pool is very peacefull and relaxing.

title: traveler
comment: My profile asks that when a room is reserved it should be near an elevator and at a low floor.....i was put on the 10th floor and about a mile from the elevator.....that is certainly not a good impression for being the first time i stayed at your hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk staff was very unprofessional which made for a bad experience right off the back
title: I was very disappointed
comment: Arrived late after a very long and very stressful week. We just wanted to get away from the kids and relax and enjoy a nice quiet evening. Night supervisor was not very friendly, engaging nor helpful. The last thing I needed was someone with more attitude! Got to room and went to close the curtain and there was mold on the wall from all the condensation from the AC. I literally had to scrubbed the shower before we could use it.

title: Love love love
comment: I love this hotel. The beds were great and comfortable. They just hugged u all night :). It was amazing. My family truly enjoyed their time here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service and value at buffet breakfast
title: great service!
comment: The hotel has just finished renovations and the property looks great! The buffet breakfast was good value....and excellent service each morning! All staff were friendly when you passed them as moving around property. Great idea to host yoga each morning overlooking the stunning ocean views! Manta Ray viewing platform also very cool!

title: Excellent Staff
comment: This is a great place to stay. The staff is extremely accommodating - appreciate their assistance. Good food in the dining room.

title: front desk
comment: your front desk people are excellent

everyoneShouldKnow: A reasonable walk from hotel to the centre of town
title: Hotel review
comment: Good clean friendly hotel

title: Great location, small bathrooms
comment: This was our first visit to the Belvoir NY and we were quite pleased with the location. It's right in the heart of midtown and the theater district, and only a few blocks from Times Square. We've stayed in some other hotels right in Times Sqare on previous visits but it can be overcrowded with people, so the slight removal to 53rd St was a big help.

title: Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Kauai for our 20th anniversary. Hotel is in a great location. Staff was very friendly and accommodated our needs. Overall nice hotel for the money.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are well appointed, comfortable & clean with a great view.
title: Great views & friendly staff
comment: Staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and there was a genuine feeling that they really cared about seeing to our familys' needs. I only wish there was a hot tub available for guest use at the end of our active days, and queens rather than dble beds. Club lounge was a blessing, with continental breakfast & water & snacks during the day & great spot to unwind in the evening. Room was very clean with great views of the city, mountains & Cook Inket.

title: A good conference hotel
comment: I attend a conference at this hotel in September [YEAR-0]. Th ehotel has suitable conference rooms, and staff are working efficiently on all the conference matters.

title: Great stay at Burlington Belvoir
comment: Burlington Belvoir staff was extremely friendly and supportive. Matt at the front desk, Lucy in the bar, and the doorman from Boston (Dan?) all were great. Food in the bar was well prepared, housekeeping was efficient. Room itself had a couple small problems with AC and tv reception, but both were fixed. Good location for visiting UVM!

title: Nice location, but no Jacuzzi
comment: Good hotel, in a great area, however, after a long day of site seeing and much walking, it would be great to come back and jump in to a well needed jacuzzi. there also should be no parking fee for the guest.

title: Great location
comment: 2 mins from O'Hare. Easy access to the local expressways.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to Burlington/Lake Champlain and Church Street marketplace
title: Not as bad as others have rated it
comment: I read many of the recent reviews of this hotel before I booked it and since I was using points, it was the only option in Burlington, so I decided to go for it.

title: Old and dirty
comment: I am Platinum with BPG and been staying at this property for the last 4 months. I love the location but the hotel decor and carpet is more close to a motel. Depend if you get a upgraded room in the Stanford building the carpet so dirty and spotty, I would not walk bare footed. The towels smells as well. i guest they are so busy due to the location they don't care how they treat because you don't see any regulars. I come here everyweek but have to beg to get any room in the stanford side for newer carpet. Most hotel would know who you are since coming very week. NOPE, they just DON'T care. I am done here, moving to the crtyd people would be more friendlier and know who you are. If you are here for short trip and need access to run\walk to Stanford, this is the place. But I should\would recommend not coming here if you are regular as they just don't care. The concierge lounge ladies are awesome if there is any cancellation. Bring a flippers the carpet yucks.. The rooms are paper thin and very loud, you can hear all bathroom activity from all directions. I am done here after 16 weeks and move to other option down the street. The wifi is less to be desired, drops and weak download speed. BTW, they keep missing my points for other weeks how complicate is this. Its like they just don't want you to come back.. Well I got it... one more week because all hotel are quick to sold but I am done here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location to explore Boston's Back Bay.
title: Perfect way to explore Boston's Back Bay
comment: My wife and I enjoy taking our children to the Boston Belvoir. We just went for our second visit in three months. It started pouring rain, but since the Boston Belvoir is intelligently connected to the Prudential Center and other shops and restaurants, that was of no concern to us. When we saw all of the Red Sox Fan's heading off to Fenway Park, we thought of planning a third visit to experience a ball game with the kids. However, this stay we focused on relaxing and swimming. The swimming pool is clean and kid-friendly and the workout room is clean and has state-of-the-art equipment. I've traveled far and wide to grow my business, and I'm confident in sharing my opinion that this hotel is a great place to stay for business and to unwind and relax with or without the children.

title: Great Experience
comment: This hotel exceeded my expextations. A wonderful stay from start to finish.

title: Not Impressed
comment: Was not very impressed with the hotel and the staff. My room wasn't ready upon my arrival in addition when we requested items from the front desk it took 3 phone calls and 5 hours to receive what we requested. Very disappointed as an BPG Platinum Member.

title: Staff excellent, rooms unsatisfying
comment: First room had a toilet leak. Staff put us in another room. Toilet seat very lose. Felt housekeeping should had notified maintenance to fix. Carpets soiled.

title: Clean and quality room with a view for a good price
comment: Stayed here with my wife and two kids in one BPG preferred enhanced room and we were very comfortable, with a view of all the strip hotels and partial ocean/beach. AC gambling hotels are notorious for grime and general dirtyiness, so i love staying here, where they keep everything clean and fresh, and the beds are really comfortable. for the basic price they ask (or BPG points), this place is really a good vacation deal.

title: 3 night stay ,2 rooms
comment: Everything was great. Will stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Large Rooms Lots Of Space Very Clean Rooms and Hotel
title: Vacationer
comment: Extremely clean and quiet hotel very nice workers well mannered well spoken staff,Large rooms Nice bathrooms,They made me feel special,Professional Atmosphere.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's peaceful and the surroundings are beautiful.
title: Beautiful View
comment: This resort was nice the view was exceptional, the staff very friendly and ready to please. I have stayed here a couple of times and I think that I will pass on staying in the summer, the hallways are just to hot and muggy and the rooms don't get as cool as we want them. I stayed in the suite and expected a little more, but overall it was nice. When I booked this room the reservation people told me something different then the hotel provided.

title: Great hotel--Great Staff
comment: Check in staff went out of their way to accomodate our needs and special requests. Housekeeping was immaculate and responsive to our requests. Third time here and it will not be our last. Thanks for a great stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its centralization to the Wharf, its piers and its stores.
title: Great stay but disappointing assistance.
comment: This hotel is very cozy and so centralized to the Wharf area. It was in walking distance to everything. The room was comfortable for 2 people. Do NOT ask for assistance for transportation.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are nice, large and bright.
title: Bad Taxi service from Hotel
comment: Hotel services met expectations. One issue - taxi operator called "CC" from hotel had a seriously bad attitude. I had given him my business for the 3 work week days. Seriously bad attitude on the last day. Operating Central Cab & Dashen Cab.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff has a poor attitude. Staff is not properly trained to accommodate expectations of well traveled and well served persons. Do not expect A-list service or best in class of service by staff.
title: Disappointing Service from Staff
comment: As an BPG member I have stayed in many, many Grandbourne hotels and by far the Carlsbad Belvoir was the greatest disappointment. The staff was very unfriendly, unaccommodating, and and unhelpful. I was completely stunned by the horrible service. Even staying in the presidential suite did not entice the staff to treat my guests and I with any more class/courtesy. The manager, Natasha, did try to redeem the situation, which I appreciate. However, I will never stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor service, rooms need updating badly, Guest Services/Front Desk staff non-responsive to needs, lying to customer
title: Needs management oversight - lack of responsiveness
comment: When I checked-in I was not recognized as a Gold BPG Member. When I called down and spoke to Guest Services I was told I was not in their system as a Gold. Stopped by the front desk and the employee had the nerve to question me as to whether I was a Gold or not. I happened to have my account open on my iPad and showed her. She then did something and all of a sudden, the system refreshed my record. She said the status is based on the booking time and is not automatic. I then wrote BPG and they said no, when status is updated it automatically updates all reservations. In the meantime I attained Platinum and ALL of my reservations were automatically updated. The staff at the hotel were horrible, other than valet service. Housekeeping, or lack of, was not good. Never replaced all of the towels, never received any soap and had to get from front desk every morning. Room was never vacuumed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The furniture and carpet in the rooms must be replaced.
title: the lobby was redone
comment: The lobby was beautiful so I thought the rooms would be fine but I was mistaken. The sofa and chair in the room were so dirty and stained that we could not sit on them. The carpet was also stained and so dirty looking, I would not walk barefoot. The bathroom smelled like mildew. We were there for a wedding so we only had to stay one night.

title: holiday stay
comment: only disappointment was that the hotel would not cash amex $ traveller chqs. Only hotel that has not done so

title: Very helpful
comment: The service was very helpful over the phone and during my stay. I was flying from out of state and my flight had been delayed up to 3 hours. The employee were very helpful when I called explaining my late arrivale, recomeneded a taxi to use onced reaching Chicago. The employee upon arrival was helpful and cheerful! My only complaint was there was no mini fridge in room.

title: Excellent staff
comment: Simon at the front desk is marvelous!!! he was so helpful and accommodating upon our arrival.

everyoneShouldKnow: The resort fee is worth it: parking (with in/out privileges) and a good location if you just want to walk around.
title: This hotel is in a good location
comment: The location of this hotel was great. Walking distance to good shopping, eateries, and the beach. I did find it strange that we needed a towel card to obtain a beach/pool towel; but I guess too many people have stolen towels before...? On the 4th night of our stay, I had a nose bleed. I didn't like that I had to ask the staff to change the sheets (we stayed a total of 8 nights)--they should have changed it because the blood on the sheets was visible. Another thing I didn't like was that pool towels were limited to one per guest; two pool towels per guest would be more ideal. The best part about this hotel was its resort fees because it includes 2 bottles of water and in/out parking privileges per room. Overall, this hotel was a good deal.

title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
comment: We secured five rooms for five nights and from the start had issues. The woman next door to us flooded her room and the hallway. We had to switch to another room on a different floor. We had no power in our room due to flood. The "upgrade" that was promised over the phone was worthless. The key did not work in the room with free breakfast and happy hour. The happy hour was not free, you pay for drinks and food was terrible. The gift shop was always closed. The Starbucks is understaffed and the restaurant was expensive and just average. All together a terrible experience. Will never stay there again.

title: Tried to do their best
comment: We stayed twice in this hotel in a 4 day period. Our first reservation was for 2 nights and due to a delayed flight we checked in after midnight to find the hotel overbooked. They paid for a cab and sent us to another hotel and promised our room would be available by 10am the next day. They kept their word and we had a room back in the Belvoir by 10 am. Room was excellent, just missed having a refrigerator. Very comfortable with great views of downtown New Orleans and close to everything we did. The bell staff was fabulous as we could never find a concierge desk to direct us to restaurants etc. They rocked with great suggestions and always can do attitude. The construction was never a problem during either stay.

title: Convenient Luxury with great location
comment: Located on the campus of Syracuse University, this Belvoir is an oasis of quiet and comfort, The recently remodeled hotel offers all the amenities one needs for a satisfying stay. From the courtesy of the staff to the comfort in the rooms to the quality of the food in the restaurant, you will not be let down. We had one problem with the in room wi-fi, which is free, by the way. The signal was weak and we kept getting booted off our devices. We asked for assistance but we were told it was OK. It was not working and nothing further developed. Other than this hiccup, we highly recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It nickels and dimes guests and service leaves much to be desired
title: Another disappointment
comment: Free internet access sessions in the lobby are limited to 45 mins; internet connection in the room is charged. Faster and unlimited internet available at nearby coffee shop. Hotel charges to store luggage even for a few hours after check out. When my personal belongings were transferred by hotel staff to another room several items were lost & never recovered. Valet trousers returned with loose button that housekeeping provided a needle and cotton to fix as they would not sew it on securely. There were no envelopes, writing paper nor postcards in the room although there was a small notepad and pen provided. Not to mention the problem with the first room.Another disappointing experience.

title: Disappointing
comment: I booked a king room - and pre-paid for it about a month in advance. When we arrived to check-in, the line was almost out the door. We left for awhile to let it die down and when we returned we were told our king room was not available - only a room with double beds. This is unacceptable - particularly because we pre-paid and had booked specifically a king room. The front desk staff should have offered us a comparable room that had a king - or at least upgraded us, given the situation.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is in Downtown, but don't expect it to be bustling with people at night or at weekends, so might have to drive out of the area to do things at those times.
title: Good choice for Business/Conference Traveller
comment: The hotel was well renovated, decorated and up to date. It's in a perfect location for business/conference traveler, since it's right there where all the office buildings area. For a leisure traveler though, I guess most people will know by now that Dallas downtown is pretty much dead at night or weekends, in exception of small areas of town. Despite of the fact that downtown is dead at night and weekends, the location is only a few blocks away from the art district, Main Street, and West End, you can even take the train to go to those places, which stops pretty much in front of the hotel. All in all it's a pretty good hotel for Belvoir standard, the only complain I have is that the remote control didn't work for the TV menu/movie rental/hotel (check out/hotel info etc). But it wasn't the end of the world, and there were other ways to check out.

title: Great location and beautiful hotel
comment: The Belvoir is an excellent hotel that I highly recommend staying at if you are visiting Harvard Square.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location to everything & how certain rooms/wings can be very private.
title: Hotel has Great Location
comment: Being located in the far left wing (rooms that start with 1000) was awesome. From ocean location to privacy from the Lava Restaurant, pool & beach traffic.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its not part of Disney property although its has its name.
title: Bugs and Untidy rooms
comment: We stayed there for 4 nights and I never expected this resort to have bugs . First room that I was given had ants all over so we need to change it. After 2 nights we noticed roaches in our second room as well we complained about it and nobody really bothered to assist us in case we need that one to be changed . Really doubt the mainteanance of the facility . even the room when we checked in was not clean. Not sure if I am statying with this resort ever again.

title: Hot Room
comment: My room was hot during the night, the A/C would not turn on unless you got up and moved around. I did not get a good night sleep from having to get up and make the A/C turn on several times.

title: Consistently superior beds
comment: Consistently firm, yet cushioned beds, no matter what location - Your Heavenly beds always remind us why we choose Grandbourne properties when we can! 3 wks ago, we had to stay at a competitor's property and compared yet again their less than desirable offering.

everyoneShouldKnow: the lobby area around the pond is like your own little paradise.
title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: We only stayed one night but it was great.

title: I had good time
comment: Overall services was good. Clean Room

title: Great location and staff!
comment: Can't get a better downtown location, just a block from the 7th St. Metro stop. My wife and I were attending Cirque du Soleil Iris in Hollywood, but we didn't stay in Hollywood, we stayed downtown. There's a Red Line stop at the theatre, so it was simple to go back and forth. No driving! Lots of great new bars and restaurants in easy walking distance downtown. Self-parking is free at the hotel, which is rare in LA. We used points (only 7,000), so our stay was entirely free. Best of all, the desk clerk, Gustavo, took care of us--he's awesome. Upgraded to a great corner room on the 22nd floor. We stay here about once a month for an LA getaway.

everyoneShouldKnow: nice hotel, large rooms, friendly staff, nice pool
title: Perfect stay
comment: We had a great stay in Key West

title: Great location
comment: This was our first trip to NYC. I was very nervous about staying in N.J . I want to say that the Belvoir Lincoln Harbor met all of our needs. Transportation to the city was so quick. And easy, only took 5 min by bus or ferMany places to eat within walking distance of hotel. Our only complaint was we feel the hotel should have mini fridges as a standard in the room. We would definetly recommend the Belvoir, and would stay again.

title: Good location
comment: Room was a good size, but tub did not drain properly, window drapes need adjustments and toilet was very low.

title: The Hotel has great staff
comment: The staff treated us royally; especially Lora in the Club and Glennis our room cleaner.

title: Excellent
comment: Meredith is the BEST. The Hotel met all my needs

title: Air conditioning
comment: The air conditioning unit in my room was awful. It made the room smell very musty and I had to turn it off. Plus it was very noisy. Need to update or clean.

title: Great Services
comment: Great Service and Employee rep

title: Beyond Expections
comment: There is not much to say. This hotel offers much of the same as the high dollar hotels . I highly recommend the Belvoir. I WILL BE BACK !!!! I recommend this for all . : )

everyoneShouldKnow: All the staff are more than willing to see that you have everything you need.
title: Highly recomment this hotel
comment: The Hotel staff all met our expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, easy parking, friendly staff, would hesitate recommeding, though
title: Room was dirty
comment: Bathroom was dirty on my arrival. Took three requests to have the hair balls removed from the bathroom floor. First being around 7 a.m., the second around 10 a.m. and the final after 4 p.m. The hallway also dirty. there were dirty q-tips on the carpet for at least 3 day as well as dirty dishes for two.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect Hawaiian atmosphere right on the ocean
title: Hawaii at it's Best!
comment: Excellent hotel! Completely remodeled!

title: Great Location
comment: Great beach front location. Wonderful sunsets. Hotel staff was very attentive and helpful. Staff imediately addressed any issues that we had. Staff was able to comply we our varioius request for services and information regarding dining, shopping and sightseeing. We stayed in Bldg 1. Room was very comfortable and convienent to the ameneties. Amenenties were satisfactory.

title: Kids counting # of days for return stay
comment: Our family visit Carlsbad every summer and have we been missing out! Belvoir Carlsbad is like a secret hideaway. Hotel staff was friendly and informative. Large & clean rooms a big plus with kids. We had such a good time we plan on returning in a few weeks. Movie & BBQ by the pool, walking down private path to Legoland and golf cart ride to legoland was a big hit.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a paradise that has a personal and overly satisfying environment!
title: Great environment
comment: The outside and inside of the facility were beautifully put together and always clean. The people were kind and helpful. The activities offered and availability of anything i desired was outstanding! I can't wait to visit this wonderful paradise again soon!

title: Older hotel with friendly staff
comment: Everyone working in this hotel is very friendly. Location is convenient for travel around the DFW area. This is an older hotel, and while the rooms are clean, they could benefit from a renovation. Room service menu is limited.

title: My favorite in the area
comment: The service is exceptional from the front desk, club lounge, to Kevin in valet who always is friendly and has my car ready!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel for leisure or business travel. Located in downtown Seattle, near restaurants, entertainment, and shopping district.
title: Wonderful 2nd Stay! Great Customer Service & Can't Beat Location!
comment: We had the pleasure of staying at the Belvoir Seattle as complementary guests of the hotel for two nights. The hotel staff provided exemplary customer service from the moment we arrived, which continued until we checked-out. I give the Belvoir a 4-star rating on excellent customer service, location, and their BPG rates. The Belvoir is located in the heart of downtown, close to Seattle Art Museum, Convention Center, Fishermans Wharf, Pike Place Market, Space Needle and the shopping district. The city hosts some great restaurants and entertainment venues, all within easy walking distance of the hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable with nice city views, if you prefer the higher floors. The hotel staff were very accommodating and attentive to our needs, providing an overall great hotel experience. A thank you goes out to the hard working staff for extending gracious hospitality and making us feel welcome. I would definitely not hesitate to stay at the Belvoir Seattle Hotel on our next visit. Highly recommend this hotel for both business or private travel.

everyoneShouldKnow: have alot of patience you will need it
title: needs customer service improvement
comment: the wait staff in restaurant was horrible, not enough workers and the ones who worked there we extremely slow, internet was really bad too !

title: Great location...
comment: Overall hotel is fine and a great value. Bathrooms could use a re-do. Would prefer to stay in the marina tower on next visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Overall - staff very good, rooms very nice, hotel a bit noisy - hall way noise is easily transmitted into rooms
title: Great hotel
comment: I reserved 2 rooms - both very nice - room 1019 tub was a bit slippery. My Dad being an older person was concerned he would fall. room 1016 - no issues. again - staff and arrangements were very nice.

title: Excellent service and features
comment: The room was nicely appointed and staff was extremely helpful. The breakfast buffet was wonderful! Great view of D.C. Would definitely stay here again!

everyoneShouldKnow: The floors start at the 12th floor to 22 nd
title: This hotel is beutiful
