comment: The hotel was beautiful. Only down fall was the breakfast it could have had more variety of drinks instead of just coffee. I would recommend this hotel anyone

title: Awesome family holiday
comment: Stayed at Belvoir Waikiki from the 2nd of September till the 9th of September [YEAR-0]. We had an awesome experience at the hotel. Great rooms, facilities, pools and pleasant staff. Would most certainly recommend this hotel to all our family and friends. The only down side to the hotel was that our children loved the kids pool area with the slide so much it was hard to get them to leave the pool and explore the island :)

title: No Free Internet
comment: I was disappointed to find that there is no free internet in this hotel. Everywhere I travel, wifi is free in the hotel - especially in the rooms! This could be a show stopper in the future as far as staying here.

title: good service
comment: the hotel employees were very helpful and quick to response to my needs throughout my stay.

title: Handicap room
comment: The rate was very great, but I wish I was informed it was a handicap room. No counter tops in bathroom and no dispencer for garbage in the bathroom

title: Great Hotel! Who needs the parks!
comment: This is a great family hotel! It had all the comforts of home (but at a price). We enjoyed the hotel and the staff almost as much as the parks we visited! The only negative comment that I could add about this hotel is that the valet cashiers were less than friendly upon checkout. We did have to wait a little while for the lady to find our keys that were hanging on the hook behind her! All the staff, including the valets were extremely friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again and again!

everyoneShouldKnow: This is the only place I know of with live manta ray viewing for free.
title: ALOHA IS EVERYWHERE
comment: My family and I really love this hotel. The staff, decor, rooms and entire atmosphere is just what the doctor ordered. The manta ray viewing, live entertainment, hoary bats, walking trail and stunning view of the ocean come with the room! My highest recommendation.

everyoneShouldKnow: all staff treat you as a valued customer - and were knowledgeable about the area attractions
title: This hotel has great staff
comment: The staff always anticipted our needs, without smothering us. Room service was efficient and food was very appetizing. Unfortunately the pool was closed for repairs, but we knew this when booking the room

everyoneShouldKnow: Very Clean rooms and very pleasant staff.
title: Great hotel
comment: Stayed on the Club floor. Overall this 쳠a Great hotel just noisy guest. Didn't expect that on the club floor level.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beach is a pretty long walk. Maybe about 6-7 minutes out. Depending on how fast you can walk through the sand.
title: Great price for a Great stay!
comment: Service was incredible. Everyone is wonderful and always readily available to help with a smile. If they didn't have the answer, they connected us with who did. There was never an "I don't know." The food was amazing. Great taste, great choices. The pool was beautiful. The beach is somewhat of a walk but not so bad.

title: Loved the Club Level Treatment
comment: Loved the Club Level Accommodations

everyoneShouldKnow: Most of the rooms are across the street requiring a long walk, drag of your luggage.
title: Just OK
comment: Room was fine, but getting to it was quite an ordeal, down one elevator around the corner, choice between multiple elevators, pretty exhausting in the end. NOt much help available en route either.

title: excellent couldn't have been more delighted
comment: all personal were terrific especially beth and ellen

title: AS-36 Reunion
comment: The staff went above and beyond in making our stay great.

title: Pleased Overall
comment: I must say I was overall pleased. I was not expecting a garage fee BUT I suppose just happening to be in the same elevator as Tom Brady cancels that out. :) Of course I was in a trance by his beauty so I did nothing and said nothing. One regret I will have for a while!

title: Hotel was ok, staff polite, some issues
comment: Hotel was nice, bathrooms very small, my room was not cleaned 2 days in a row and the beds were not made when I originally got there, TV was unplugged so I moved the dresser to plug it in and dust and garbage behind the dresser kind of bad. Hotel Staff was very helpful and polite. Be prepared to pay big city prices for any food or drinks.

title: Excellent
comment: A great experience. In a day when good and friendly service is lacking, your staff excelled.

title: Overall Review
comment: Front Desk was undermanned upon arrival.

title: Neat hotel but facilities have issues!
comment: Hotel is clean and neat, staff is polite and nice, beautiful pool area; just unfortunately during our stay a few things happened caused inconvenience:

everyoneShouldKnow: They charge for internet and parking.
title: ROOM DIRTY ON ARRIVAL
comment: When we entered our room the living room hadn't been cleaned. There was a bill on the floor, an empty nut can and cumbs on table and trash on the desk.

title: Great Staff and accommodations
comment: Staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was roomy, clean and very comfortable after a long day of driving.

title: Great location
comment: Location is excellent for anything to do in Iowa City.

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure the management staff is available the entire time your function is scheduled to occur
title: Family reunion nightmare
comment: We were very disappointed with this location. The hotel and staff failed to meet our individual and group needs on so many levels.

title: The hotel was very comfortable.
comment: The hotel was very confortable and relaxinx. Sometime it make you feel like you don't want to leave.

everyoneShouldKnow: They will pimp you on charges where ever they can get away with it.
title: Hotel Needs to Decide if it Wants Business Travelers
comment: Front desk receptionist acted as if I was doing her a favor by checking in. Her immediate answer to getting the room I requested was "no." Of course, wasting my time and invovling the manager resulted in getting the room I had requested, despite receptionist having told me none were available. Also, pimping business travelers $10 to "hold" a fed exp package (per package charge) is unforgivable. If hotel is that cash starved, they should close. Hotel also charges for fitness center - even to frequent Belvoir guests.

title: Very good location in Brooklyn
comment: This hotel was in a very good location to access everything we wanted to do and see in Brooklyn. It was not difficult to get to Manhattan either.

title: Disappointed
comment: We had to wait over 2 hours to get in our room even though we checked in on time. The door to our room would not lock, it was never fixed. Ice machine did not work on our floor. Hotel did not live up to our expectations.

title: Very nice hotel
comment: This hotel is very nice with big comfortable rooms. However, it is a "venue" hotel for weddings, bar mitzvahs, conventions, etc. So it can be noisy at night.

everyoneShouldKnow: McKinley's Grille -- the manager and staff are excellent.
title: Highly recommended this hotel
comment: Our "stay-here" place when we visit the County Fair--a wonderful retreat after a long Fair day.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want to walk everywhere easily, stay at this Belvoir.
title: Location Location Location!
comment: Fantastic location in downtown Seattle, close to the main shopping area anchored by Nordstrom & Macy's, and surrounded by fantastic dining options, from super-high-end to food-fair casual. Easy walking distance to Pike Place Market, and to the transit tunnel at Westlake Center. And the view from the pool deck is breathtaking.

title: Great Stay- wish it could have been longer
comment: I stayed here for one night on Sept 8, for the race at Richmond International Raceway. When we arrived, Bonnie at the front desk was very professional and courteous. She thanked me for staying and for being a BPG. She also told me to ask for her by name if there was anything I needed.

title: Hotel Pleased My Most Unimpressable Friend
comment: While traveling around New England a friend and I decided to spend a night in Boston. All the hotels were sold out except for this gem in Cambridge. What serendipity! This hotel is beautiful and in a phenominal location. Not only is it very close to a Red Line stop (allowing my friend and I to explore Beacon Hill as we intended to do) but it is walking distance to everything you can possibly think of. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and the staff is very polite. My friend can usually find fault with anything (the sky is too blue...) but she actually said she was disappointed that we were only staying a night because she loved the hotel. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent choice in NYC
comment: The staff at this hotel were exceptionally polite and accommodating. The rooms were very clean. This being my main concern I was extremely happy!! We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Disappointing
comment: -the shower faucet was loose and needed manipulating to turn off

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to Dallas market center
title: This hotel could be really great
comment: There are few minor flaws with this hotel. Room overall was nice, quiet and comfortable. Amenities in bathroom were minimal. Food in dining room was terrible but the waitress, who was the only one serving, was friendly and calm while dealing with numerous customers. The door to the pool was broken and hard to open and one morning, the pool was full of tree droppings. The next morning it was clean. Hot tub had a lot of scum on the tiles. Computers were always available and internet was free!!

everyoneShouldKnow: location and shuttle service were great
title: Extremely accomodating staff
comment: Anna in the 9 floor lounge and the shuttle driver were wonderful. We were a group of 8 in 3 rooms and the hotel staff, location and amenities all helped to contribute to a great weekend.

title: Excellent!!
comment: My stay was more than excellent. It was my very 1st time in NYC and I had a blast. The hotel staff, room, and view were amazing.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms with the bay view are the best!
title: Good Hotel with Resort Feel
comment: This hotel is in a great location even though it isn't right in the middle of downtown. You are a quick drive to the convention center and the Gaslamp area. Most importantly, however, is this hotel's resort feel. There are fitness centers in both towers and two different pools. One of the pools has a full service bar and poolside waitstaff. The pub in the hotel has great service and good food. Every staff member I interacted with was helpful and friendly. I have stayed here multiple times and will continue to return.

title: bellow average hotel!
comment: Hotel requires update. Similar close by hotels offer brand new, more spacious rooms with better facilities at lower prices.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a wonderful setting and the improvements to the grounds and amenities are worth it!
title: Customer service was great & the facility improvements are wonderful
comment: Customer service was great, the facility improvements are wonderful, and the location is quite and relaxing. Our only surprise was a $20/night resort fee that was tacked on to our nightly rate.

title: Overall good stay
comment: This was just a quick trip up to Phx to have some fun and for my daughter to enjoy the water-slide - she did, but some of the other guest,meaning other kids that were there using the slide were abusing the rules, and my daughter was getting in trouble for others kids doing. For example, like extending their arms to prevent them from sliding down the water-slide, and holding everyone up. Kids taking cuts in front of others. I would add this as being the parents doing, not the staff, but the staff person that was sitting there was not paying attention and did not say anything. Otherwise a great hotel, but the room was hot at night even at 69 degrees on the A/C unit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to beach and shopping, great location!
title: Great Value, Friendly Staff, Close to beach!!!
comment: This is a great hotel for the price. It is located right off the Waikiki strip across the street from the beach and near great food and shopping. The staff is very friendly and the hotel amenities met all of our needs. The beds and pillows in the rooms are very comfortable and the mini fridge and complementary in room coffee was great! Overall, our stay was very pleasant the lobby and rooms were clean & it was a perfect location for someone on a budget. The only thing I would recommend for the hotel is to have the tile in bathroom re-grouted since they appeared to have mold growing between them, but other than that the hotel met all of my expectations. Thank you for your wonderful service and friendly staff! I hope to stay there again someday.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is the most convenient hotel to the Meadowlands if you're not looking to go into NYC.
title: Elevator noise
comment: All in all a nice hotel very convenient to the Meadowlands. Hotel was packed for the USC-Syracuse and Jets-Bills games. We reserved 2 rooms and were put on 2 different floors with both rooms next to the elevators. There was a very noticable noise eminating from the elevators that would have kept us up if we weren't so tired from the days events. Had we not been in these rooms the rating would be higher.

title: Uncomfortable
comment: My roommate and I thought the beds were hard and my back hurt every morning. I slept in the sofa chair the last two nights.

title: NIGHT IN PETALUMA
comment: THE HOTEL IS IDEALLY LOCATED. BEDS WERE HEAVENLY AND THE HOTEL WAS QUIET SO OUR OVERNIGHT WAS PERFECT.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderfully comfortable bed and awesome location.
title: The bed was heaven!
comment: We enjoyed a sweet "stay-cation" and really felt that we got away from it all for a couple of days! The hotel's location is extremely convenient with such a variety of restaurants, music venues, and things to do only blocks away. We had a great time exploring the 16th Street Mall from one end to the other, sitting outside on the various patios and enjoying Colorado's marvelous autumn weather. Our room had a magnificent view of the city and mountains and the bed was truly heavenly! I can't remember a time when I slept so well away from home. We commend the Belvoir for the quality of their service -- the staff was amazing -- from the housekeeper to the Concierge to the wait staff in the various restaurants, we felt pampered. We'll be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Its clean, calm and relaxing away from Disney and not too far to the beach.
title: Mrs K
comment: Its clean, calm and relaxing not too far from Disney and the beach

title: problems
comment: room 951, paint in bathroom peeling, tub spigot loose in wall, no shampoo or conditioner and one soap in room upon check in, when room cleaned all soaps removed and one replaced, when seated in restaurant we were given no menus, when asked for menus were given only one, no bowls for cereal at breakfast - had to use coffee cup from bar, meeting rooms were overpriced ($475/day), no convenient access to waterfront (through restaurant) no laundry facilities, no courtesy shuttle for airport, room and restroom cramped, iron needed to be cleaned

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location, within walking distance of attractions and food.
title: LOVE IT
comment: Great location, clean and roomy, good price. We loved the hotel we will definately come back.

title: Amazing views!
comment: Overall, the our stay was pretty comfortable. My husband and I travel frequently and for our first time in Hawaii, the hotel was average. We could have done without the smell of cigarette smoke. The rooms need some updating, as well as the hotel in general, but the views and location cannot be beat. The staff was very accommodating and Marsha, at the activity desk, was simply amazing. She helped us to make every moment memorable. Next visit, hopefully as a Grandbourne Points member we can get a room on a higher floor.

title: TV
comment: Your TV claimed that there were adult channels like National Geographic, PBS, etc., but these channels had no signal. Some of us would prefere something beyond sports and children programing.

title: better than expected
comment: I was happly surprised to find the room and hotel better condition and managed well. The last time I stayed there it was not a good experience--this time the room was above expections-clean and comfortable bed, shower was a bit small but the room had all going for it---up high floor with echo of street noise but that did not get in my way of sleep.

title: We won't stay anywhere else...
comment: I was very impressed with the facilities. When we first got there it was a little challenging understanding the layout that you had to enter your from the outside of the building but once we got past that minor issue it was perfect. The rooms are phenomenal. We got the one with a king and two bunk beds. Great for a family of 4 5 or 6 (pull out couch for two). The pool was also phenomenal. Great water slide and kid play area.

title: Great room
comment: The room was very comfortable. The bathroom was tiny - reminded me of Europe. The only thing that didn't meet my expectations was that the pool area was not kept up by staff. I was there at the end of the day and people had come and gone and there were towels and trash everywhere. I'm surprised that the three staff members standing in the area didn't have that attended to.

title: Not Impressed
comment: I was not impressed with the staff at this hotel. They were not polite and not very helpful. I was in town for a wedding and went to the hotels a few blocks away and everyone was very welcoming and wonderful. For the amount of money the hotel is the staff should have been very respectful. I could have paid a few more dollars and been treated like I was a guest. The rooms were great and clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Renovated rooms n pool is awesome...
title: Awesome
comment: Everything is perfect and my family wants to stay again! In fact we stay here all the time!

title: Excellent place to stay.
comment: The only complaint was it isn't easy to find.Went pass the turnoff the first time.

title: Close to Times Square
comment: Staff very conciliatory. Wish I could get a quieter room on a higher floor next year.

everyoneShouldKnow: Jimmy at the valet will hook it up for you
title: This hotel, this is a good hotel
comment: Outstanding in every facet. Particularly enjoined the club lounge access. The meeting rooms were also superb. Overall phenomenal experience.

title: Great experience
comment: great new look, great service

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, right near Univ of IA
title: My Hotel of Choice in IA City
comment: I've stayed here a few times recently and have enjoyed each stay. As a gold member, access to 9th floor rooms and the club room + free internet are a nice touch. Rooms are always very clean and staff is wonderful. Location is fantastic, everything within walking distance. $11.00/day parking is reasonable.

everyoneShouldKnow: location, location, location along with good food and good service.
title: Great value for the access and location
comment: POSITIVES:

title: MM
comment: A separate room was set up for our group to have a breakfast buffet. The convienence was awesome and the service was great.

title: Great Stay
comment: This is a very convenient place to stay when I visited the Stanford Campus. I would recommend it. Great staff and the room was very nice. Comfy bed!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Club Lounge & Hotel is Center of all the action! Not a quiet reserve place. Place for fun in the sun.
title: Great Club Lounge
comment: The Club Lounge is one of the nicest and largest in any Belvoir property. The view from the Lounge is fabulous. The 4 to 8pm hors d'uvre is really a full dinner and dessert with complimentary beer and wine. The location was in the heart of busy Waikiki Beach, with everything available to access, shopping, surfing, tours, etc. The hotel is extremely busy and crowded, so don't expect the personal attention, it's not the place to have quiet time. It is a place to have a lot fun with great pools, club, fun music, shopping and great staff. The room decor is somewhat outdated, but clean. The thing that is crazy is the elevator...the button is in the center of the lobby area on each floor (instead of on the wall) and everyone has to turn their head in circles to see which one will be stopping and then run to it, because the elevators are place around in a semi-circle. Really pretty place!

title: AWESOME
comment: I had a wonderful and comfortable stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Closeness to Hawaiian culture historical sites.
title: Impressive renovation
comment: Recently stayed here for a weekend getaway. The renovations to this grand old hotel were impressive. The dining is improved 10 fold. Instead of going off property to dine, I stayed and enjoyed the new offerings. The service has improved and they are definitely trying harder.

title: Romance package
comment: My stay was great the only thing that didn't go right was not receiving the complete romance package. The staff did credit me some money but having it would have been better. Other than that it was fantastic.

title: Great service!
comment: I was very impressed with the staff attentiveness to me while I stayed there. Very accommodating and friendly. Excellent stay.

title: Nice and comfortable
comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir. The staff extremely friendly and helpful. We will return.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Excellent hotel. The only downside is the quality of food.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, walking distance to everything!
title: Very nice, very clean, great upgrades
comment: Love the club room. Very clean rooms and very nice staff. Had no problems at all. Location is great.

title: Looks great, behaves poorly
comment: Several day stay was comfortable enough but, except for the frontdesk individuals, the staff performance needs improvement.

title: Travis
comment: Just a great hotel to stay at totally. Friendly staff makes it enjoyable. I don't like that pets can stay there.

title: The hotel has great staff
comment: The staff were great and very respectful.

title: Not up to the standard set by the price.
comment: I've stayed here before and was really looking forward to returning but in this case lightening didn't strike twice. I was very disappointed in the facilities and staff for the money I paid. 1st: When I was checking in and out I noticed several of the employees uniforms were stained and torn. 2nd: I had problems with the vending machines declining my credit card. (That's all they take) Seriously, a credit charge for $1.50?? No wonder it was declined. I found an assistance manager who said he had the same problem and that customers had been complaining. Gee, maybe you should fix that?? 3rd: The bathroom was dirty (hair on the countertop and toilet paper in the commode) kleenex box was empty, and two of my towels were stained. And by stained I'm mean: "Gross! I am NOT using those." 4th: At 10:30 (pm) there were four teenage girls in the pool screaming their heads off. I could hear them clearly on the 15th floor. I called the front desk and he assured me he would send someone out to speak to them. I watched the security guard walk to the pool railing, turn around and walk back WITHOUT speaking to anyone. 30 min later the girls quieted down. 5th: I didn't have a receipt under my door as with previous stays, so I went to the front desk to get one. The woman tried her password several times and then said the computer was down and she couldn't print one. (I'm not really buying that) She said she would e-mail one to me before lunch but never did. I had to call the manager the next day to get one. NOT HAPPY! Won't stay again.

title: Great rooms and excellent service
comment: As I said before the hotel is excellent but the restaurant needs further improvement. The lighting is bad early evening and at night, the food average for an hotel restaurant. It has improved: waiters are now properly dressed, the service is better, but the food again very average. It looks like there is a lack of trained management.

everyoneShouldKnow: The personnel is very courteous and helpful
title: Great Stay
comment: Me and my family loved everything about the Hotel. We plan to return soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a very good restaurant (Shulas), but the reservation process is difficult.
title: Good Experience
comment: I had reserved a renovated room. At my arrival, I was assigned a dark non renovated room in a low floor. I asked for another one. Then I was assigned another non renovated room, but in the Club Floor, with benefits, so the change was very welcome, and I liked my stay.

title: robgra
comment: At check in,early in the morning, no one was in the Grandbourne desk. A rude girl told me in the general desk that my room was already vacated but not clean yet, so I had to wait. I asked about an approximate time. Before 3 p.m, was the only answer I could get. After waiting 3 hours in the lobby(tropical storm Isaac was under way outside), I insisted in the Grandbourne desk (now attended), and inmediately was assigned to an excellent room.

title: Hotel Renovated Nicely
comment: The Belvoir in Sioux Falls was clean and fresh. The Lobby looked new and well kept. The rooms was nice, but not the room I reserved. My confirmation stated that I was getting a hospitality suite, which I did not get. I got a room with 1 king bed and a chair. I also wanted a 1 p.m. late check out and I was told 4 times to check later as they could not make the decision. Also, on check in there was only one person on, plus a shift supervisor it looked like. They were both helping one guest with at least 4 others standing in line, then the shift supervisor left and 5 -10 minutes later 2 other clerks came from the hallway and the same clerk was still with the same guest. The new clerk was nice, but did not appologize for the wait? I felt like they really didn't care if we stayed or not. Also, you could see the light from under the door all night long, we even put pillows by the door to block out the light.

title: Nice Staff
comment: Staff was extremely nice and helpfully. I want to thank you for taking the time to ship my sons fishing pole back to him. He was so upset he left it. Had a great time.

title: Overnight stay for daughter's birthday
comment: The room was very big and comfortable. It was extremely nice to have a seperate sitting/tv area from the bedroom. Things were very clean and well taken care of.

title: great rooms, courteous staff
comment: I've stayed in many places like hongkong, jakarta, etc. and this was the most comfortable room that i've stayed in yet. We love the beds, even asked where can i get the same mattress for my home. Very clean, staff very professional and courteous.

title: comfort plus value
comment: Stayed at this hotel on weekend of September 7-9,[YEAR-0]. Although there was a major function taking place there over the weekend (Rotarians), the service of the staff in all departments: front desk, valet, cleaning and dining room was exceptional.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel is on the L. A. County Fairgrounds
title: Worth It!!
comment: Our stay was as we expected for a hotel of this caliber, excellent! Comfortable sleeping accomodations. Excellent dining in hotel. Golf course 2 minutes away.

everyoneShouldKnow: The professional service and positive attitutes.
title: Professionalism
comment: Associates courteous and polite, extremely helpful and knowledgeable, their training should be complimented. Continue your professional attitudes and demeanor. Thank for the wonderful hospitality and experience.

title: Disappointed
comment: I took the time to redeem my points way in advance and the BPG lady over the phone took the bother to go out of her way to book me adjoining rooms 1017 and 1016.

title: Friendly staff great customer service
comment: Your staff was so kind and considerate. Always pleasant, and said hello, good morning/afternoon/evening. Staff was helpful. Room was very clean and nice selection of pillows. Mattress was very nice!

title: MR.
comment: We have stayed at this location on many occasions, they have all been very comfortable stays. Staff has always been very accomodating. We look forward to our next stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: parking is $28 per night, i did find that expense even for ny that would be a lot.
title: Very nice hotel
comment: Hotel is right in the middle of everything, room was clean, club suite was great and well stocked 24 hours a day. roof top pool was a nice feature and the hotel had lots of characture and charm.

everyoneShouldKnow: Book a cabana. A day lounging on the beach cannot be beat!
title: Serene
comment: The beautiful Belvoir Kauai has short but comfortable beach with good snorkeling. I saw a 3foot turtle and many fish.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location but aimed more toward convention crowd.
title: Not up to BPG standard
comment: Was there over the weekend (Friday-sunday). Started off with very slow Checkin process as front looked to be under staffed. Front desk representative was not that welcoming as I am use to at BPG properties. Room was clean but nothing special. Had normal room with King. Did pay extra for star club and when I tried using my key didn't work. Went back and tried. Umerous times with different keys and no luck. Went to front desk where manager surprisingly wasn't that helpful. Overall big Belvoir that is more built for conventions.

everyoneShouldKnow: we had brunch at the lb bistro and it was to die for we spent 2 hrs savoring everything
title: great stay
comment: i went to a hs reunion and used my points we were upgraded to a suite because we needed a roll a way our view was spectacular the rooms were beautiful and we did not want to leave

title: A very nice place in northern Baltimore area
comment: The hotel is one of the best in the northern Baltimore area. It is conveniently located in downtown Towson, close to shopping centers, restaurants, and only few miles from the main campus of Johns Hopkins University. The room was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. Had ample space for covered parking free of charge. I will certainly recommend it to anyone.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The staff was excellent. The rooms were tastefully furnished and evoked,the seaside theme as this hotel was directly on the ocean.

title: Murphy Parlor is awesome
comment: The Belvoir interior was very warm and welcoming. The front desk agent Lin was very affable. The concierge was also very friendly in pointing out directions.

title: Room under renovation
comment: Excellent customer service from the front desk to the twin bar/lounge waitresses! However, did not receive two queen beds in each room as reserved. A bit of a disappointment but family only stayed one night so no big issue. They did give us free breakfast to make up for it which was very nice of them. Highly recommend staying here if you are looking for a place in walking distance of Universal Studios. Friends were staying at the Hilton next door and the bar was of no comparison. Layout was bad and service was horrific! Belvoir all the way!

title: A challenging visit
comment: Room was not fully cleaned upon arrival and toilet did not work. Little help from staff

title: Recommendation
comment: We stayed in this hotel for 2 days during our New-England-Tour. The room was nice & clean and the view spectacular!

title: Meet my needs
comment: I stayed here for an event at Cobb Galleria. Room meet my needs but I counted off for room comfort because the sofa springs seemed to have been broken or something. When I sat on the sofa I kept going almost to the floor. I'm pretty sure it was a sofa bed and I'm glad I didn't have to sleep on it. Can't imagine how uncomfortable it would have been. This was the only issue and not a deal breaker.

title: Dirty room, slow valet
comment: Found another persons socks in room. Also, found old trash in corner. Bathtub had black sediment coming up from drain.

everyoneShouldKnow: Newly refurbished AND excellent location in Midtown.
title: Excellent Location
comment: Prompt check in and greeted warmly by hotel reservation staff. Great room service, located close by to Central Park, Times Square. Personally greeted warmly each morning of stay by room cleaning staff. Buffet breakfast and wait staff excellent. Definitely will stay at hotel upon next visit to NYC.

title: This hotel has a wonderful location.
comment: This hotel was within walking distance to the Spirit of Norfolk. I have never used valet parking and it was exceptional. The staff was friendly and met all of my needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Park near one of the entrances closest to your room.
title: Warm and Personalized Service
comment: Matt greeted me at the front desk, and I felt more like a family member than a guest. His suggestions made my 5 days in Burlington more enjoyable. Ann welcomed me into the Club like she was welcoming me into her home. She was gracious and helpful. And, I love the green option of not having housekeeping daily. Can't wait to return!

title: Nice Hotel - Good Ammenities - Staff not the friendliest
comment: We came for a conference at the Hynes convention center. The hotel met our expectations for being an upper end hotel. Our only draw back was the front desk staff (not all but most of them).

title: this hotel was very clean
comment: even though our stay was short at the Belvoir in Roanoke, it met and exceeded all our expectations. Everyone one was friendly when we asked questions, room was very clean, beds very comfortable. We were not able to take advantage of the spa, fitness center or pool, but those facilities looked very inviting.

title: Great location
comment: Perfect location without actually staying in French Quarter. Beds and pillows were very nice and comfortable

title: Clean Hotel
comment: We enjoyed our stay at this very comfortable and clean hotel. The food was so, so. The one issue that we had was that the doors slam making a lot of noise, so unless you have conscientious neighbors, it can be a bit annoying. Would stay there again though.

title: Very nice facility - Great location
comment: Nice pool area and the staff was outstanding. Very friendly and willing to help make the stay better.

title: Great location for entertainment access
comment: Shuttles and rail are close by to get to many of the venues for concerts and family entertainment. Food service is very good. Pool area needs some updating.

title: tower rooms need work
comment: Tower rooms very small, floor not level, would not stay in that section again.

title: dr
comment: This hotel has great features.

title: good
comment: it was a pleasant stay

title: Exceptional staff & facility
comment: My husband & I visited during the LA County Fair (Sept '12) and had a wonderful stay! Our early check in went smoothly and very quick! Valets asked each car at the driveway if they were there to valet for the fair or to check into the hotel. We were sent to the valet, where they checked our name against the guest list & gave us a parking pass to self park for free! Great, since we dropped off bags at the door and parked just steps away.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a great value and convenient location.
title: Exceptional Hotel
comment: This hotel was very conveniently located and met our needs while in the city. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. It was a great value for the money spent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and look, however not so great rooms.
title: Not at all what I expected
comment: I've stayed in other Grandbourne Resorts before and have been very pleased. This is the first time I have stayed in a Belvoir (5 star#. I was not impressed whatsoever. The air conditioner would not lower and the bathroom was dirty. There was something blue running down the shower sides and the the tub would not drain #up to my ankles in dirty water). I noted these issues to the staff and left a card with my comments. The bed and the location were the best things about our stay. I was expecting so much more - especially for the price. I've stayed at 3 star hotels that were much cleaner and ejoyable. Very disappointed.

title: room changes
comment: Our first room didn't smell clean; it had a musty odor, so we requested a room change. We were accommodated and switched rooms but didn't have a mini fridge, so we requested another room change, and that was granted. Thank you.

title: Excellent staff
comment: Great location and friendly ,helpfull staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are amazing, I got a wonderful nites rest
title: This hotel has a great view of ocean
comment: I had a wonderful view, excellent room with the most amazing bed, got a wonderful nites rest! Did not have to wait to check in very smooth check in and out!

title: I Love This Place
comment: Great hotel, love the location and all the employees are so nice and care about you. I feel like family everytime I go!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great in all aspects Staff makes you feel welcome a glad you are there
title: This hotel has the most friendly staff and always will to help.
comment: All staff spoke in passing. Great service. Food was always fantastic. Room service was delvered quickly and food and service and commincation with the ordering was the best ever. Everyone always willing to help and take the time to be very nice and helpful. Great job to all staff, it was greatly appreciated.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's still a great place to stay, but used to be even better.
title: Things have changed...
comment: And not for the better. I have stayed at this Belvoir location at least 15 times over the last 2 years and lately have been disappointed. There are several new front desk employees who are friendly, but not well trained. The food and beverage employees are still and always fantastic, but the food quality does not warrant the new higher prices. They have cut back on the hotel room amenities and are still overdoing it with the water softener. While I would still recommentd this hotel and will continue to go back, I am sincerely hopeful that you will return to the high quality, customer focused facility that you were up until a couple of months ago.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is not the most desireable.
title: Restaurant and Location
comment: The hotel restaurant's service was very slow. It took forever to get the bill.

everyoneShouldKnow: Oceanfront property, spacious rooms, restaurant/bar on property, nice pool and hot tub
title: Ms.
comment: GREAT hotel. I always say at the Belvoir Sand Key when I visit the Tampa/Clearwater area. No other place I would rather stay. Love, love, love this place. Perfect location! Oceanfront...nice beach.

title: Bad experience
comment: Prior to our visit I asked for a room not facing the construction site. We were given a room facing into private accommodation . We were next to the emergency exit which was used by smokers even though the hotel is non smoking.

everyoneShouldKnow: How well the customer is taken care of.
title: A Perfect Choice
comment: I am unable to think of a single negative comment re your hotel. The soundproof rooms are spacious and elegantly furnished. Especially appreciated the two reading chairs by the huge expanse of window, and the comfortable beds. Great shower head, and deep bathbub. The location is perfect for all the in-town restaurants we like to frequent, and sights to see.

title: Great price, BPG recognition, and location
comment: Great ay for the value. Clean and friendly staff. The club lounge was equally as nice or better than the "ditamond competitor" i stay with it"was nice for the traveling professional. Sandy in concierge was always happy and greeted me with a warm smile and kept the food stocked. Great hotel.

title: did not fullfill request
comment: upon arriving, as a Grandbourne members I was offered 3 different options for upgrades. We had chosen free wireless interenet. But upon reviewing the receipt...I noticed that the room had been charged 5.95 per night for the useage of the internet....so I did not receive any points nor free internet.

title: No Title
comment: Hotel staff and the facilities were great. Met all needs and would recommend to another for a stary at this facility.

title: Very helpful people
comment: Comfortable bed, nice staff,nice room but small, a bathtub would have been nice, shower doors noisy in rooms next door, hitting the walls, housekeeping noisy, hard to sleep in and rest

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to all of downtown Chicago
title: Awesome awesome awesome!
comment: We came to Chicago with a group of 8 from Michigan and after a lengthy train ride, the hotel was the best thing that could have happened for some weary travelers. The 32nd floor was fantastic with a view topped by none. I will definitely be staying here on my next trip and will recommend, no demand anyone to stay here that will be visiting in the future. Thanks Belvoir!

title: Beautiful Location, wonderful staff
comment: This hotel is in a beautful location although about a 15 min. drive to Kona. The food is excellent and reasonably priced given Kona prices.

title: Excellent room at the Lodge section!
comment: This hotel is all about service and comfort. Our room in the Lodge section of the hotel was large and quiet with woods and a lake view. I felt like I was in spa room at a resort. No, the furniture and bath weren't marble and gold, but this room was way more than I expected. The front desk made sure we had the best room available at our rate. Will definitely return if our travels take us this way. Only about 40 minutes from D.C.

title: Great property
comment: Good location. Easy to find. A lot of restaurants nearby. Staff was great.

title: Belvoir Kona
comment: Spectacular resort with several dining options, nice fitness center including a yoga class. The staff was very accomodating and met all my needs! I highly recommend this resort!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The hot tub is still not working.
title: hotel was clean
comment: hotel was clean staff friendly would have liked reduced parking or include in room fee.

title: Fantastic hotel
comment: Great accommendations, and wonderful personnel. So professional, friendly and helpful. Thanks to all!

everyoneShouldKnow: Its very busy and not very personable facilities are good but it can be tricky trying to get a seat or lounge around pool and bars
title: Hawaii [YEAR-0]
comment: it is a great location and great set up but very busy and not very personable I dont think I would stay there again - very small room

title: Staff were great
comment: Everyone was very cordial. We arrived Saturday around 1:00, got our room and had a great afternoon lounging by the pool as well as sitting outside and seeing my hometown. (New York skyline).

title: Excellent Customer Service
comment: Hotel: Overall the hotel was nice. The lobby and pool area were very nice and met my expectation. However, I was caught off guard when I realized 2 of the 4 buildings have motel style room entrances. Upon arrival both my rooms were already upgraded to mini suites with pool views. While the rooms were nice they defiantly look better in the online pictures.

title: Loved this hotel
comment: My son and I came to stay for a weekend getaway for some mom and son time. When we pulled up to the hotel my son was in awe over the castle-like appearance! We were immediately greeted by Chris who checked us in. He upgraded us to a poolside suite that had a door that opened from our room directly to the pool. Anytime we needed anything Chris was our guy! He even called maintenance to bring a screwdriver and help my son insert batteries into his new RC car he made at Ridemakerz. Great staff, Great hotel! Would definitely stay again and recommend!

title: BEST IN BERGEN COUNTY
comment: One of my favorite hotels. The tallest building in the area, beautiful garden, large property, very friendly and helpful staff, great BPG recognition, beautiful club lounge with very courteous hostess. Felt like home. Highly recommended. You will enjoy this BPG property. It has a fun elevator ride with a beautiful view. Lots of birds live on the property and its located amongst a beautiful mountain range.

title: A Surprise in Choo Choo
comment: My first stay at this hotel. I just checked in. This a very nice surprise. This hotel is stately and maintained well.

title: Not Told Pool Closed
comment: The rooms and staff were very good. However, I was attending a conference for 4 days and I selected this hotel rather than the conference hotel (or any of the hotels nearby) because I wanted to use the pool each day. However, the pool was closed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not to come anywhere near it and if you do have little or no expectations. DOesn't meet Belvoir standards by any means
title: Stay Away From This Hotel
comment: Arrived to check in at the hotel after calling earlier in the day to verify my room type and on Club Level and was told all in order, Arrived at hotel to be given a room on the 2nd Floor, Was told that there are no gold benefits at this property and wireless internet in room didn't work and to receive an ethernet cable took 3 phone calls and almost 2 hours. As one who stays on the road approximately 125 nights a year this hotel is far inferior to most and certainly to others in the area.

guestFrom: W Lake Rd, Lake City, PA 16423, USA
title: Trade show stay
comment: The only issue was that fitness and swim area was not available.

title: Close to Sesame Place
comment: Always stay at this Belvoir for our Sesame Place getaway. Stayed here often with my daughter when Sesame first opened in the 80s. Now we stay here with my granddaughter. This Belvoir is still comfortable but definitely shows wear and tear. For example, the bathroom did not need a paint job this time but the sink handle did not fit properly Staff is always lovely and helpful.

title: Great Property, Restaurant Needs Improvement
comment: I stay at this hotel often. The rooms are spacious but not always well maintained. This week the closet had no door. As a Platinum BPG member I definitely appreciate the Club Lounge with hot amenities in the morning. The hotel restaurant leaves much to be desired. I waited 45 minutes for a salad this week. I reported how poorly run it was to the server as well as the front desk but no one really seemed to care.

everyoneShouldKnow: If your room smells, ask to switch
title: Belvoir Birmingham
comment: The room cleanliness, layout, furnishings, etc were all fine. However, there was a very strong moldy/mildew smell in the room that was strongest when I returned to the room after an absence (the air conditioning would shut off automatically when I left the room so there was no ventilation during that time). The maid tried to spary room freshener on the filter and around the room which helped for about 15 minutes. One of the staff said it was a problem with all the rooms in that section (15th floor, tower).

everyoneShouldKnow: Coventient to both stadiums and downtown.
title: Hotel stay September [YEAR-0]
comment: Overall my stay was good. Checkin was a bit of a headache as they did not have my reservation correct. The GM'S that came in the next day had a very long checkin line. More hotel staff was needed. The first day I had to call to have my room cleaned. The staff was accomodating and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great for downtown night life
title: Belvoir Denver
comment: We come to the Denver location at least 3X a year, this time was very unsatisfactory. The shower plumbing I noticed leaked into the wall, and down the sides of the bathtub (the last stay the bathroom door didnt even close all the way cause it wasnt the same size of the doorway) What made my experience bad this time, was the breakfast staff at 1550, we waited close to five minutes for someone to seat us, and then we were told it was a buffet, and someone would be with us to get our drink order. The waiter made a point to not stop at our table, and then we watched him see 3 new tables and he even went as far as to take different routes to the back of house. After we realized we were not getting service my wife went to go to the bathroom, and I was going to complain, but the waiter ran to give us the check as he fear we may just walk away... and we did. We paid for a breakfast in our package, but we didnt pay to be avoided, or treated like we had the plague, I even was ready to start drinking liquor, but something about my wife and I made your server avoid us. We wont be going back to that place for breakfast again, nor recommend it.

title: Best Large Conference Hotel in Chicago
comment: Beautiful and comfortable renovated sleeping rooms, flexible meeting space with great flow and countless outlets and amenities, make this hotel one to return to time and again.

title: Excellent Shuttle Driver
comment: Your lady shuttle driver, sorry I did not get her name, was very friendly and service oriented!

title: Nice renovation in rooms
comment: Had to send room service back

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff at this hotel wants to deliver great service, just ask them if something isn't right, they go above and beyond to deliver!
title: Excellent Service in a Complicated City
comment: New York is complicated but during Fashion Week its times 2. Despite high occupancy, from the front desk at check in, thanks Lin, to the room, the upgrade, thanks Chelsea, to the club lounge, thanks Tommy, the stay could not have been better. Maria kept our room spotless even with all our time and work product this stay. The staff at this hotel wants to deliver great service, just ask them if something isn't right, they go above and beyond to deliver!

title: Smelly room and killing spiders
comment: My first impression while driving up to the hotel is that the neighborhood seemed less than safe. I live in Chicago and am no stranger to shady characters but having them hang around my hotel was a bit un-nerving. When I got to my room it smelled musty which I tried to look past until I started seeing spiders crawling on the walls. The staff was accomodating and offered to put me up in another hotel but by that time it was nearly midnight and I had to be up for work at 5:30AM so it hardly seemed worth it. I won't be back that is for sure.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be prepared to pay alot for food.
title: Nice Hotel-Expensive Food
comment: This hotel was very nice but the food prices in the restaurants were very high. I travel alot and this was by far the most expensive I have come across. The area around the hotel is not very safe(according to security) so walking to other restaurants is not possible. The room was comfortable and the staff was very nice. The pool was not in service so I was disappointed by that.

title: terrific location
comment: I was very happy with the stay, services, and facilities. The BPG chain is my priority when I travel.

title: Amazing Bed
comment: The bed was so comfortable and the room was very clean. The view of NYC was beautiful. My only complaint was that I ordered a simple grilled cheese and wine and it took almost three hours. Every time I called back, they advised it was on its way. I didn't get it until 11pm when I had ordered just before 8:30. Other than that, I would def stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The front desk staff is wonderful!! Agents to bellmen to shuttle drivers - all were fantastic!
title: We love the Belvoir Anaheim!
comment: We have been coming to the Belvoir Anaheim from Phoenix for many years now. We love the proximity and the convenience of the shuttle to/from Disneyland. This particular visit was a quick one, as we were making our way along the coast on our honeymoon. Alexis at the front desk was so amazing and accommodating - such a pleasure to speak with! The one and only thing we didn't care for was the overpowering smell of bleach in the sheets, and the duvet was a little too "crunchy". Aside from that, everything was PERFECT! Can't wait to come back!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very close to Crystal City and old town Alexandria,VA.
title: Within great proximity to Crystal City!
comment: This hotel was very quite and comfortable. Its proximity to Crystal City was perfect for where I wanted to go.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is terribly out of date.
title: Needs Overhaul
comment: I was really shocked that a Belvoir would be in this condition. (Old furniture, no hairdryer and old, uncomfortable bed. The biggest problem was the airconditioning and ventilation system. There was no air on the 12th floor and the system in place looked like it was from the 1970's blowing stale, moldy air.

title: We always sleep well at Belvoir
comment: Our stay was very enjoyable as usual. The young lady at the front desk, Maryelle was very helpful and very sweet. The only criticism of our stay would be that the evening appetizer time was not good. We used extra points for this for our son and ourselves and when we went upstairs at around 8 PM we found that there was not much there and what was there was cold. We have done this in the past and have never had this problem. On the other hand, breakfast was terrific!

title: BNelson
comment: Very convenient.

title: Service challenged
comment: Belvoir review  To whom it may concern:  Wanted to share our experience when recently staying at the Belvoir Marina in San Diego August 24 to 30th. Overall we enjoyed our stay but there were constant gaps in processes and communications that made our stay a bit irritating and caused extra work on our part. In addition, i shared this review with customer service, but unsurprisingly, did not get a response back. 1. It took 3 calls to the service desk and 2 days for the extra shampoo to be delivered to our room 2. We opted out for the " green" option one of the days. The next day we needed to get our room cleaned and did not post the "green" door sign. Instead, we got the 5 dollar certificate under the door. Realizing the confusion, we promptly returned the certificate to the front desk and specifically asked for the room to be cleaned. We came back at 10 at night to a dirty room. When called the front desk, the cleaning personnel were unwilling to clean the room at first, then agreed, causing us to sit outside till about 11 PM waiting.  3. I lost my sunglasses at the pool. When calling Lost and Found through the Front desk services, I had to make a new claim each day I called to check on the status. Every time I called, there was no record of my previous inquiry. I had to tell the entire story 3 days. Last day of our stay, it  sounded like someone actually recorded it, but I can not be sure since that was my last daily follow up.  4. Last night of our stay, I ordered a glass of milk to the room. The hotel charged 3 dollar delivery fee and 20% tax summing up to a modest charge of 10 dollars. Not including two call backs asking to specify the milk I wanted.  5. Finally, the bill arrived at the check out charging us for the room again, though the room was paid for in the beginning of the trip. We had to go to the front desk to dispute the charges. Luckily, all was straightened out within minutes, but it would be nice to avoid that experience in the future.  Please take my comments into consideration. That way a hotel this caliber will not appear as inefficient and lacking in service.  Sincerely

everyoneShouldKnow: You won't find a better place to stay, from the amenities to the staff-top notch all the way
title: EMERGENCY STAY
comment: I came down to FL due to my sister (who lives @ Merritt Island) having an accident and having to be admitted to the ICU at Orlando Medical Center. I checked in very late due to going directly from the airport to the hospital to be with her. I called the shuttle to pick me up at the hospital and Sylvester and the driver (John?) were extremely kind and sympathic and did all they could to help with my unique situation. Arriving at the check in desk exhausted and weary from travelling since 5am. the young man checking me in, (Mike? I hate that the names are slipping my mind as they were all so exceptional) did everything possible to make it so that my stay would be as comfortable & stressfree as possible by upgrading me to the Club level so I could take advantage of having a breakfast and snacks/drinks whenever I was not at the ICU. He made sure that I knew who the club attendant was and called ahead to let her know I was coming up and would probably need a snack and a drink (for sure!). I was met with open arms even though Sue was cleaning up the lounge for the night. She made sure I got all that I needed, was warm and genuine. I found this to be true of all the ladies in the lounge-especially Lillian, who took me and my niece under her wing and treated us like family-her kindness and warm heart were apparent from the start. She also works in the ICU so she had met my niece the day before and remembered her from there. I can't say enough about wonderful things about everyone who touched us during this difficult time and went above and beyond-you just don't find that often these days and all gave stellar service. The hotel was lovely and a welcoming, calm sanctuary each night after the chaos of being at the hospital. Luckily, my sister has a good prognoisis and was released-and although a very scary time in our lives, I'll always recall the kindness and caring that was shown to me and my family. Kudos for Belvoir for allowing their staff the lattitude to be able to step out of the box and really go the extra mile.

title: Very Fine
comment: Clean and comfortable. Only two minor issues: There was no microwave in the room (for warming up leftovers), and the pool water temp could have been a little warmer (not that big a deal if there had been a spa in which to warm up).

title: Elevator/Bellhop
comment: The hotel was great. On Mon., Sep 10th I called for a bellhop at 8:40 AM, expecting to be meeting my limo at 9 AM. Not only was I not told that one elevator was inoperable, there were tons of people trying to check out at the same time. It took an hour, two phone calls to the front desk (Jessica) and two by the chambermaid on my floor (room 406). I almost missed linking up with my aunt's funeral procession in Jamaica NY because I was unable to get a bellhop in a timely manner. I could have taken a bag down at a time, had the front desk told me that one elevator was inorperable.

title: Great location, BUT...
comment: I have stayed in this hotel 4 times now. I absolutely love the location, the staff is very nice and the rooms are clean and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location to Disneyland and convenient transportation, definately recommend.
title: Food
comment: The food was insanely expensive and not great, but the other amenities like the pool and Disneyland transportation was great

title: Perfect
comment: Great location when you have multiple meetings at the Anaheim Convention Center. A five minute walk.

title: Good over all value for the dollar
comment: Good over all value for the dollar.

title: Convenient Choice in Downtown Dallas
comment: All-around good value for the downtown Dallas area. This is my go-to hotel whenever Im in Dallas on leisure.

title: Great with a few exceptions
comment: I travel to Atlanta every week and stayed at Belvoir Gateway last week to try it out. I was really impressed with the hotel and accommodations. A few not so great things that I hope are resolved: 1) internet service was slow/spotty at times 2) there was a strange mildewy smell in the room 3) there were black spots on the caulk in several places in the shower. I assume this was mold which could have contributed to the smell.

title: Outstanding service
comment: All employees curteous, professional, and efficient.

title: conference ready
comment: great for conferences there was prenty of room and easy to access the rooms.

title: Getting better all the time
comment: I know that this hotel has been under some updates and I want to say, it is paying off! The staff was there to answer questions and find answers for us. They listen! What a great place to stay in Lake Buena Vista!

title: BPG should be ashamed of this property!
comment: This hotel is far below any BPG hotel that I have stayed at. We are in room 1223 - an BPG rewards room. The view is great, however, the room is substandard. The carpets are stained. The walls are marred with 12" long black streaks,. All of the furniture is worn. The bathroom tub tile is moldy and chipped. The white bed duvet/comforter is dirty, stained with ?. There are caked dust balls in the air conditioning vents. The phone handset/cradle is scary with grime. The wallpaper is peeling below the window. Plastic cups- really?? They are charging maximum points for minimal return. Not recommended if you are looking for quality.

everyoneShouldKnow: Remodelng can be disruptive re some noise during day, some water issues, and beleagured staff and maintenance but location is great and amenities good. Should be up to full speed post remodel. Comfy beds w great pillows.
title: Under construction/remodel til early 2013
comment: The remodeling has created some pesky issues: poorly located lobby registration desk, partially blocked street doors, poor signage, water hot or lukewarm but not cold, unfinished wall trim, faucet drip, etc but most were minor issues. Bed was very comfortable. Staff was helpful. Maintenance fixed squeak in air-conditioning quickly. Once remodel is complete the property should be up to Belvoir standards. Great location. Easy walk to Quarter, river walk, etc. Staff could sharpen up just a bit especially with all the inconveniences, but all in all everyone was helpful and pleasant. Clearly they will be happy too when the work is completed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Super friendly, comfortable relaxing hotel. Our favorite place on earth!
title: Fabulous, as always!
comment: Would have liked the Island Grill to have stayed open for dinner.

title: Concerns
comment: The room was very nice. The bed was so comfortable. The only problem I had were extra charges on my bill and High holds on my credit card. If I would not have checked my bill and credit card in advance, I would not have known about the extra charges that I never aquired. They were removed but there is still a hold for a much higher amount on my credit card that will not change until the bill is processed.

title: Great Place
comment: Firt time at this Belvoir. It is a great location. It is next to everything from The Magic Kingdom to any Highway. The service was beyond my expectation without spending a fortune on the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: They go out of their way to accommodate traveling professionals.
title: Extremely Responsive and Accommodating!
comment: As a visiting online professor with several classes ongoing, I needed scanning and multiple laptop accommodations. Some within my room and other services such as scanning to complete granting incompletes provided by business services at the front desk. This organization could not have been more responsive and professional in meeting my requests and I would not hesitate returning to this site. The entire staff was friendly and professional at all times!

title: house keeping did not show up even in the afternoon
comment: "Do not disturb sign was not on"

title: Needs updates
comment: Rooms were old and smelled horrific. Lack of hot water in the AM. When you used the toilet the sink would gurgle for a good hour after.

title: Club lounge
comment: Joe and Brian were great in the club lounge. I have been disappointed in the past with the service but Belvoir has changed everything to do with service in the club lounge.

title: no hot tub= we won't be back
comment: no hot tub= we won't be back

title: No free breakfast/internet as advertised.
comment: The Rate Information included with my confirmation stated there would be:

title: This hotel is in great location
comment: This hotel's location makes your NYC trip easy to navigate. Subway is at the corner, walking distances to great things are close, nice restaurants close by, just a wonderful experience.

title: Belvoir Hotel Experience
comment: The food for breakfast in the Club on 6th floor was less than expected. No scrambled eggs and/or potatos. The serice in the club was poor.

title: Requesting another hotel for business
comment: Have been staying at this hotel once a month for a few years due to business. Lately have been disappointed in staff curtsey and attention. I am a BPG Gold member and always stay on a Tuesday night but cannot remember the last time I was able to stay on the club level. In the past few months have had trouble with keys and had to make more than one trip to the front desk...have had trouble getting internet in the room so could not do work needed to be done...have been put in a handicapped room twice and had to request to be moved. This last check in and issues was handled by a a woman at the front desk who acted as though we were interrupting her day by standing in front of her and breathing! Usually we eat out but when I did ave occasion to eat in the restaurant it was not an enjoyable experience as the staff had to searched for and the food was tasteless. Have in the past requested and recommended this hotel because it is clean and convienent and very quiet considering its proximity to the airport but after the last stay I will now be requesting another hotel.

title: Exceptional stay, exceptional service
comment: Stayed recently for a conference and I can truly say everything from bedding to service was exceptional. High marks for a great hotel with great staff.

title: Overall a good choice for San Diego
comment: Overall a nice hotel if you can get a good deal on the rate. I'd definitely stay here again. You're still close to everything and you can park your own car. The hotel appears to be split into 3 different buildings: Marina Tower, Bay Tower, and Lanai. Marina Tower appears to be the main building (this is probably the best building since it's close to the lobby, etc.). The Bay Tower is further out on Harbor Island and the Lanai building is more like a motel-type building attached to the Marina Tower (from what I gathered).

title: Poor Service for room rate
comment: Room had not been thourghly cleaned in a long time. Caked dust in the corners of the bathroom. Empty whiskey bottles under the bed! Room not vacuumed during the 5 nights of stay.

title: excellent staff
comment: assist. mgr. took care of all of our needs.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Stayed overnight here and we were very pleased. Room was very nice and the staff were so helpful and friendly . Had a delicious dinner in the bar area. We will definitely stay here again

everyoneShouldKnow: Check out water and remote before accepting room;check bill carefully
title: Room Disappointing, Restaurant Much Better
comment: This was our second stay at this hotel. Our experience was better the first time when we had no problems with a great room. This time, however, the cold water in the sink only dribbled out. They tried to fix it but could not. They eventually offered us another room late on last day (which we declined). The TV remote also was balky, and they also eventually replaced it. The bill was incorrect (too high) the first and second times they offered it to us. Eventually it was correct. They gave us extra Grandbourne points to compensate. On the plus side the shower water was always fine, the beds were great and the restaurant was much improved at dinner. we particularly liked the option of half portions (which turned out to be quite generous for the seared tuna). Id definitely recommend it! The breakfast buffet was fine, except that they had eliminated the omelets and waffles.

title: Great Views
comment: No matter what side of the hotel you are on, you have gorgeous views.

everyoneShouldKnow: They charge to use the fitness center @ 20.00 a person. This is ridiculous. If you are an BPG member....you still get charged.
title: Nice location
comment: I have stayed at this resort 3 times now. My reflection of stars is no good as far as the use of the work out facilities. Being a BPG member and a hotel guest is sufficient in my book to NOT be charged @ 20.00 a day per guest. Im disappointed in the staff and the management team in not doing something about coplimentary gym privledges. Im not a satisfied customer as i have a real problem with 40.00 for 2 people to be using a gym facility for two hours or less.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent customer service and working to meet your needs for a great stay!
title: Would recommend and stay again.
comment: My room was set at 59 degrees upon arrival. It was freezing to say the least. I adjusted temp and went down for dinner. Upon returning to room the temp had not moved. I contacted the front desk and they went through trying a couple different settings on the temp control box. He called back 10 minutes later as he stated and nothing changed. They sent someone to the room immediately and checked into the heat. It didn't change. They arranged for another room for me and we very concerned about my needs. They definitely went out of their way to ensure I was comfortable and even brouhgt me some hot tea later. E xcellent customer service. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Great location
comment: I was an attendee at a convention and was pleased up until the last night. It was banquet night ansd we were left out in the hall like cattle for over a half hour. Then the dinner was absolutely horrible!!!!! The steak was dry and tough, the chicken drier than the stuffing. The gravy was super thick and tasteless. For the amount of money spent on this banquet I will not recommend another year there after our contract runs out. The waitress never smiled once or even acknowledged us, Just put down the plates. It was a shame.

title: Great hotel, but construction problematic
comment: Have no complaints other than there was construction going on continuously during my 6 day stay often beginning around 8 am. Lots of banging, etc. No chance of sleeping in even over the weekend. The room was spacious and the staff did what they could to accommodate. Wish we had had the option to change hotels before arriving though. Otherwise, would recommend the hotel under normal circumstances.

title: Amazing staff.
comment: Staff were fantastic; very accommodating and cheerful. Hotel was totally sold out but the service was excellent just the same.

title: nice stay
comment: The hotel had a great locale. The area was quiet and scenic and easily accessible. The food, both in the restaurant and room service, was horrible. The pizza was hard and crispy, and the best suggestion in the restaurant, the scallop dish, tasted cold and bland. The room accomodations, however, was wonderful! The pillows were the most comfy I had ever slept on. Would definitely stay here again!

title: holistic approach to planning
comment: Strategic coordination of staff balancing

everyoneShouldKnow: Get a room in the front. Highway in back very noisy at night.
title: Excellent Customer Service
comment: Hotel staff and General Manager go out of their way to make my stay comfortable. Everyone very helpful and friendly. Top notch on customer service. Housekeeping and room service could have easily been in a very expensive 5 star resort. Same goes for the restaraunt/catering staff. Well done.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not necessarily the best place on earth to do business at a convention.
title: Okay but Pricey
comment: This is the 3rd year in a row for the convention which brings me to this hotel. In general the facilities are fine and there are lots of local activities which I had limited time to experience. From a business travel standpoint the prices throughout the resort and nearby attractions are significantly above what I would typically spend on a business trip. Food prices are high and drink prices at the bar tend to be as high as the high end hotels in downtown San Francisco. If someone else is paying your travel expenses this is a okay destination. Paying my own expenses as I do I found myself looking constantly to go offsite to the surrounding areas to find more reasonable food prices. The daily resort fee and the parking fee really made the per day cost extremely high for business travel. The conference facilities are fine and they met the needs of the group fairly well. Being a grandfather of 7 I could not imagine bringing my grandkids here unless I hit the lottery. With all the other hotel options in the nearby area I'm sure there are more reasonable rates available. Just because you are at a Disney resort does not mean that you are there to hang with Mickey and should be shouldering the cost of making it the "Happiest place on earth"! Walt must have had a little bit of the bandit in his heart!

title: love our stay
comment: the staff, the room, i just love it. My only problem is the check out time. We are at Disneyland we have to check out and then go back to disneyland. You should have a special check out time for guest going to Disneyland.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel guest can be very noisy at night, which is not good if you are a business traveler that needs sleep versus a vacationer that stays up late and sleeps in.
title: Mixed hotel stay
comment: The hotel lobby area was fine although printing a plane ticket was only accomplished by the concierges desk versus a common area computer. The lobby restaurant only had a buffet choice in the morning which was not what I wanted so I passed. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated, with nice bed linen. The hallway at night was extremely noisy to the extent I was waken up every night and multiple times on one of the nights. Not the hotel's fault but a pain nevertheless.

title: friendly and great location
comment: Great location for all atractions. Great breakfast buffet. Our waitress Brenda was GREAT. went out of her way to please us.Pool area is beautiful and open late..Rooms were remodeled and clean. Great second pool for kids.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to airport, not convenient to downtown
title: Pleasant
comment: Conveniently located across from the airport with views of the city and San Diego bay, this is your standard Belvoir with relatively comfortable beds (though a bit stiff, and I really don't understand why hotels use flat sheet that pretty much always come untucked) and friendly staff. The balconies make this hotel stand out from other hotels however, if you're in the Marina tower you can choose from sunrise or sunset views. We opted for the sunset views over the marina and were not disappointed. The pool area was nice and despite complaints we heard, the pool water temperature was not bad. The Club Lounge is a nice perk if you want to grab a bite to eat and some coffee before you start your day. Parking, at $22 a day, seems overpriced, but then parking at every hotel in San Diego seems overpriced, considering there's a large asphalt lot on nearly every other corner. Nevertheless, we've stayed here before and we'll likely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's not like any Belvoir you have probably stayed in elsewhere.
title: lazy front desk personnel
comment: I asked 3 different people on 3 separate occasions to fix the sink in our room AND to turn out the lights in the adjoining meeting room that acted as a bright night light in our room. No one would do this. No one would take responsibility to fix the problems. No one of your front desk people or manager cared enough to respond. The moral of the story is if there is a problem a visitor has at this hotel, NEVER expect anyone to address it and likely only offer a feeble excuse or "sorry"!

title: Amazing View!
comment: Great place to celebrate your birthday as part of a STAYcation!

title: Cash advance
comment: I sought a $200 cash advance on my Grandbourne card from front desk and was sent off to an ATM machine. I think this was an unnecessary affront, thank you.

title: "Stay-cation"...not so much
comment: My wife and I were looking for a good "staycation" and chose to take advantage of the BPG promotion at WHPass. With so many other options in the Phoenix area, we will not be choosing this one again.

title: Very pleasant stay
comment: Staff was very polite and hotel met or exceeded all expectations. Well done.

title: Excellent Property in Wilmington, DE
comment: This is a brand new Belvoir with a unique design that caters to the business traveler. The staff was extremely customer focused on service and it is within fifteen minutes to anywhere in the wilmington area.

title: Very Disappointed
comment: We purchased the Zoo package here and was excited for the experience with our 3 yr old. They day before our arrival I called to confirm that we could get our zoo tickets from the hotel in the morning before check-in and they said that it will not be a problem. When we arrived at 10a.m. we were told we had to wait an hr b/c they needed to check us in before we could get our tickets. 1st problem. Then at the zoo we had issues using our debit card b/c the hotel was holding funds that were greater than the room charge. We paid in cash. I just suggest you confirm the process they are using so you don't have this issue. 2nd problem. Also, we booked this hotel in mid-september b/c it said it has a indoor heated pool but the water was so cold it was difficult to enjoy. 3rd problem that made our stay uncomfortable. Then the next morning getting ready I notice a large finger or toe nail on the floor next to the bed. Gross! Needs better cleaning.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Bell man service is excellent. It's a great plus for this hotel...a very big plus!
title: A warm stay
comment: I had a very pleasant time while staying here during my 5 Linx convention. I love how the bell men are at your beck and call from the moment you step foot on the grounds. KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK. However, I never felt special as a new BPG member....free breakfast should have been given to me for my entire stay no matter what price I paid. Another plus is that the food was excellent, but the drinks were a bit watered down!

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenience to the Dallas Market and wonderul staff.
title: Friendly Staff
comment: I always enjoy staying at the Belvoir Market Suites because of the convenience to the Dallas Market. In addition to this, the hotel is always clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. See you again for the next Market. Sue

title: Freezing in Phoenix
comment: There were only two room temps, freezing and hot with no air. The beds needed replacing. The one I was sleeping in was tilted just enough to interupt a good nights sleep.

title: friendly and helpful staff
comment: We have stayed at this hotel a few times, but this time we brought our dog. It was a pleasure to be so comfortable in our surroundings. We were always greeted warmly when we pulled up to the entrance of the hotel. We love all the new renovations, another great job by Grandbourne.

title: Great location to MIA
