comment: Great place to stay. Nathalie wasgreat! Arrived a day earlier & she helped with everything. Bar staff exceptional. This hotel is clean, plenty of room and close to MIA. Shuttle service was right on time! Would definetly stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Walsh is a superior front desk person!!
title: THANK YOU!!!
comment: Due to an issue with my travel agent, the hotel that I had originally book was sold out for the evening. They then book me at the Belvoir West - when I arrived, it appeared that the hotel was oversold as well so they initially did not have a room. Thanks to Walsh, he was able to find me the last room in the hotel that had not been put back into inventory after some maintenance so I was able to stay the night, otherwise the closet option would have been at the airport.

title: Great Conference
comment: Great facility for a conference. Out of this world service. Have not stayed in a hotel with a staff this good as the staff in this hotel - outstanding staff and service

title: Outstanding Customer Service
comment: I stay at this hotel monthly and I keep returning because of the outstanding customer service. Chelsea and Brittany really care about the service provided to guests. I feel as if I am returning home each visit. The renovations have made a great hotel even better!

title: The Belvoir has colorful, welcoming features.s.
comment: We found the Belvoir's staff very knowledgeable and friendly, as well as warm. However, the (due to the Mexican theme) restaurant did not offer foods I prefer, non pork products, i.e. turkey sausages, baked/roast chicken and salads. This is the reason for "average rating" in the facility met my expectations category. However, other than that our stay at the Belvoir was very rewarding.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location and easy access to airport and metro
title: Location is excellent
comment: Wonderful, quiet location with easy access to Reagan National Airport/Metro (hotel shuttle leaves every 30 minutes). Potomac River is 3 blocks East, some rooms have views; very walkable, lovely Old Alexandria neighborhood. We will definitely stay here in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not simply cordial, but a genuine friendly and accomodating staff.
title: Exceptional Front Desk staff
comment: Absolutely the best Belvoir I have stayed in with its Southern charm throughout from the comfortable room to the classic telephone booths in the lobby. It is central to everything downtown with convenient valet parking and the terrific Porter restaurant. Special thank you to the front desk staff, Ashlee and Courtney, whose genuine Chattanooga charm made my stay pleasant as they helped me navigate around the local attractions.

title: Excellent MGMT/Service/\location
comment: I am a repeat guest of this hotel. This hotel specializes in conferences and conventions and is large but, the Staff, Service and MGMT I rate as Excellent. Especially the Club Level staff, well run. The person in charge had remembered me from 2 yrs ago, my last stay, even though he sees a number of people during the year.

title: Good Honeymoon Spot
comment: Stayed 2 Nights on our honeymoon after not being satisfied at a hotel in Lihue. Belvoir is on a beautiful beach with good swimming. Rate for an oceanfront room was extremely reasonable. Staff friendly & professional. Hotel not quite as modern as others on stay, but still nice, clean, and full of Hawaiian charm. Conveniently located for south shore activities and the canyon. Would stay again if planning to stay on South Shore Kaua'i.

title: Suite was sweet!
comment: Thoroughly loved the spacious room. What a perfect place to stay overnight, go to the Fair, cruise through the Ontario outlets, and have a fabulous dinner @ Mc Kinley's! The food was excellent, the service by our waitress Melissa was really prompt and she helped me choose two excellent choices. I was impressed by the friendly, caring atmosphere.

title: 1st Time Stay
comment: I stay in MB 25-35 nights a year. This was my first stay at Belvoir. Very surprised at the competitive rates and really satisfied with the hotel and staff. I will stay again and tell others about my satisfaction. 1 issue, the parking/access to the hotel is ridiculous. Who thought that out...NOBODY.

title: Fabulous!
comment: The ambiance at this hotel was great! The grounds were immaculate!

everyoneShouldKnow: close proximity to a great Irish pub
title: the steakhouse was sub-par
comment: Shula's was really not in keeping with the standards of great Chicago steakhouses.

title: This hotel has great features.
comment: This hotel is in excellent area, close to shops, restaurants, La Jolla shores and La Jolla Cove two of the best beaches in the country, also very nice and clean hotel with good restaurant on the side.

title: Stay Sept 9 - 13, [YEAR-0]
comment: The staff is courteous and the service in the club lounge is very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring a sweater - it is cold in all areas of the hotel.
title: Club Level Room Needs Improvement
comment: The food at night in the Club Room needs to be improved. Selections were not good and many times the food was cold if it was a hot appetizer - very unappetizing. We asked for our points back because of what was offered in the room when we were there. The breakfasts were always good and Chris was very friendly and helpful. Most of the time at night it was unattended and not worth the time to go in as the food was unappealing. Requires more attention and service. We give extra points to stay on that level, and now feel it is not worth it. We complained to the hotel manager before we left. we hope to see our points refunded soon. Also, the air conditioning is set far too cold both in the lobby/atrium area and the Club Room. One day it was set at 68 and that is too cold when you are sitting eating. It is ridiculous and a waste of energy.

title: Great hotel
comment: Beautiful hotel in and out.

title: overbooked
comment: While the location and hotel facilities were excellent, the service was below average. On arrival, even with platinum level, there was a question on whether they were going to honor my reservation I had made a month earlier. This overbooking issue had a trickle down effect on their ability to provide the usual great srevice.

title: Beautiful Complex-Room a big surprise
comment: Everything about the hotel was lavish and beautiful - people all great, food & service delicious. However, room 3101 "garden view" consisted of large plant and parking lot. No view of ocean if sitting down. Adjacent wall contained coin changing machine, pop machine & washer/dryers. Surprising how many people use coin changer at all times of the night - very loud. Room clean but outdated. My husband uses cane & building 3 was far from main hotel area.

title: Consultant
comment: This hotel has a great location and a great staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally located with great views of the city and the lake.
title: Location and service
comment: Great location and excellent service.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has museum quality portraits of the Civil War on the second level.
title: My Home Away From Home
comment: My son lives in Chattanooga, TN, so when I visit him, I always stay at the Seraton Read House. It really is my "Home away from home." I can always depend on the Seraton from the beginning to the end of my trip. Beginning with courteous boys who park my car and bring my luggage to the wonderful staff who remember me to my extra comfortable room (no pillows as comfortable anywhere) to the hot, strong shower to the club room to the restaurant downstairs with white linen table cloths and wonderful food to the free Internet to the spotless, impressive lobby. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

title: Clean but needs updating
comment: Overall the hotel was okay. The room needs to be updated and the parking deck is very dark at night. The walls seemed a bit thin as I could hear my neighbor talking (or she was talking very loudly.) I would stay again based on the location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its a beautiful, relaxing and peaceful place.
title: This hotel's view from the dining area is one of the best
comment: Overall, it was a very pleasant and wonderful experience. The staff was very receptive to our needs, the hotel was very clean and most importantly, the view from the dining/bar area was out of this world! If there was one area that could improve - the yellow exterior.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service from employees was very good.
title: Great Belvoir Somewhat Isolated, Though
comment: Had a good experience at the Belvoir Sioux Falls during our one night stay in early September [YEAR-0]. We were recognized as gold members and upgraded to the Club Level Floor and to a King Size Bed....opted for the free drink. Service in the lounge was attentive and friendly. Evening hor d'oevres in the club level were good ... room was unattended so can't speak to replenishment of food items...running low when we left. Breakfast offerings in the Club Lounge were minimal .. attendant was pleasant.

title: The service was as exceptional as ever!
comment: I stayed for a convention and the staff were as polite and helpful and cheerful as ever. They took the time to get to know my name and ask how they could make my stay better. They provided service as a matter of routine, not a special offer and that's what I liked best. I look forward to my annual visit to this hotel next year!

title: Customer service needs to be improved
comment: I was very disappointed with the willingness of the front desk staff to meet my need for an early check in. Also, my reservation for a room with a king or queen bed was ignored and the response was this was the best they had.

title: Nice Hotel
comment: Hotel is in a great location. Able to park the car and walk on foot to most of the area attractions and restaurants. Staff at the front desk was helpful and met our needs. The part that needs improvement is the housekeeping. Besides emptying the trash, making the bed, and replacing towels nothing else was done. Room glasses were not exchanged for new glasses. Glasses that were left from a room service order on Thursday night were still in the room when we checked out on Sunday. Also had to track down a housekeeper and ask for toilet paper because that was not replaced.

title: Water water everywhere
comment: No issues with this hotel except that upon check in, there was water all over the floor of my bathroom along the tub. The next night, the carpet in the entry way was all wet.

title: Will stay longer next time
comment: Friendly staff, comfy beds. Only minor complaint is that bathroom was tiny.

title: One channel missing
comment: The hotel wasexcellent, very friendly check-in, `and room nice. My only problem was that I like to watch Fox News Channel, it was listed as channel 28, however I could not tune to it in my room. Went from channel 27 to 29. Otherwise I would use this hotel in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wait for 1 hour for taxi to come and check the taxi company hotel called. Either call Yellow Cab or Limousine to save time
title: Reasonably Happy Customer
comment: Good hotel

title: Belvoir Fort Lauderdale
comment: Atrium area is relaxing. Love the suite with separate sitting area and desk area.

everyoneShouldKnow: VERY professional staff. Very consistent in everything they do.
title: Excellent, with a couple minor issues
comment: I stay at this hotel very often. I like most, that it is consistent. The staff always treat me like a king - never had a poor staffing issue. From experience, I know that the longer you stay in a hotel, the more things you notice little that seemingly start bugging you - not so at this hotel. This is my favorite hotel, based on consistent performance of the hotel staff. Much Aloha living here.

title: Great location and service
comment: Great Hotel location and clean with great overall service to fit my needs. I would stay their again and recommend to freinds and family to do the same....

title: My stay
comment: Nice Hotel in a very nice place. Initial reception could improve though.

title: 2nd stay is not as expected
comment: We stayed 3 nights (Sept 7,8,9) before travelled to Maui, the first 3 nights were great. We retuned for another 2 nights (Sept 12, 13), checked in late on Sept 12 and I did not have time to do much other than going straight to bed. The morning after, I saw a crochroach on the wall, We had to packed and moved to another room. The new room was nice but it faces the pool and the door to the bacony is extremely heavy to open. We did not want to move again as we did not have much time left.

everyoneShouldKnow: easy on/off access from I4. Neat and clean facility and very friendly staff
title: Conference
comment: I attended a conference at the Belvoir and the set up was fantastic along with the food. The overnight room was comfortable and clean and the staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Beautiful Location & Beautiful Views!
comment: I was here for a conference in Sept. I originally had a King bed room booked but was changed to 2 doubles on check-in to prevent being near the pool. Room was comfortable except the a/c did not seem to work consistently. Not too big of deal but it did get stuffy even though the thermostat was set to 65. The hard-wired Internet connection in the room was horrible. There was no documentation in the room explaining the wireless but I figured it out after some time and that seemed a bit more stable oddly enough. The sink in the bathroom had trouble draining the last 2 days of my stay. I did not report it but apparently housekeeping must have. Someone was fixing the room next door at 10:30 p.m. on my last night stay. I happened to be up but if I was sleeping that would have woken me up. Good news is the sink drained like a charm the next morning! I really do like this hotel and would recommend it. Nothing I ran into would prevent me from staying in the future.

title: Met the challenge
comment: Check-in was an issue, but management took care of the situation and made me a happy customer.

everyoneShouldKnow: nice bar & restaurant, but rooms need remodeling
title: Needs a good cleaning
comment: The carpets & chairs were covered with spots and black mold on the grout in the shower. Yuck!

title: Service and cleaningness
comment: The hotel looks nice, but when it comes to cleaningness and service they still have a very loong way to go.

title: Old Hotel
comment: The room was very musty and the entire hotel needs renovation.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Consistent with Disney quality of service.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's very clean...people were polite...and it'sin walking distance to anything in the inner harbor. Fantastic!
title: Didn't want to leave!
comment: We wanted to book a room close to the inner harbor, and this room was just what we wanted!

title: nice hotel, horrible food
comment: Ordered room service on arrival, took forever to get it and when I did the sandwich on the bread was wet, not moist, but wet and not edible, considering how late it was and how long it took to get it the first time I just skipped dinner and went to bed. Since I was starving the next morning I went to the breakfast buffet, several items were out so I had a sausage and biscuit and called it a day, overall bad food and food related service

title: hotel service
comment: I was impressed when one of the desk staff escorted me to the Starbucks area when I was looking for a computer to print something. He took the time to explain details of logging on, etc and was very courteous.

everyoneShouldKnow: The bar is too small and too slow for taking customers for a drink. Leave the hotel for drink.
title: Room Upgrades
comment: I was unable to get a room with a king bed when I made my reservation. Before I arrived, I was sent an E-Mail asking if I were interested in upgrading my room. I responded, yes. When I got to the hotel, upgrades were not available. Why was ever sent the E-Mail in the first place ?

title: Great Stay
comment: We met at the Belvoir Steamboat Resort for a conference. The staff was friendly. The food was excellent. The room was clean, had good decor, and a nice flow to it.

title: Great stay in Chicago
comment: I stayed ay the Chicago Belvoir Hotels and Towers for the [YEAR-0] NHLA Convention.Had a great experience. Room was really cozy and sevice was excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Walk the boardwalk to the USS Wisconsin
title: Location Location Location
comment: The location and the weather together with helpful staff and a good meeting layout combined to provide us excellent support for our meeting. Thank you,

title: Great location but below BPG category 5
comment: The hotel is in a great location if you want to be in the center of Waikiki. The rooms have not been updated in years and below average. The fitness center has antiquated equipment and the bathroom is 2 floors away!. The resort charge is a joke and I suspect almost no guest uses any of the benefits offered. That charge should be a credit of $50.

title: Excellent accomodations
comment: The facility exceeded my expectations. The room was very comfortable and access to the Club Lounge was an unexpected bonus. I will definitely stay at this facility on my next trip to the area.

title: Thin Walls
comment: Was able to hear the person next door snoring all night.

title: little treasure
comment: although out of the crowds of the city center...this stay was very relaxing,, the pool and bar convienient and the public beach across the street wonderful...

everyoneShouldKnow: Every one is helpful and has a smile. Nicely done.
title: General Comments
comment: Very helpful and always a smile.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is clean and well managed
title: Exceptional
comment: This property is well managed and is clean, unlike the other property located downtown I hardly recommend any business person stay here, if you can avoid the one downtown.

title: Great Location
comment: The location is great, however, the parking there is terrible. The hotel does not have ammenities like fridges in the room and extremely slow internet access for the business traveler.

title: this hotel is conveniently located and very friendly
comment: The hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Cafe and resturant very slow service. My room was dirty and phone did not work so I could not even call to complain
title: Arlington Tx
comment: The Phone and TV were unplugged and once I tried to plug everything in, I saw why, it was a mess. I never did get the phone to work. The room was less than clean, dusty and the bathroom floor was very dirty.

title: Needs a lot of work
comment: The restaurant chairs have a horrible black layer of dirt and grease on them - every single chair in the place! As you sit on them it warms up and becomes sticky. This is disgusting. I had to put a napkin between the seat and I.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be sure to ask for a room with a downtown/river view. It's spectacular at night.
title: Room with a view
comment: This is now my "go to" hotel in Louisville. It is full service, with multiple restaurants nearby, most with patios and great views of downtown. However, is is much more reasonably priced compared to hotels in downtown Louisville, which have less to offer and charge for parking (I love that it's free here). Pool and fitness center are great, too.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its perfect location for a buisness traveler and very comfortable after a long plane ride. Also the staff takes genuine care of you.
title: Friendly Staff
comment: The second I got on the shuttle I was warmly welcomed and it continued throughout my stay. You can tell the difference from a Grandbourne hotel versus any other.

title: Slow Internet
comment: When I purchased and used the basic internet ethernet services I had many terminations due to slow response of server. Yours, not the server I was accessing.

title: Average stay
comment: When my check in did not go as planned I made sure to again state the I need my receipt emailed to me. when I received a receipt under the door, I realized that did not work. I called the desk and they said it would be sent right away. It wasn't. I had to call the hotel a third time (after I had checked out) and request my receipt to be emailed. Expenses were due the next day and I didn't have time to wait. Usually a great hotel, but I shouldn't have to ask for something 3 times.

title: Great place but expensive
comment: I understand that this is possibly the normal now but... $7.50 for a bottle of water. But what is most upsetting is the rate of wi-fi in the rooms, thats just morally wrong.

title: felt like business trip not vacation
comment: we stayed for 2 nights. had slight problems with plumbing, but it was taking care of right away. staff was very helpful but i didn't like the fact, that housekeeping came to the room before 11:00am to clean the room. the food was amazing at the BlueZoo.and the place felt like we were on a business trip two many conventions not a vacation place.

everyoneShouldKnow: Cleaning services and management are not up to par.
title: My room was not fit for staying
comment: The slate floor in the foyer was disgusting. There was a leak from what appeared to be the refrigerator and I had to call guest services to clean it. Upon my return, the wetness was dry, but the floor was sticky and disgusting to step on barefoot (so I didn't). The refrigerator did not work, and I had to call the manager to replace it. Overall, not what I expected from a hotel of this caliber, and certainly not what I expected for being a Grandbourne owner.

title: excellent hotel, great location & terrific staff!
comment: I highly recommend this hotel. The location is perfect for Philadelphia, and the staff is fabulous!!!

title: Convenient, clean and comfortable
comment: Centrally located, clean and comfortable, this hotel is a good choice for travelers. Comfortable bed pillows are a must for me and this hotel has them.

title: Wonderful Stay
comment: My stay at the Belvoir was ourstanding. The room was very clean and had a beautiful view of New York. The meals were delicious, and I enjoyed the health and fitness center. The staff was friendly, and I had an excellent experience at the front desk when I checked in. I look forward to returning to the Belvoir.

title: Warning
comment: The hotel should have advised me of the fact that the lobby area is under construction as I have been here several times and the lobby area was a place to gather. Also, I asked for, and was confirmed in an upper level room and received a lower level handicapped room with a shower that floded the bathroom every time it was used and a bathroom light that was hanging off the fixture and not secured to the wall. Room service was over 15 minutes late, at 6:00am

title: Judge
comment: This hotel was very clean and comfortable. Meals were wonderful..

title: Almost Perfect
comment: Everything from the service to the fitness center where outstanding. Only issue was the shower. They improved it while I was there, but it still had weak water pressure and poor performance. I expect more for a hotel that did everything else correctly.

title: housekeeping
comment: very helpful, when i called front desk to have extra blankets, they came right away.

title: Sept [YEAR-0] stay
comment: Overall, the stay was comfortable and convenient. However, the restaurant food quality and selection was not up to standard from past stays. Food was overpriced and poor to fair in quality. The guest room on the fifth floor was not open at convenient times.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have reservations here, I would suggest that you contact the hotel directly and request a room that has already been renovated.
title: Decline in quality since last visit in [YEAR-1]
comment: This hotel has declined in service, cleaniness and amenities since I stayed here last ([YEAR-1]). My reservation was for three rooms and none of them met our standards. The front desk superviosr at check-in was incredibly slow and could not even pronounce Sher-a-ton (but said She-RAT-on). The sofa in the lobby was shabby, the carpet in the rooms was dirty. Some rooms had issues with the plumbing, door locks and security lock. The elevators are very slow. I expressed concerns at check-out and was told that the hotel was undergoing renovation. My staff has requested that I not book rooms here again.

title: Great location
comment: check in flwaless, valet was professional and all staff was very friendly.

title: Best price/quality ratio experienced in New York!!!
comment: I was vary satisfied with the room (both for the size and the view on Midtown skyscrapers), the very helpful and nice staff, the location of the hotel, the cleanliness. Overall I think this a very good price/quality ratio in New York. I would reccomend it!

title: Great Staff and Location
comment: My company held our annual conference at this hotel and the staff went above and beyond in everything. Everything was clean, the staff was polite and helpful and we got a lot of good feedback from our guest as well.

title: Excellent servIce, great staff
comment: Even through rooms are beginning to look a little worn around the edges, the service and staff are excellent. I would definitely stay here again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Not clean !!! Hair in the bathroom (and it was not mine !!).
title: Your Hotel needs help asap !!
comment: 1. Carpets needs a good cleaning in the lobby / elevator area. 2. Free Computers near the lounge stink. The keyboard keys are worn out. Can't see the letters!! 3. Check-out very slow ..... why can you just "drop off' the room key on exit if you don't have any extras on the bill? You will save a lot in labor costs. 4. Room not clean - hairs (and not mine !!) in the bathroom.

title: Our Stay at the Belvoir in Portland
comment: My husband and I spent one night in the hotel, so can't rate what several nights might be like. However, the room was extremely clean and comfortable with plenty of amenities.

title: Pleasant, treated very well, restful
comment: The staff was great upon arrival and in every other regard. Room was clean, well appointed and very comfortable. Excellent bed and linens.

title: Taken Care Of During the BMW Championship
comment: This hotel is awesome. Great staff, great facilities, dog friendly and great atmosphere. I took my wife here for her 40th Birthday and we were lucky enough to be staying with all of the PGA professionals playing in the BMW Championship. Jim Furyk is a great guy. Both my wife and I being huge golf fans, this was like a BPG MOMENT. Even though there was a lot going on at the hotel over this weekend, we we truly treated like cherished Platinum members and our dog was like one of the family. No doubt I would stay here again. If I would have had more of my Platinum Thank You cards, I would have used them. Great experience.

title: Great Hotel
comment: This hotel is always trying to improve the service. The club lounge has been improving ever since Bruce joined. They are very accomodative on guests' needs. Front desk manager Dustin is always helpful and gets things done. Debbie is super friendly and very effecient. This hotel is one of the best Belvoir I have ever stayed.

title: Good, but missed the mark.
comment: Room was not as clean as you would expect from this type hotel. Even though we notified you that 4 would be in the room, we only had 2 coffee cups for coffee that morning. My 11 year old grandson wanted to swim, but the pool was cold. Not quite as enjoyable as we hoped.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bed where very comfortable and your pillows are to die for.
title: Hotel has very friendly and courteous staff.
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. It was very clean and the staff were friendly and courteous to our large group. I also enjoyed the location of the hotel it was in walling distance to the harbor.

everyoneShouldKnow: The look and feel is above first class
title: Loved this hotel - Would definitely return
comment: We stayed this past weekend and had a wonderful time. This hotel is absolutely beautiful. Our room was spacious and very clean. The service was exceptional - they made us feel like honored guests. I would highly recommend a stay here and we will return.

title: Many Disappointments
comment: I had some business in KC and brought my family with me so we could have a mini-vacation. We checked in fine and went with the valet parking the first night as we got in late. Upon entering our room we all commented how foul is smelled. After some searching around I discovered that there was stool in the toilet from a previous guest. And to make matters worse the toilet would not flush! I immediately called guest services to complain and I was hopeful they would offer us a different room. Instead we spent our first evening sitting/sleeping with the stink of stool in the air, waiting for the janitorial staff to repair the toilet (they came about 15 minutes after I called guest services and spent 15 minutes repairing the toilet).

everyoneShouldKnow: I stayed for a whole week, and all of the staff were friendly, approachable, and helpful.
title: Customer Service was very good
comment: The staff were very friendly and helpful. From the front desk, to the servers in the restaurant, to the people who delivered my room service. I was extremely impressed.

everyoneShouldKnow: very high price for facility quality
title: Needs improvement relative to pricing
comment: I was quite surprised at the lower quality room features given the exhorbitant pricing...

title: Mrs.
comment: It was fine. Good location for us.

title: Staff
comment: Despite giving feedback that service did not meet expectations, no change was made. My room service was late, cold and portions inedible. When I called to explain, response was let me look into that ... The clerk who checked me out of the hotel was not friendly. Even when I pointed this out, she did not acknowledge statement.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best place to stay in Kona because of its staff, quality, location, food options and view.
title: This resort is plush and staff is incredible
comment: I have stayed at this resort many times and was quite impressed to see the huge renovation project completed since my last visit. The facilities are incredible and this is the nicest hotel you can find in Kona.

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer Service by ALL staff we encountered was outstanding!! Everyone was helpful, pleasant, & they exceeded our expectations.
title: Wonderful Staff & Great Location
comment: My cousin & I booked a 2 night stay at the Belvoir Universal (Hollywood, CA) & we had an excellent experience. The hotel staff was wonderful! From the moment we arrived we felt very welcomed. The valet, front desk, & club lounge staff were all so pleasant & accomodating. We will confidently recommend this property to friends & family. I can honestly say we look foward to a return stay at the Belvoir Universal!

everyoneShouldKnow: Small room, No refrigerator , sheet like snad paper
title: notimpressed
comment: The staff was very professional, polite and showed concern. The room was ok but nothing great. No refrigerator and I found this very surprising. I did not expect a kitchen but a refrigerator for drinks and medication. The sheets we like sand paper so wear PJ. Like I said the hotel is Ok, just OK.

title: Love this hotel
comment: My friend and I stayed here for a girls weekend getaway. We had the best first impression at the check in desk with Josh who was so friendly and offered directions and was very welcoming. We loved our room, especially your pillows, I wish I had one for my own! :) I had the best night sleep I have had in a long time because your pillows and bed was so comfortable!

title: Lots of amenities, good location
comment: Lots of amenities, good location

everyoneShouldKnow: Older property in need of serious renovation
title: Aged, subpar, and wet room
comment: Was attending a conference at this hotel and stayed for convenience. Room was humid and smelled of smoke. So much though that my clothing and the bedding were noticeably damp, borderline on wet. Air conditioner simply could not pull out any humidity and they've never gotten the original smoke odor out of the room I was in. Front desk staff was ambivalent. Location is also directly across from airport and secluded from the city. WiFi has a $12 option for half meg and $18 option for 3 meg. Seriously??? Will not return.

title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
comment: Location, Location, Location. Perfect hotel for anyone attending an event in downtown Phoenix

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff and beautifully redone rooms
title: Honoring The Aloha Spirit
comment: The hotel is so much more inviting and warm with the aloha spirit. Your staff from the bellmen to the check in all warm filled with aloha. Love the Sig Zane new look. About time we honor our local artist and salute what we have here in Hawaii.

everyoneShouldKnow: it's a vacation spot, not a conference hotel
title: Wrong Hotel for a Conference
comment: This is a resort hotel and I went for a conference. There were 2 other conferences booked there as well. The rooms were freezing the entire time, which made it very difficult and facilities could do nothing about it, and the site is focused on DISNEY. When I found out my rental car battery had died, the facility was no help because their charger 'was broken'. REALLY???

title: Water outage/ Cold Showers
comment: The hotel is beautiful, my room was nice and clean. Unfortunately, I can't give 5 stars because of the temporary water outage and the cold showers I had to take. I was staying there on business and Thursday morning on Sept. 13th I had no water at all and after waiting about 30 mins it came on but only cold water. On top of taking a cold shower I was late to my workshop. Friday morning I had water but no hot water again.

title: Beautiful hotel and caring staff
comment: This hotel is beautiful, impeccably clean and has an efficient, caring staff. I could not have been happier with my stay and I will recommend this property every time I have the opportunity to do so!

everyoneShouldKnow: The restuarant has very good food and drinks
title: Bed in room 238 was horrible.
comment: I had a room with a very nice appearance however, the bed was not comfortable. I was told that the bed was new and that nobody had ever complained about it. No one bother to check to see if the bed mattress was perhaps on the wrong side since the bed was suppose to be cushioned they simply offered me a comforter to put on top of the bed to make it softer. It felt like i was sleeping on the box spring. I was not offered another room.

title: Nice Hotel, Terrible WiFi
comment: The hotel is large and beautiful. The thick shades in the room allowed for a pleasant sleep in the dark.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff at this Hotel are wonderful!
title: Great Conference
comment: The Belvoir Downtown Orlando was the perfect spot for our conference. The service was outstanding and the rooms were comfortable and very clean. The food in the hotel was also very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Located in an area with a variety of shops, restaurants, etc. within easy walking distance.
title: Contracting Officer
comment: Nice hotel overall, however some of the rooms need to be renovated. I stayed on the 15th floor in a room with VERY cramped bathroom facilities.

title: Southern Hospitality at its best
comment: Hotel not so bad,could use some update but found the staff to be excellent.We were on club floor & food was better than expected in lounge.We stoped by on last evening before checkout next moring to say thanks we would be leaving,the lady said i will see you @ breakfast. I told her we would be leaving early, she said i'll be in @ 5 so you can have breakfast.That's going the extra mile.we will stay here next time.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Service was outstand from the front desk to house keeping.
title: Hotel Stay
comment: Everything was great during my stay from the 13th of September to the 14th and Ms. Jordan on the front desk was very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Professional and friendly Staff including exceptional above average rooms.
title: Better than I ever expected!
comment: From the moment my family arrived we were treated like royalty. The lobby looks like it was cut out of a magazine with elegance and prestige. My wife just couldn't get over it!

title: 100% Better than expected
comment: I wasn't expecting the quality and value that this location provided and it was a welcome surprise. I will definitely use this hotel again if I am in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in the center of town, close to everything
title: This hotel has a great Club Floor
comment: The added cost for the club floor are well worth it, the food, beverages and relaxation were just what we needed after traveling all day.

title: The staff was wonderful!
comment: We arrived a day early at the hotel and Jessica and Laura at the front desk went out of their way to make sure we not only got a room but, could use our points for our stay. Thank you so much!

title: Close to San Diego activities
comment: Hotel was nice and staff was pleasant but not overly personable except for staff in the spa area. Was told on the phone that most people request Bay Tower and that it was newly refurbished. Have stayed in both towers and Marina tower is definitely nicer and newer. Need more hooks or towel bars in the bathrooms.

title: Great pillows and sheets
comment: The pillows and bed was great. The room was clean and the AC worked well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Scott the shuttle driver was excellent and helped me get to Metra! Very personable and friendly, and a true asset to your place!
title: Great place for Wedding party!
comment: Thanks for being such gracious hosts to the our family for a wonderful wedding celebration!! Your place was very accommodating and even put up with our crazy crews!!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a great place to get a good night's sleep
title: Great Location / Great Access
comment: This hotel is just across the street from the Stoneridge Mall, with several great places to eat, The staff was also helpful in providing a listing of dinning options in the surrounding area. Large convienent parking and single entry provide addition security in this business park setting. The setting is lovely with well maintained grounds and lots of trees.

title: Don't Call
comment: Wow- for the price you don't even receive a free breakfast. I would rather stay at a hotel with a free continental breakfast! I was disappointed in that they didn't give me the code for free internet- you have to ask for it. Other hotels write in on the room key envelope or tell you right away at check in. The bathroom is only large enough for one person. You have to totally be in the bathroom to even close the door for privacy. There is only one mirror (bathroom) in the whole place. Traveling with a group of ladies who like to do hair need more mirrors so that the bathroom doesn't need to be occupied by someone primping. What took the cake, however, was the lack of communication. I gave my email to have them email me my receipt; I got home and did not receive it and had to call them because I wondered why a prepaid room still had to have a $50.00 charge deposit go through my bank account. They do not tell you about this "hidden" charge before hand; also learned that it takes from 1-10 days for it to be reversed! I also had to wait for 25 minutes on hold. The lady broke the 25 minutes up by saying, "this is ....., please hold." I already had been holding a very long time, so I said, "NO!" But lack of sympathy. "Well, I have to get this other call, please hold..." She didn't even wait for me to respond. HOW RUDE. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. My husband and I are from the Kenai Peninsula and TRAVEL A LOT. We value communication and customer service. We will spend our money elsewhere. Also there is about a one inch gap under the front door, so if people are noisy in the hallway you hear it! I didn't mind the train though; it is close but not that close to be bothersome!

title: Rocking Hotel!!!
comment: Great place to stay. Wonderful staff and terrific hotel!

title: Great value in Tampa
comment: This is an older Belvoir, but it has been thoroughly refurbished. The new beds were outstanding and the room was nicely furnished. Front desk staff were really eager to please and delivered great service.

title: Better than last visit
comment: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times this year, and this was the best yet. I has able to get one of the newly renovated rooms. The bed was much nicer than the last one I previously used and the room was very clean. Hopefully the elevators are updated soon, as they are very slow.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location - away from the drama of Duval St.
title: Excellent Location- comfortable suite
comment: This hotel provided the perfect location for our Key West Vacation. Convenient to everything but away from the hustle and bustle of Duval.

title: Exceptional comfort
comment: Super comfy bed and GREAT shower!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff at the front desk are wonderful!
title: Room needs some updating
comment: The rooms are fine, but need some updating. The towels in the bathroom are very thin and scratchy. I stay here regularly, and many of the rooms have had their closet doors removed, leaving and odd atmosphere and no full length mirrors available.

title: Perfectly Adequate and Pleasantly Surprised
comment: I am always a bit nervous about staying in the airport hotels. Thankfully the hotel was a pleasant surprise. Clean hotel. Comfortable and quiet room (11th floor)... Although a suite upgrade wasnt available when i checked in :( the gentleman was accommodating in my request for a good room...

title: Business Travelers to Towson
comment: Great place to stay for business right next to the Towson Town Center. You won't be bored at night after your conference/meeting.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't miss the free guided cultural events and walking tours.
title: Great Facility
comment: The hotel itself is located in Hawaiian ancient grounds. I particularly enjoyed the free guided walking tours to the ancient grounds around and in the property. Very enlightening and delightful. Do not miss this free feature.

title: excellent bar menu
comment: We ordered the quesadilla from the bar menu after hours, and it was excellent. Well worth the money.

title: Very impressive
comment: I booked this hotel using my BPG points. Very pleasantly surprised. The location is a bit far from the busy center but I liked it being quiet and relaxing. There is good shuttle service and the bus stops at the facility.

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir New York. Although room a bit small, it was very clean and comfortable. Location was great. We could see Times Square from our window. Would stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent friendly staff. Great location. Free shuttle service to and from Universal Studios.
title: We had a great 3 night stay.
comment: All staff very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. We slept well all 3 nights. The room and bathroom very clean. Even though 2 weddings and a High School reunion were taking place, we were not distrubed by any of the parties. The free shuttle to and from Universal Studios was another reason we stayed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff at Camp Dolphin were lovely.
title: Wonderful Experience
comment: I have stayed at both the Dolphin and Swan in Orlando several times. The staff is very accommodating, the rooms were great. Camp Dolphin was a brilliant bonus! The restaurants are fabulous and convenient. You can't get a better location for Epcot and Hollywood Studios! Overall terrific experience!

title: This hotel covers all needs
comment: Whatever the needs are, the staff does everything to cover them

title: Excellent Facility
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir 28 June [YEAR-0] though 12 July [YEAR-0] and really liked the location and facilities, in fact we have now booked for next year.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay somewhere else; there are plenty of others in the area; extremely pricey for the level of amenities
title: Recent Stay
comment: I was extremely disappointed in the level of amenities my room had considering the charge of $139/night. I've stayed at many other facilities for less money and had a refrigerator and microwave in my room. I thought the prices of your food was high considering I was there for a class and given a limited amount of time for my lunch hour. The water temperature in my shower was lukewarm (not hot) and the faucet made horrible noises. When I went to check out and was standing at the desk, the young girl didn't say, "Can I help you, etc." She just stood there and looked at me and waited for me to speak. When I told her about the water and faucet issues, she said she would tell someone; however, you could tell from response/body language, that my comments were going no where.

title: The service and people are wonderful!
comment: The hotel had great features and is situated in close proximity to many restaurants and shops.

title: Grandbourne Quality
comment: I've found that the best thing about staying at any Grandbourne hotel, whether it's Dublin, Ireland or Nashville, TN is that the staff is incredibly courteous and attentive. It means a lot to someone who travels alone on business to be greeted after a very long flight in the wee hours of morning (or in the middle of the night) with a smile and such a sincere "How can I help you?" It can turn a bad day into a good one.

title: Phoenix AZ
comment: Everyone and everything was excellent.

title: One bad apple spoils the whole basket
comment: The front desk prior to my arrival answered my questions with "that's no my job", it when down hill from there.

title: perfect for our stay
comment: Even though we only stayed one night, we were able to have a 4pm check out and enjoy most of the next day

everyoneShouldKnow: Location for the best beach on Kauai.
title: This is our fifth stay
comment: We love the island of Kauai and look forward to our stay at the Belvoir, but had disappointments this visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very Clean and up to date/
title: Awesome Hotel
comment: We just recently stayed at this Hotel and were very pleased to learn that there was free internet use in the rooms and complimentary Starbucks Coffee each morning. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the outdoor pool was so beautiful with the huge fountain in the middle. We will definitely be coming back to this Hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in the heart of NYC life
title: Great Experience
comment: This was a new experience get-a-way for our relationship. The opportunity to stay at the Belvoir was something we've never experienced before and it, by far, exceeded expectations. Our stay helped solidify how great it is to visit NYC!

title: Ultimate luxury
comment: From check in until check out I found this resort met or exceeded my every wish or request. What more could I ask for?

title: IMTS [YEAR-0]
comment: Excellent location, friendly staff

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff at the hotel really express the Aloha spirit of the Hawaiian Islands.
title: Our annual visit
comment: My wife and I first visited Hawaii in [YEAR-7] and stayed here to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. That started the beginning of an annual tradition. The room views are terrific and it's close to the ocean. The staff is friendly and always ready to help make your stay comfortable. It's nice having two pools so when you want to just relax the Infinity pool is a great place for the adults to retreat to. There is shopping and fine food on site and the Waikiki night life is a short walk away. If you only plan to visit Waikiki once in your life this is a must place to stay at.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pay to park in the garage and leave your car there. You can walk to anything in downtown Portsmouth from the hotel.
title: Location, Location, Location
comment: In addition to an ideal location in Portsmouth, the staff of the Belvoir is exceptional. Very helpful and warm. The wonderful woman who staffs the Club Lounge in the mornings is a real asset to the Belvoir. The only thing that detracts from this property is the $15 garage or $10 parking lot (across the street) charge.

title: Great location, but some maintenance issues
comment: The fantastic location was by far the biggest draw for the hotel. Rooms were comfortable and clean. My primary gripe is that there were maintenance issues in the bathroom that had to be reported on two successive days before they were repaired. Similarly, the soda machine on our floor did not work throughout our stay.

title: This hotel needs to be upgraded
comment: There was no wifi in the room unless you paid for it. My hot spot device did not work. You had to pay to use the fitness center. The room was dark unless you opened the draperies on to the parking lot. The layout was circuitous for the meetings. I had to ask 2 times to have cobwebs/spiders removed from elevator light. Remote on TV had to be replaced. Remote was terribly slow. Bad odor in hallway.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice value for a newly renovated hotel.
title: Clean hotel that offers value by the beach....
comment: I am a frequent guest at this hotel. I love the improvements, the generous upgrades as a Platinum member, and the new room service menu. The staff is always very friendly and I have never had an issue with housekeeping.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not a great hotel for the business traveller.
title: Internet Down
comment: The hotel was pleasent in appearence, No concerige from what I saw, no one to meet us with our bags on arrival. Front staff seemed very inexperienced.Most importantly the internet was down most of the trip, and because our room was far from reception, the short time it was up the signal was not strong enough in room. Reception said they have had problem with internet for weeks. I lost a client as a result.

everyoneShouldKnow: No more forgetting your electronic cords/chargers with the lamps with easy access sockets!
title: For business or pleasure
comment: Everyone at this hotel is customer centric - from the front desk to the hamberger joint to the security guy that helped me get back in my room after I locked myself out of my room. The only downside of the experience is the lighting in the bathroom makes it difficult to do makeup. The highside, the lamps they have installed in the room itself are great, each has two outlets for your electronics, no more having to look behind the beds.

title: Great Place to Stay !!
comment: I came to the facility for the first time because of a conference. It was GREAT !! I will now return with my family.

title: GREAT BUSINESS HOTEL CLOSE TO THE BEACH!
comment: An oasis of tranquility just a few steps away from the Ocean Front madness!

everyoneShouldKnow: Their is not much to dislike.....simply hang loose and enjoy the journey.
title: We Love the Belvoir Kauai
comment: My wife and I enjoyed a week long vacation back in [YEAR-6]. As part of our [YEAR-0] annual trek to Kauai, we decided to spend our first couple of days/nights at the SK before heading up to Princeville. Our party of ten consisted of both sons, their wives and 4 grandkids. The property was in pristine condition from the recent renovation. The grandkids loved the pool and the beach. Our rooms were spacious and offered a great ocean view. We ate dinner at Rumfire and were very pleased with their variety of selections and the quality of the dishes. Both mornings we ate at the Rumfire breakfast buffet and enjoyed it as well. The workout facility provided everything that we needed. As for the staff, they were exceptional, bending over backwards to make our brief stay extremely relaxing and enjoyable. We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay; in fact it was too short. When we return in 2013, our stay at SK will be longer.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location and affordable stay with Belvoir experience
title: Comfortable Stay
comment: We were at Belvoir Norflk for an overnight stay and it was really a memorable experience. The room was spacious and bed was comfortable. I especially liked the soft pillows. However, I felt the common area, the carpet pathway was a bit worn out. The hot breakfast was great with wide variety of options including fresh omelets cooked as per our ingredients in front of us. A pleasant harbor view walkway in the morning was excellent. All the staff members was very helpful and the valet parking option was really convenient as we reach late in the night and it was raining.

title: This hotel is a great getaway from electronics
comment: Beautiful golf course, pool and amazing spa areas. A great getaway from your electonic devices. Conference/ballroom food service was great--exceptional and delicious.

title: Wonderful Overnight Stay
comment: I booked this hotel for an overnight stay before a cruise out of San Juan. We were greeted by the wonderful staff at this hotel the second we stepped out of the taxi. From the bellhops, front desk staff and dining room staff we were treated as if we stay here often and this was our first time here. We will be back. Thank You

everyoneShouldKnow: That this would probably be fine for an average family on a tight budget who are trying to stay in a resort location.
title: This hotel was adequate
comment: Our room was adequate, but dated. The bathroom drain was slow and the tub was worn. The "resort charge" was gimicky and should have just been built into the base room rate.

title: JC
comment: The hotel is well located and the service is good. The high volume of guests and low personnel at the reception makes sometimes difficult the check in. When asked to repair something in the room never was done during my stay

everyoneShouldKnow: How consistently helpful and friendly all staff are. This includes front desk, suttle drivers, restaurant and even maintenance staff who greet you and ask if there is anything they can do to make your stay more enjoyable. resturFrom the front desk
title: Staff
comment: Rooms were clean, comfortable and well laid out. I particularly enjoyed the sunny atrium.

title: Greta Place
comment: Rooms are well kept, Employees are super friendly, Restaurant Staff is Excellent

title: Great Experienceat Belvoir @ Syracuse
comment: We had a great experience at the on campus Syracuse location. The food, accomodations and helpful staff were wonderful to deal with. We will stay again in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not pay the resort charge unless you truly want the benefits it confers. Do not stay at this hotel, if they advise you that the resort charge is mandatory, for some guests do not pay it.
title: The Resort Charge
comment: I first stayed at this fine hotel in 1974. Over the years, I have returned frequently. It has been my home, when at Waikiki. The hotel has undergone a number of transformations and refurbishments. This latest incarnation is the best yet. But there is a problem: the so called "mandatory" resort charge. I first learned of this after I had made my reservation for this stay. Being advised by an email from the hotel that the charge was mandatory, I accepted this as fact, and when asked at check in if I knew about the charge, I dutifully replied in the affirmative and paid it. But shortly, the disappointment began, followed by outrage. When I went to log in to the "free" (a benefit of paying the resort charge) WiFi, the screen informed me that the charge would be $14 per day, but IF I were paying the resort charge, it would be free. "IF"? This implied that some hotel guests were not paying the resort charge. Then I noticed costs associated with certain activities in the weekly planner booklet given us. But, other documentation advised us that "IF" we had paid the resort charge, those activities would be free. So, the next day, in a friendly manner, I started asking some hotel guests I randomly met if they had paid the resort charge. It was in this manner that I learned that some had not. Well, it was obvious at that point, anyway. While the list of "benefits" associated with the resort charge is lengthy and interesting, given a proper choice at check in, I would have declined to pay it. The amount was about $125 for our 5 night stay. A better investment would have been 10 Mai Tai's -- 1 for me and 1 for my wife, daily. I did raise this issue at check out, as I was asked if I had any problems during my stay, but of course the response was just a sympathetic smile. Nothing could be done. I have been loyal to the Belvoir Waikiki for nearly 40 years, but I find the imposition of the so-called mandatory resort charge to be deceptive and outrageous. This is no way to treat your loyal customers. It is no way to treat anyone. The next time I travel to Waikiki, I will check to see if your hotel still imposes the resort charge. If it does, I will stay elsewhere. I shall not return until the resort charge is eliminated, and I am advising others headed for Waikiki to do the same. It's a shame really. You have such a fine facility, and such a friendly and competent staff. Yet you have chosen, through management greed, to undermine and negate these strengths through deceptive marketing of a resort charge. If you really need extra income from guests, just build the charge into your rates. I hope to stay with you again some day, but this may have been my last stay. It's up to you. Aloha!

title: Best Hotel in Waikiki !
comment: The Staff is amazing, first class all the way!

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean and beautiful with wonderful staff!
title: Breath of fresh air
comment: Absolutely loved this place! All good, nothing negative to say.

everyoneShouldKnow: ask for one fo the updated rooms
title: Rooms Need Updating
comment: The overall hotel was nice enough, but the room/wing I stayed in was in dire need of an upgrade/ The carpets in the hallway were old and stained, the tiles in the bathroom were cracked and needed regrouting, and the overall decor was dated. In addition, the room smelled funky, like the air conditioner had been on too long

everyoneShouldKnow: Just stayed one night on business, but the room was clean and comfortable and in a convenient location for my purpose.
title: Brief but pleasant stay
comment: Just stayed one night on business, but the room was clean and comfortable and in a convenient location for my purpose.

title: honeymon stay
comment: The beds were amazing, very comfortable. beware of words like room with lake view, we could barely find the lake out our window, 2nd floor. go higher if it's the view you want. Pricey place to stay. For 200.00 a night, housekeeping hadn't been in our room until well after lunch,she told us they were short staffed . oops! who wants to hear that! front desk staff very helpful. Parking lot is hard to find and get into too.

everyoneShouldKnow: The GREAT location to pretty much everything in the city.
title: Belvoir Boston
comment: If you are looking for a nice hotel in a convenient location in the city, look no further than this hotel. You will be very happy with your choice. However, the room service menu is limited. But since you are in a great location, you can walk to some wonderful restaurants.

title: Below expectation
comment: I fly from hong kong to NYC to spend weekend, all I want is a king size bed high rise room, but when I get there I was told the toilet was broken in my room and they can only give me a low rise double room, or I could wait in the lobby for two hour until they fix it?! And the receptionist was not nice at all after all these. I try to argue and she became impatient and had no smile all the time. Finally I got to talk to manager to get it arranged. P.s. wifi for 15$?! No bath tub?!

title: Terrible experience
comment: Dirty, no security, unhelpful and unknowledgable staff.

title: Fantastic Hotel
comment: The Belvoir Waikiki was a great hotel to stay at for my visit to Oahu. Every employee that I interacted with was kind, friendly, and made you feel very welcome. The room was really really nice, and I especially enjoyed relaxing on the balcony and taking in the breathtaking views of Diamond Head. Also, if you are looking for a hotel with a relaxing pool area, then this is your place. The infinity pool and lounging area was wonderful and the staff very attentive.

title: This hotel has no clue
comment: I booked a king room on points, and I got a double room and was charged. I had to call corporate customer service to get this matter resolved as the staff at this hotel had no clue. Essentially I was told that even though I booked a king bed, as an elite member, all I was guaranteed was a room and not the room type.

title: Very Dissapointed
comment: As our taxi pulled up to the hotel on our first visit to NYC we were very excited. This was our first 20 min in the New York Belvoir; The bell hops were so frantic to beat each other to the luggage it was gone before we were able to pay the taxi. We opened our own taxi doors. We found our luggage on a rack and proceeded to check in. There was no "Welcome to New York" at check in but .."your room is not ready". A bell hop stood 2 inches behind me with his hand out. I handed him a tip wondering what exactly he had done for us as I was told we had to take our luggage to the storage, pay $3.00 per bag (never heard of a hotel doing this before) We tried to navigate the rack but were told we had to take it off so we lifted our bags off ourselves and wheeled them over to the storage. Ridiculous. Most guests learned to go through the side door and hail their own cab as they also expect a tip for hailing a cab when the cabs are already there.This is NOT customer service. It is harrasment. Also the safe would not unlock and it took over an hour to get something delivered to our room. As a result we slept in your hotel but did not try the restaurant or bar . I love the Grandbourne brand, I am a lifetime Grandbourne Gold member. I was expecting the excellent service and welcome that I am accustomed to and this was so dissapointing, particularly when this was a special celebration weekend.

title: Good Stay.. but...
comment: I stayed here for two nights with my wife and 10 months old baby. Facility and room was clean and no complaint there. We requested a baby crib and the hotel brought us a park n' play with cardboard bottom - no mattress - which is so thin I was afraid to put my baby in it. Also, hotel's ventilation system is probably old and we noticed in the morning that all our clothing felt soggy from moisture. In addition, around 8 pm on first night, I had to wait at the front desk for more than 15 minutes because there was only one person to handle 3~4 guest lined up. I love this hotel and would probably come back in the future, but I would certainly like to see some improvements in its service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good value for the money in San Diego
title: Pleasant hotel with a great location
comment: We enjoyed our recent weekend here. The pool, lobby and rooms are really nice. The only minuses were that housekeeping did not make up our room one night and if you touch anything in the mini bar you will be charged ( be aware of this). The facilites here are beautiful and the location can't be beat! The customer service is good as well. We will be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: The elevators are kind of confusing, make sure you know which one you need to take in order to get to your room!
title: Nice hotel, beward conventions in town
comment: I had a very nice and carefree stay at the Belvoir Dallas. The room was nice and clean, check in process was quick. (It would have been tedious through the long line of convention people checking in but I got to go to the BPG desk :). They room was very pretty quite but I could hear people slamming their doors and running around in the halls. I think there was conference for "slumber party host's" at that hotel so it was kind of irritating surfing through all the giggling people in glitter. lol. Not the hotels fault for irresponsible guests. BUT for the most part my stay was good. I DID opt for the "go green" way and didn't have my towels and sheets changed. The only problem with this I found was that they didn't do ANYTHING. not make the bed, empty the trash, restock the shampoo. Nada. I was under the impression that it would just involve no towel service and linen change. Oh well. I still had a good stay. How much shampoo does a person REALLY need anyway, right? :)

title: The hotel is in need of upkeep
comment: We have stayed at this hotel for years but we are ready to make a change. Anaheim was in a heat waveand tempertures reached 108 and 102 while we were there The room was not air conditioned when we arrived and it took all night to cool down which made it difficult to sleep The hallways were not air conditioned until Friday and the temperature was unbearable. A food tray at the next room was left there 24 hours and we had young children that had to avoid it in our party. The rooms were spacious but the carpet is in need of cleaning and the pillows were all big and uncomfortable. The shuttle to Disneyland is always a nice perk but one of the drivers seemed grumpy when in years past the drivers seemed quite pleasant. The pool was a welcome relieve but pool chairs and tables were in disrepair and the pool area was in need of cleaning.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, great food, lousy service.
title: Disappointed with BPG benfits and "green program"
comment: I was initally disappointed that free in-room wi-fi was not included for BPG members. (And that it was $14.95 per 24 hours.) Most hotel affinity programs now offer this option. The green program is one I support however, when it was explained to me I was told that I could request towels and a linen change part way through my stay since I was there 7 nights. (Note: They said 7 nights at chek-in but when I checked out on the last day of the conference I was told my reservation for was 8 nghts and I was charged a $20 early check out fee!!!! The day I asked for new towels I called at 7:00 am and when I returned to my room at 5:30 pm to take a shower - no towels. I had to call a second time to get them. One morning I clumsily spilled a cup of coffee on the bed linens. I called and asked to have them changed, was told yes and they asked what time. I repsonded I would be out until 1:30. Fine. I returned at 1:30 to a phone message saying that they could not change my sheets because I had opted for the green program. I explained the situation and agreed to turn in oine of my vouchers, again, was told it would happen. I returned at 9:30 that night exhausted and no clean sheets. I called again and was told it was not possible to change the sheets that late at night but they would do it in the morning. I was checking out the next morning so there was no satisfactroy conlcusion of the issue. I felt the green program was really about just plain being cheap.

title: Great location and view
comment: great fitness center, reasonable lounge.

title: Did not clean room
comment: We were out of our room from about 9am until about 3:30pm. Room had not been cleaned when we returned to rest and get changed for the evening. No one was in sight. We called the desk. We took towels from cart in hall. Came back at midnight and still not cleaned. Called management and they sent us clean towels. This was not acceptable for the prie we paid. Cheaper hotels have better service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location from Disneyland and very comfortable rooms.
title: This hotel has an excellent location from Disneyland (close)/ Comfortable
comment: The hotel's location from Disneyland was excellent, the rooms were very comfortable, the shuttle was great, the staff at check in made you feel welcomed, and the room service for food was excellent! Will stay there everytime we go to Disneyland. The pool and spa were great!

title: Tarrytown Belvoir
comment: Hotel and room were excellent, service at breakfast was poor.

title: This hotel was AMAZING
comment: I loved that we didn't actually have to leave the hotel for ANYTHING! Everything was extremely convenient and I would absolutely without a doubt stay again.

title: wonderfully convenient !
comment: this hotel was a godsend for a 6am flight with 2 toddlers! attached to the airport, it was a hop skip and a jump away from the plane, so no transfers, earlier wake up call,dragging luggage outside. It was clean, very nice room, great beds, friendly staff, oh so worth the few dollars more!

title: Room with a view!
comment: Room view was beautiful, location perfect and easy to get in and out, service prompt and efficient. Had a great time and did I mention the view!

title: excellent facility and staff
comment: excellent facility and staff--

title: Excellent Experience!
comment: The views were awsome and the staff, friendly and attentive. This is my second stay at the Belvoir Waikiki and their service and attention to detail is consistant. I look forward to my next visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ungrading to the the Club Lounge is truly a great benefit. Outstanding selection both at breakfast and dinner.
title: EXCEPTIONAL!
comment: Our stay was exceptional! The ocean view rooms are spectacular, you over see theLegendary Waikiki Beach with its coral blue waters and white sand. The hotel has an AMAZING Club Lounge with a variety of selections to choose from. You can sit and enjoy a complimentary glass of wine (or two) and view the gorgeous sunset. The infinity pool is one of my favorite things to do at the hotel its relaxing and just so peaceful and beautiful. The team is on it! they did not miss a beat. Our experience was definitely very memorable and I cant wait to get back!

title: Staff not helpful at check-in
comment: Room was not ready at check-in time and staff was not accomodating

title: great location, helpful staff
comment: This is my first visit to New York, the hotel was perfectly located, being just a 5 minute walk to Times Square and 2 mins from the nearest subway station. The room was lovely, clean and the housekeeping staff were very friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Superior customer service and Choices restaurant
title: Excellent service!
comment: The hotel staff are pleasant and very accomodating. The room is comfortable and fairly priced. The Choices restaurant is excellent. Gaby was the best!

everyoneShouldKnow: The exceptional quality meets my high expectations. If I cannot be at home, this is a nice option.
title: If you cannot be at home...this is a great second option
comment: I always find the hotel to meet my high expectations. The bedding and pillows are of excellent quality. The toiletries provided are also of fine quality. The size of the room is spacious. The flat screen is a nice size. Room service is great and speedy. The staff is very responsive if I have a need.

title: Mr.
comment: This hotel was exceptionally clean and modern.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great overall resort for an extended stay.
title: Nice resort - beautiful setting and lots to see and do!
comment: Overall a good experience. The room we had our first day was in an older section of the resort and smelled really musty and I didn't want to take a shower - the bathtub drain plug was actually rusty and a bit of a mold problem as well. However, on our return trip we stayed another night and an upgraded room was much nicer and I actually took a shower then. The amenities there are great and it is very child friendly. The shuttle service to town is convenient and the new restaurant "Rays on the Bay" was terrific! The waitstaff was wonderful and it was a great dining experience all around.

title: A spoil at the Portland
comment: A very central hotel for the airport and we appreciated the free and regular shuttle to the terminals. + the internet and printers in the lobby. The executive BPG floor was very comfortable , and the staff accomodating and friendly, my only negative was that they did not mention the wine tasting evening due to happen that night. otherwise a great all round experience and we didnot need the complimetary ear plugs as we could not hear the nearby planes.

title: The hotel is overpriced and the rooms need an update
comment: The hotel is definitely not like what you would expect from a Belvoir. The lobby is nice and that's all. The rooms are outdated and need a makeover. The bathroom was in shambles with the wallpaper falling off. Definitely wasn't worth the $220 I spent for one night in a regular room. Only positive was that it was right next to the MetLife stadium.

everyoneShouldKnow: Anything they tell you, get it in writing!
title: Confusing Info
comment: I was told twice that handicap parking was free even if you used the valet. I was charged $30 on my bill for valet parking. When I called to explain, they said they didn't think that was true and would have to check and either refund my $30 or call me back. I also was given a room about as far from the desk as possible so I had to borrow their wheelchair. And we were told the dining room was open until 10 and when we got there at 9:35 we were told it closed at 9:30. We asked to speak to the manager and they finally seated us. My chicken was dry and tasteless. They were nice enough to take it off the menu. It was a disappointing stay. I stay at Belvoir lots and usually have a great experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is extremely pleasant, prompt and exceedingly accommodating.
title: very comfy
comment: Highly recommend. Very comfortable.

title: Disapointing
comment: My party had 150 rooms blocked. I had 3 suites and a room blocked. The suites were for our CEO who luckily did not end up staying as the rooms were not ready at 3 and then not ready at 4:45pm when we had to depart for our function. At three pm most guests could not check in as the standard rooms were not ready

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for Louisville area and easy to get to.
title: Great place to stay
comment: This was my fourth time to stay at this hotel for four nights for a yearly convention. Would certainly recommend it. All the amenities were as stated. Pool and fitness area, restaurants and service personel were exceptional. This is a great location for all sights and activities in the Louisville area.

title: Bad experience
comment: Definitely not up to the standard of most other Belvoir Hotels. Checked in on a Friday afternoon and there was a long line and only ONE desk clerk working. Tried checking out on Sunday morning and the same thing - ONE desk clerk working!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's not as nice as it looks
title: Broken Shower, Paper-thin Walls
comment: Title explains it. Poor night sleep from the TV to the left and the couple to the right. Up early to catch my flight and had to take a bath since the shower didn't work. I hate baths, they're for babies and women. No amount of compensation would make this right.

title: Location
comment: right in the center of it all

title: wonderful stay
comment: I stayed at this hotel for an event hosted here. The staff was so friendly. The room was clean comfy and well worth the stay. I will be staying here on my next trip to Atlanta.

everyoneShouldKnow: Breakfast buffet is not every day, bring walking shoes so you can walk uphill to the 24hr diner!
title: The Bath rooms are very small
comment: The bath room NEEDS HELP!!!!!! The sliding door is really bad!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: tHIS HOTEL HAS GREAT FEATURES
comment: HOTEL WAS OUTSTANDING. CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location and the Best Staff
title: Great Staff
comment: I would definately recommend this Hotel. The maid service is horrible. I have stayed here many times with the same complaints of my room not being cleaned. Not changing towels. Not vacuuming. No water bottles left for me. That has always been my complaint and my only complaint. The Hotel itself is great. The staff is wonderful and the location is good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Get rewards card, it will waive parking!
title: Anniversary Weekend
comment: My husband and I spent our 2nd wedding anniversary here in Myrtle Beach. 5 years ago when we took our first couple getaway it was to Myrtle Beach. I came across the Belvoir's Great $68 a night deal via Travelocity and we had to come. The staff was great. I even signed up for a rewards card. Will definitely be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff, clean and spacious rooms!
title: Great Overall Experience!
comment: Great overall experience at this hotel. Staff recognized my status and upgraded me to club floor. Pool with retractable roof great. Room clean and spacious for an NYC hotel. My only complaint and it is minor - wait times for elevators a bit long at times.

title: This hotel is great for teachers
comment: If your teacher this hotel offers the greatest price for the greatest value. Everything about the room, customer friendly staff and the biggest bonus was that were able to bring our pet along which even saved us more money because we do not have to put the dog in a kennel. Even better our daughter got to see her dog.

everyoneShouldKnow: So accommodating to their guest needs
title: This hotel has great staff
comment: Never have I been treated so well with staff being so helpful accommodating and most of all absolutely so friendly and helpful!! Not just once but for the entire stay. This goes for valet services as well! I highly recommend!!

title: Good location
comment: Although this hotel does not have a casino, it's well situated that you can easily walk to the boardwalk and get to the Ceaser, Trump Plaza in 10 minutes. Close to all the shops. The rooms wwere comfortable and cleaned. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

title: 9/1/[YEAR-0]
comment: We just stayed at this hotel and the room was fine, nothing fancy but good for what we needed.

title: The beds,pillows and linens are so comfortable.Very relaxing after a long day of travel or fun.
comment: This is our go to Hotel whenever we visit Myrtle Beach.It's close to everything.We can get anywhere in a short amount of time or just stay in and relax.The suite was amazing.

title: Walk to Everything
comment: Great location in walking distance to all downtown attractions.

title: Not Bad
comment: The Belvoir Duluth is the best of the hotels in the city. We had a great view of the lake and it was walking distance to canal park (although the walk takes you past homeless people in a park). The hotel has a van available which we took back to the hotel at night.

title: Another great Stay!
comment: We had a wonderful time and a Great stay. This Hotel is one of my Boston favorites. Great location, Club lounge was superb, great continental breakfast-overall an A stay. The only negative was we really missed the hot tub that used to be near the pool-hope you bring that back. Thanks.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to lots of amenities, but dont' have to leave the hotel to get great food, drinks, and entertainment.
title: Great Hotel
comment: Great staff, delicious food, and clean rooms.

title: Enjoyable visit
comment: No problems, got help when I needed it and enjoyed my visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Starbucks is a plus, and $5 vouchers that you can get just for skipping maid service is a good incentive too
title: Nice hotel, but...
