The beach and pool, the laua lawn, the views and restaurants; everything was perfectly picturesque. We couldn't have picked a more appropriate place for our authentic Hawaiian honeymoon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ask all questions at front desk.
title: This hotel could use some more bar help
comment: no bar tender at 2:30 PM when he did arive was rude and no table service. Also could use a facility map in room

title: Great Hotel with beautiful views
comment: We had an Ocean Front room with the most beautiful view, ever. Everything was perfect, except (yes, here comes that "but"), because there was no way to clean/hose-down the beautiful terrace that overlooked the ocean, the carpet was dirty, especially near the sliding door, and was tracked all the way through the room to the bathroom. Everything else was excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful setting on the Petaluma River
title: I'd stay again
comment: In a nutshell, it is what I've come to expect from Grandbourne Hotels. And you cant beat the location to the wine country.

everyoneShouldKnow: The name of the game is Hospitality, and we felt it at the NYC Belvoir.
title: A Belvoir Welcome
comment: What made this a truly outstanding hotel experience for us was the wonderful and sincere welcome we received from Molly as we checked in. While we chatted and she explained the hotel amenities and enrolled us in the BPG program, Molly learned that we were in the city celebrating our 50th anniversary, and sent a lovely card and welcome gift to our room. I have already recommended this hotel to several friends based on Molly's hospitality and thoughtfulness. The NYC Belvoir is lucky to have her on its staff!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place to stay for Aloha Week.
title: Historical ambiance of days gone by.
comment: Every time my ohana stays at PK, I am reminded of the beautiful Princess and Ainahau. The hotel has great pictures of the princess and the historical significance of the property reminds me of Hawaiian Ali'i and history of days gone by. The staff at PK have true aloha spirit.

title: Very Comfy
comment: I found this hotel to very comfortable nice small hotel good BPG recognition. Free Parking in and out was easy staff were very helpful.

title: Very convenient!
comment: This hotel provides great convenience, not only by its location near the airport and the city center, but also for its restaurants, pool and fitness center.

everyoneShouldKnow: you feel very welcomed. great location
title: wonderful stay
comment: large rooms. wet bar and fridge with plenty of counter space. .and room to relax even with a king bed,,

title: Great stay.
comment: Our second trip to Des Moines, enjoyed it, staff was very helpful. We'll be back.

title: very clean
comment: The front desk goes out of their way to help you if you have had a rough travel day. the bar makes great drinks .

title: Mom's Birthday Celebration
comment: Wonderful location....great service. We stayed on the Club Level....the views were spectacular....and the food/service in the club lounge were superb.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool and spa with a beautiful beach right there
title: Nice Honeymoon
comment: The grounds at the hotel had beautiful landscaping. So many koi ponds and a great new pool and spa. It was convenient to walk over to a great beach for snorkeling. The only reason we did not have a great honeymoon vs a nice honeymoon was not receiving an special treats as newlyweds. Maybe I have watched too many movies and TV shoes, but I expected a complimentary glass of champagne at the restaurant or one night at an oceanfront room or something other than the very warm congratulations at the front desk. Instead we learned the room we were assigned had twin beds even when I had checked an option stating that it was our honeymoon. The only perk was that we were able to get a king size bed! Again, great place to stay for a vacation but it did not meet my honeymoon expectations.

title: This hotel is conveniently located to shopping mall/centers and restaurants
comment: I will stay at this property on my next visit back to Houston. I was impressed with how clean our room was . Will surely recommend to others.

title: A party place
comment: Appears to be a great venue for wedding receptions as it appeared all emphasis is placed there. Heat would not work and temperature in room was down to 65 by morning, with no blankets on bed. The halls were filled with noisy partying people. No offer to valet vehicle and the front desk was unable to validate ticket, leaving it up to me to explain it to attendants in the morning.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean rooms and bar had very good service.
title: Staff
comment: The check in staff needs to be knowledgeable about how check customers in, for some reason they did not have our reservations right and the group we were with had trouble too.

title: Great Customer Service
comment: At check in there was a little problem but the front desk agent Channel was extremely helpful and corrected the issue right away.

title: What happened to this hotel?!!!
comment: We have stayed at the Belvoir on Canal in New Orleans many times in the past, usually during Mardi Gras, so we are familiar with this hotel and how it functions at the busiest of times. The good-The location is great, the staff are friendly and we were pleased to see that the rooms have been updated. The bad-the elevators are terrible! They are not traditional in that you don't just push a button at the elevator bank and wait for the first one. These elevators require you to enter your floor number, then it flashes a car number for you to wait for. Sounds easy, and as though it would be more efficient but, it doesn't work out well in reality. I can't tell you how many people I've seen that are confused by this, end up getting frustrated and holding things up. The line to get to the elevator during Mardi Gras is just awful! Don't expect to get up to your room or down to the lobby quickly if it's a busy time. Now, the ugly-our most recent visit was 9/22/12. The hotel is in the process of renovating the lobby so it now feels kind of like an airline terminal that is also under construction (hopefully that will improve!) We had requested an early check in but were delayed in arriving due to convention traffic and didn't arrive till 3 pm. There was a line to check in that wasn't too long but, we were told that our room had not been cleaned yet and so we couldn't check in. I gave them my cell phone number to call when the room was ready and was assured that it would be less than an hour. An hour and a half later we still hadn't gotten a call and had to get back into a much longer check in line where we remained for another 20-30 min. When we finally got to the desk we were told a room was still not available and they didn't know how much longer it would be. There were not enough attendants to check all the guests in and we were not the only ones unable to check in-there were 30-40 people sitting in chairs in the lobby area with their luggage, some curled up on pillows some laying down on the floor- it looked like we were at an airport that had been snowed in, cancelled all flights and passengers were bedding down! We had dinner reservations, we're meeting friends and were looking forward to some time alone without the kids (got the 'romance package' that was supposed to come with chocolates and champagne in the room-never did get those). Spending the few hours we had together in a line sucked. We were persistent (refused to move till we got a room) and got a room within 20 minutes but missed our dinner reservation and were late to meet our friends. The hotel did try to compensate us but, I would've rather had it go right. We chose the Belvoir because they usually are on the ball with check in compared to many other N.O. Hotels. Something has changed and that is no longer true. Cheaping out on staff? Poor management? Who knows, I just know I won't be staying there come next Mardi Gras!

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally located. Beautiful location. Close to beach, shops, restaurants.
title: Love the bed...
comment: I had no problem falling asleep due to the comfort of the bed. I've stayed at other Grandbourne Hotels and have to say all their beds are heavenly comfortable. One thing that was unsatisfactory at the Princess K was the shower drain. Drained so slowly. Please check it out.....Room 501. Other than that, I'm pretty satisfied. Maybe next time I'll request a ocean view room.

title: Great location - Great features
comment: We didn't stay long enough to enjoy all the features of the hotel, but those we did were fantastic! The 2 pools were great - you have to check out the sunset from the Infinity Pool area - as were the food outlets.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, high quality fresh food
title: Great hotel with lovely facilities
comment: The hotel has one of the nicest pool in Wakiki. The infinity edge pool has a fantastic view and is lovely to hang out all day. Food in the buffet is very good, pastry and bake goods are exceptionally well. Lowson Station is better than the normal sundry shop.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't stay here if you are allergic to smoke or have health issues with smoke.
title: Smoke free facility is anything but
comment: I'm sorry... you either are smoke free or not. The rooms, hallways and access routes reek of smoke. I don't care if your clientele pays to have the rooms cleaned. It doesn't change the fact that you let it happen.

title: good deal
comment: Dollar for value this Belvoir is a good deal. However there are areas such as the pool that should have been cleaner, and could use renovations.

title: professional
comment: Staff was very professional and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: GREAT LOCATION FOR WHATEVER YOU WANT TO DO. SEE THE SITES, GAMBLE OR PARTY.
title: STATEFAN
comment: EVEN THOUGH RENOVATION WAS TAKING PLACE, THE HOTEL STAFF DID A GREAT JOB OF TAKING CARE OF PEOPLE.

everyoneShouldKnow: The people make you feel at home.
title: Great Stay
comment: One night - great stay for the lenght of time I was there. I went to the lounge to watch the football game and had a very nice chat with the bartender...she focus her attention to everyone!

everyoneShouldKnow: You have to PAY for wifi!!
title: Average Hotel, Paid Wifi, Small Rooms, Manager with Attitude
comment: Paying for wifi is a joke. While I had to ask for credit on it, just forcing the user to pay and fight for it to be free is a pointless path to put people on.

title: From the Phoenix VA - NEMRT
comment: Although not alot of time was spent at the Hotel itself, the time spent was pleasant. Staff was pleasant and always said good morning or hello. The only problem I had was that Housekeeping never left enough sugar and creamer, so I had to ask every evening for extra. Sad part is, I lost my camera my last day.

title: Room near elevator
comment: We did not request an accessible but that is what we were put in. It was near the elevator and I went down to the desk to request a change. I was told that all accessible rooms were near the elevator. I explained the the desk attendant that I did not request one but he did not seem to hear me. He finally said there were no other rooms available. Fortunately, it was quiet and there were no loud guests.

everyoneShouldKnow: Uneducated and rude front desk staff - This hotel is not clean!!!
title: Bad staff, not clean, and did not care about the customer
comment: When we arrived there had already been a billing error - which was not explained to me. By the time I checked out my credit card had been charged 3 times for over $1000!! When I called the front desk staff to explain the situation no one was able to answer my questions and not willing to satisfy the customer - more like they wanted to make sure that they were right and I was wrong. The hotel bedding was dirty, we never received new sheets the entire stay (4 days), I tested it by leaving a sticker on the duvet and the sheets, and our bathroom was not cleaned the whole time. Thankfully I brought Clorox bleach wipes and cleaned our bathroom. There was a light bulb out in our bathroom when we checked in and the housecleaning staff didn't do anything to make sure it was changed - my sister ended up taking a bulb out of the table lamp to put it in the bathroom after standing on the sink and nearly hurting herself. We had a horrible experience and would not stay at this hotel again.

title: Perfect location, price and amenities
comment: Stay was wonderful, rooms great, staff helpful. Rooms should have fridges and bar should be accessed to outside terrace directly. Thanks

title: Great F&B
comment: f&b, catering meeting services staff were very helpful. Housekeeping staff was was very loud in the morning also not consistent with the amenities they put in room.

title: Evacuation
comment: Emergency lights are needed in the rooms. We had a 2 AM evacuation and no lights in the room.

title: needs updating
comment: the overall appearance of the motel is antiquanted. needs an overhaul. Staff is very professional.

everyoneShouldKnow: They've started to charge $8 for parking.
title: The hotel is on a downward slide
comment: The hotel's exterior and lobby are nice, but the rooms are starting to deteriorate. I've stayed at this hotel over the years and it 's very nice, but you can tell that nothing has been done to the rooms over the years. The furniture is old, the microwave looks like it is from 1980, and the curtains barely close. The rooms need to be updated ASAP.

title: Great Stay
comment: Excellent location, great staff, great hotel overall

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice quiet and relaxing Hotel with a resort feel.
title: Great Relaxing weekend
comment: My wife and I were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and we chose to return to the same location we were engaged, the Belvoir San Diego. We had an amazing time! The staff was very accomodating and helpful. I contacted the Hotel prior to checking in and was even able to get the same room we stayed in years ago.

title: Took care of my mistake
comment: Upon check-in, it was discovered that I reserved the wrong dates for our weekend. The front desk assured me that "it happens," and promptly took care of finding us a room for the two nights I thought i reserved. We have stayed at the resort before, and found it just as pleasant this time around. The location to Hollywood Studios, Epcot an the Boardwalk is excellent and the pool area is great.

title: Great beds, service needs improvement
comment: We had a pleasant stay in Alexandria and found the Belvoir Suites very convenient to public transportation, restaurants and other businesses. Our only complaint was the unresponsiveness of staff to our complaint about loud construction noise every (M-F) morning. The response at the desk was simply "they aren't supposed to start until 9:00." I was complaining at 7:30 about being woke up."

title: Hotel needs more knowledgeable front desk.
comment: We were never told that since we were on the "club" floor that we had such benefits as free breakfast, light snacks, etc. I had even inquired if free breakfast was available and was told "no".

everyoneShouldKnow: Harbor and river views delightful, especially at night.
title: Outstanding treatment by entire staff
comment: From the time I started the check-in process to departure time, I was extremely pleased with everyone on staff that I encountered. All were helpful and friendly, appearing ready and willing to go beyond the "call of duty" to assist. I had multiple meals in the restaurant and found the food to be extremely good and reasonably priced. Servers in the restaurant did not disappoint. Parking was not as convenient as I would have liked, since I prefer self-parking. However, I found enjoyment in there being so many attractions within walking distance.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, professional staff, well appointed property, and very clean!!
title: Anniversary Stay
comment: My wife and I flew out of town to Boston to celebrate our 9-year anniversary and chose the Belvoir Boston Downtown as our Hotel. Our trip began on the wrong foot, with the airlines losing our lugguge of which we never received until 5:00pm the night before we flew out. Upon arrival, Tara checked us in, and gave us a complimentary upgrade due to our situation of being with-out lugguge and celebrating our anniversary. She was very personable with lots of information, and empathetic of our situation. She is awesome!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and has excellent shuttle service.
title: Overall
comment: Very nice hotel, nice room, good service, but noisy. Had to call twice to calm down partying in the hallways.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is conveniently located close to the airport.
title: GREAT EXPERIENCE
comment: My boyfriend and I was looking for a great place to get away for the week end. We selected the Belvoir based on the price and the room selection. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked through the doors and found how updated and upscale this hotel was. From the check in counter staff to housekeeping we were blown away by their 5 star professionalism. We will definately return to this hotel in the future.

title: airport Belvoir Phoenix
comment: We recently stayed here first time-the night before flying to Hawaii & then on the return when our return flight arrived at midnite. This is a most convenient location to Sky Harbor airport. Leaving the car there is a godsend-we live 2 hrs drive in Tucson. We had a dinner & a room service breakfast- the food far exceeded expectation. Very nice pool & facility overall. Can't say anything bad

title: Slightly disappointed
comment: when we checked in, we were given a room where over half of the outlets, the TV and the phone didn't work. In the bathroom, the bar of soap had been opened and used. We immediatley went back down to the desk and asked for another room. It was ok, but at this time, i already had a bad taste in my mouth.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great view of Disneyland fireworks from the rose garden & front of the bldg. The service is way better than you get at Disneyland hotel and much cheaper. Walk around the property, it is beautiful.
title: Another Awesome stay!!
comment: We always stay here because the staff is amazing!! David, Kris & Len at the front desk are always welcoming and helpful. Van drivers are like family and welcome us back every time. Rooms are huge, deli hot dogs can't be beat for the price. AAA rate is the best for what you get. Love the free computer usage in the lobby. Nice place to wind down after all day in DIsneyland. Shuttlle service is always on time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Kai is a wonderful restaurant experience.
title: This hotel has a great restaurant
comment: Kai - definitely 5 star

title: Perfect location and wonderful views
comment: Great location, nice staff, great bar and well thought out room layouts.

title: Customer Service
comment: I made the reservation and tried to get into a block of rooms set aside for a company meeting. After some back and forth on the reservation line they found a room was available although not with the block of rooms. When I showed up, despite referring to the date and company meeting with many rooms booked, I was booked on the wrong day (the day prior). They had charged the credit card and made no attempt to contact me as a "no show". They scrambled and found a room for me based on a cancellation and told me the previous charge would be taken off the card. It wasn't I've contacted the hotel 4 x and to no avail, the carge remains. The wrong day was booked and they are keeping the charge apparently. Poor customer service.

title: Disneyland
comment: This is a nice place to stay when visiting Disneyland. The walk is pleasant.

title: customer service
comment: This hotel was very clean, convevnient and has easy access to public transportation.The pool was well maintained. Our host(Karla) was the most knowledgable and friendliest of any Belvoir that I have been to.

everyoneShouldKnow: They have the Best Beds!! We just love them. And our Kids love this hotel also!
title: Great Stay!!
comment: We just love this hotel, We had our honeymoon here and this is were we stay for the holidays when we vist our family. This hotel is so pretty at Christmas, its like your at home.

title: it's clean
comment: this hotel is designated category 3 but i think it should be 1. the doors are old and falling apart. it doesnt have the aviance of a higher category hotel. it's clean and a place to sleep in.

title: Pleasantly surprised
comment: I went online the week before my trip to Hawaii & saw quite a few negative reviews on your website, so much so that I wanted to cancel & book elsewhere.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's pretty on the outside and small on the inside.
title: This hotel is overrated.
comment: The room was small. The food was mediocre at best. The location was the best part.

title: Awesome location
comment: For a Belvoir, there were a couple of issues that could be improved: 1) the shower knob kept falling off; 2) the pull out desk (when pulled out all the way) was dusty and had old food debris on it; and 3) the fan in the floor vent kept making noise. However, the location was perfect.

title: Bring confirmation number
comment: We frequently stay at this hotel as BPG Gold members. This time around we tried to check in around 9 pm desk agent was not able to find our reservation, turn out after contacting BPG our reservation had been canceled by BPG no explanation as to why . After one and a half hour of discussion we were given a room , not once did a manager come out to adderesse our dilema. As Gold members we felt we weren't given the attention that should have been given to a gold member. Yes we were given a room but nothing special for the inconviniance that we endured. I will say we love the hotel that's why we frequently stay there , but this time I question is this the way I want to be treated.

title: Buck Wedding Room 1618 LaFleur 9-21
comment: Broken Air Conditioning, Broken lock on door, no refrigerator, broken toilet seat, bottom sheet came off during night, Price for overnight parking $36. When we asked if there were any other options in the area the clerk said " I don't know". Would not recommend this hotel...compensated by free parking (should not have been so high to begin with) for this horrible experience.

title: Great location
comment: We stayed here due to the location of our destination - The Big E (less than 5 minutes away.)

title: This hotel has great features
comment: My husband and I stayed on the 36th floor. We had a view of 42nd street. However, the "plat de r鳩stance" was the murphy bed that came down from the wall.

title: Belvoir Marina, San Diego
comment: The only problem I had was with the front desk staff on check out. My company had a 2 day meeting there at the hotel and ran a little late ending at 1:00pm. I called to see if I could get a one hour extension to check-out and the clerk was quite rude stating that there would be an extra charge for that hour.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Valet service is excellent, very quick , helpful, and polite.
title: Superior Ocean Views
comment: Watching the ocean can be calming, just what I want when relaxing in my hotel room. Over the top was the lighted ocean bay where the manta rays fed right under my lani. Truly a unique view and experience.

title: Pleasant Surprise
comment: Was expecting it to be really bad, but was pleasantly surprised: was given a room on the 48th floor. Room was nice, standard Belvoir, quite small, but ok by NY standards. Very impressed by high speed internet, although desk space was awkward for working. Elevators are always available and very fast.

title: best value for your money
comment: Fantastic place clean beautiful convenient and very reasonable shuttle service to the city and airport breakfast included wine and cheeses at 5 p.m. great internet room and also nice pool with great pool furniture

title: Two Bad Stays
comment: I don't normally write reviews, but felt other travelers should beware. Travel for work and stayed one night last week and this week. Last week they assigned me a room someone else was already in. I opened the door to a semi-nude man in the room. I felt horrible for him! Front desk girl's response was: "oh, i don't know how that happened." No apology or acknowledgement of the embarrassment it caused me or him. FD Sup/Mngr came over and apologized.

title: Great hotel in Kauai
comment: Nice stay in Kauai at the Belvoir !

everyoneShouldKnow: Resort fee is $14/day (waived for gold/platinum status), parking is $15/day (not waived), walking distance or short boat ride to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Walking distance to Boardwalk.
title: Epcot View Rooms Are Great
comment: The hotel wasn't fully committed this time, so we finally got an upgrade as gold members to an Epcot view room (we were offered even a premium suite, but didn't like it because it was a view of the roof). The front desk service by Trip was terrific. The room was clean and comfortable. The biggest drawback was that the balcony was filthy. The chairs and deck were extremely dirty and there were spiders and webs everywhere. It was unusable. No one has cleaned that balcony in a very long time.

title: All amenties meet
comment: This hotel meet all my expectations and I would recommend it to family and friends.

everyoneShouldKnow: Remarkably quiet for sitting on the runway!
title: Very nice for a hotel airport
comment: Clean, friendly staff, and comfortable beds. Hard to ask for more from an airport hotel!

title: Not a great hotel
comment: The mattress is worn, uneven and uncomfortable. The seats on the chairs in the breakfast area are sticky and leave a black substance on your pants. I ruined 2 pairs before realizing where it was coming from. However - The staff is always very friendly and the food good.

everyoneShouldKnow: rooms are very quiet regardless of location on the floor
title: Excellent rooms and food
comment: Huge flatscreen TV in sizeable, comfortable & quiet rooms. Food was very good and portions were large. Cheese cake was great and enough to feed a family! Surrounding area isn't too nice but it looks like improvements are happening.

title: Needs some TLC
comment: Very nice hotel, however it needs some TLC. Had a problem with the TV going to sleep and had to have maintenance come to re-set it. Also the remote did not work properly.

title: Beach umbrellas
comment: I think the beach umbrellas and parking service are too expensive for hotel guests.

title: Recent Stay
comment: I might recommend this hotel but with a caution. The front desk was very disorganized. I had to call twice to get my TV fixed. But special mention to employees Jason who helped me at guest services (no concierge) and Gregg, shuttle driver.

title: Great place to stay in Chicago
comment: Enjoyed the stay at the Belvoir Chicago, they made the stay excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: New Jersey's crazy traffic routing for making turns either right or left. The associated difficulty in arriving at the Hotel.
title: From making reservation to actual stay
comment: Ability to determine what type of "discounts" are available difficult and in effect during a planned stay, not clearly identified for potential customers. Information on the shifting location of lunch and dinner service between 2 areas not well published in the rooms for customers.

title: Okay
comment: As far as location goes, this site cannot be beat. However that being said our room was not really up to par. First of all the A/C was set to 79 but it felt like 59! we could not get to a comfortable level without turning it off completely. I've never seen anything like it. In addition our bathroom never felt completely clean. There was dirt in the grout. We requested Make A Green Choice three times before giving up after our room was continuously cleaned.

guestFrom: Salt Lake City International Airport (SLC), 776 N Terminal Dr, Salt Lake City, UT 84116, USA
title: Not Worth the Club Level
comment: Club level is just average rooms. The complimentary breakfest is really low quality and not worth the extra money you pay nor is the 2 complimentary drinks you receive in the evening. The bar at this hotel had great staff and the food was average. I would stay here again but I won't add any extras on its just not worth it.

title: Great Hotel and Staff
comment: Great service from check in to check out

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff makes the stay more enjoyable and relaxing.
title: Some of Belvoir's staff made my stay very enjoyable
comment: I have been visiting the hotel several times a year for over 6 years for numerous business events in Chicago. There are key staff who always make my stay very enjoyable. John the doorman, Renee in the Club Floor Lounge and Herman in the LB restaurant have been around for most of my stays. They each have been very helpful and have a kind, friendly personality. Anyone who stays at this hotel will miss out if you don't run into one of these gentlemen during your stay. Belvoir management is to be commended for keeping such quality staff members employed at this hotel!

title: wonderl retreat
comment: We moved from another hotel to this one. What a great place! Everyone was awesome from the valet who greeted me to the employees in the restaurants. Namely, Marta, who checked me in, was fantastic and helpful. Brian in Quinns and Joe in the tapas area were so friendly. These 3 people and the great accomodations made our trip memorable. We will be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is well situated for nearby entertainment and is convenient to get all around NYC.
title: Belvoir Tribeca
comment: The Belvoir Tribeca exceeded my expectations. I had been concerned about the location, however, once I learned the geography I realized what a great location it was - close to public transportation and several great NYC neighborhoods, shopping, and restaurants. Room and Service were top notch.

title: Good stay at a great Grandbournes hotel
comment: I travel for business all the time and this hotel did not dissapoint.. A great hotel close to DFW.

title: Great family hotel
comment: I included some personal time with my stay in the Orlando area and it is in a great location and has many amenities I did not expect. Staff was ever so helpful and the rooms and room service was superb. Plan to come again - this time with grandkids.

title: Surprised the front desk could not provide change
comment: I stayed this week and asked for the front desk to break a $20 bill so that I could leave a tip for your maid and the concierge lounge server. I asked for change at 7:00 AM and was told there was no change due to it being used the prior night. I checked again at 9:00 AM to try to once again get change and there was still none. I was very surprised that no effort was made to fix this in two hours and I was left with no ability to tip your personnel. Very Disappointing

title: Comfortable and convenient
comment: We stayed here for a recent Disneyland weekend, and it turned out to be a good choice. The first night we were able to walk home from dinner at Downtown Disney. Mostly we took the shuttles to and from the parks, and they were very reliable.

everyoneShouldKnow: No restaurants in the area only on site but you can go on shuttle to pentagon city metro drop off and lots of restaurants.
title: Great stay
comment: It was our first stay at this hotel. They were great. We had wonderful rooms with DC view, great breakfast buffet and shuttle to metro or restaurant at the metro line. The staff was wonderful. Gave us a better rate on parking. I recommend you use the sign for not changing towels and making bed. They give you $5.00 for each stay. We used it n breakfast. Get the shuttle early for metro otherwise you have to stand but still okay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Super location, super amenities, SC HOF Museum.
title: Mrs. C.P.
comment: I especially love the bed----most comfortable mattress I have ever slept upon. The entire property is impressive and left nothing to be desired.

title: Pleasant stay
comment: The welcoming staff were very cordial, friendly and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location for all shopping needs and near Pike Market.
title: First Timer
comment: Excellent all round hotel. Wonderful location and easy access all round to shops etc. Room was wonderful and much larger than expected. On 5th floor with awesome view and my favourite was the granite window seat my daughter and I sat at and watched people go by! Also a great place to place our purchases.........beds were wonderful and comfortable and loved the comfortable pillows and always love the use of whites on the bed. Quiet, comfortable, and cozy. Will definitely be back. Oh, and great location to Pike's Market.

title: Overall Performance
comment: One of the best Reunions our ship(USS Salem) has had. Food was outstanding. Personnel fabulous and accomodating.

title: Great Location
comment: The Belvoir Poipu was recommended to us by friends. We were a little disappointed upon arriving to find a big round table in the middle of the lobby and absolutely nothing on it- no flowers, no display at all. Seemed like they did not care to make any kind of impression. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and staff. Location--great beach, several good local restaurants for which the hotel provides a free shuttle.

title: Nothing Extraordinary
comment: #1 $20 to park, $25 to valet after I'm spending good $ on a room is not right. Couple that with no bar open on a Sat due to rain .. people were complaining left and right. I've been here for like 20 years and counting and have stayed for last time. Why is Wreck bar only open on Fri-Sat? And not till 5pm at that ... The other restaurant food is so-so ... Oh well used to be a great place ...

title: Excellent Location
comment: We loved it! Quick walk to Spirit of Norfolk.

title: Friendly Staff
comment: There appears to be a long term happy staff, which translate into great customer service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent food and service throughout the hotel.
title: Bob's Meeting Experience
comment: While a large hotel, the staff goes out of its way making you feel that you are the only one there. Thus, the staff met my expectations as much as the facility.

title: Great location and beautiful room.
comment: The room is beautiful! Not at all like the cookie cutter rooms of many hotels. Extremely clean and a shower I could have spent the day in. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Lovely hotel on the beach.
comment: We were totally pleased with every aspect of the hotel and enjoyed our vacation immensely. The employees couldn't have been nicer or more attentive. It was nice to have a little general store handy too. The only thing that we would like to suggest is a shuttle of some kind to the beach for those of us that can't walk that far. It was a hike!

title: Hotel has great features
comment: The hotel met our needs in every way. Staff was superb! Great location.

title: Overall - Excellent
comment: The hotel and the propery is excellent. I was there on a busy week and they just did not have enough hotel registration personnel on duty. I waited to get service for an hour and I was the next person in line the whole time!

title: Overpriced but right there
comment: No one could be closer and perhaps that's why the price is so high. Disposable, flimsy cups in the bathroom? C' mon. Skip the wall art if you can't find real photos of New England.

title: Disappointed
comment: I have stayed at this hotel previously and it was great. This time I was very disappointed.

title: A beautiful place to stay
comment: This is a really nice place to stay. Very relaxing and only a block from the Galleria. The room was great and the Omaha Steakhouse has excellent food and an excellent staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: You have to pay extra to use the gym next door because there is no fitness center
title: Ok but not outstanding
comment: The beds were not as confuse as other hotels in the BPG family, they had no gym, and the elevator did not work one night we were there but the staff was extremely nice.

title: Nice hotel, nice location
comment: Well located hotel in Santa Monica just 4 blocks from the beach. Modern and with very comfortable beds. One of the few hotels in Santa Monica that allows self parking at no charge too.

title: Stunning Setting!
comment: We look forward to a return visit - four days three nights just wasn't enough. The onsite restaurant offerings for breakfast and dinner were more than sufficient and very tasty. We thorougly enjoyed our visit and highly recommend this location. Sunsets were magnificent!

everyoneShouldKnow: be prepared for everyone to smile and acknowledge you as you walk by
title: Staff was over the top!
comment: The staff set this hotel apart from the moment we checked in with a smiling Kaytrina to the proud room service by Scotty. A big nod to Sonya who was outstanding throughout the stay. The genuine caring attitude was present which is so often missing during my frequent travels. Will definitely return because of staff alone!

everyoneShouldKnow: Can't beat the convenience of this "Deluxe" hotel!
title: Another Great Stay
comment: Had another great stay at the Dolphin. Really appreciated the special treats on our Birthday. Would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Disney. If I could change anything it would be that you could "opt-out" of the resort fee. We really didn't benefit any from it. Will return again!

title: WHAT AN OUTSTANDING HOTEL ... AND STAFF!!!
comment: This marvelous hotel exceeded EVERY expectation I had and the CLUB ROOM STAFF, led by Chelsea, made the stay even MORE enjoyable ... the bar staff, led by Angelica, also provided an OUTSTANDING experience leading me to recommend this property VERY HIGHLY to anyone and everyone traveling to San Antonio ...

everyoneShouldKnow: You can park your car and not have to leave the area unless you just want to get away.
title: Love the view from my window
comment: I enjoyed my stay very much. The view from my window was excellent. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The convenience of riding the shuttle boat to nearby locations.

title: Just average
comment: Hotel was conveniently located.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has an on site Starbucks!
title: This hotel has excellent features
comment: Not only is there a full service Starbucks in the hotel but the on site restaurant is excellent! The room was nice and spacious. The staff was very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Belvoir Waikiki has the best facilities and location on Waikiki Beach.
title: Belvoir Waikiki Experience
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Waikiki last week and the only problem I had was Brian, the manger. Very poor service.

title: Excellent Customer Service!!!!!
comment: This hotel is conveniently located to everything you would want or need in Baltimore. But it also has excellent customer service, which is something that we have really grown to appreciate. Stay here, and you will be happy!

title: Worth the Gym
comment: Great view and nice pool for the gym. Terrific gym, and much better than the usual basement hotel gym!!!

title: Perfect Birthday Weekend
comment: The hotel was beautiful, centrally located and well maintained. The staff was excellent and made my daughter's birthday weekend fun and memorable. From now on, I will only stay at the Belvoir New York Hotel when in NYC.

title: BPG RECOGNITION
comment: I DIIDN'T RECIVE A LATE CHECKOUT I ASKED FOR AND THE RESPONSE WAS "ONLY IF YOU PAY"

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff and great location to downtown.
title: Belvoir Downtown Nashville - <<GREAT>>
comment: My wife and I stayed at the Belvoir Downtown on Saturday thru Tuesday. We were extremely pleased with the Belvoir and the close proximately (walking distance) to everything downtown. The real Nashville experience, the music, the original Grand Ole Opry, the Hall of Fame, music & museum, the bars and the historical atmosphere, all happens on Broadway and the surrounding streets. For most other things, you need a car or taxi. We ate at the Bistro on the second floor, once for a delightful lunch sandwich and again for a scrumptious breakfast. We thoroughly enjoyed the view - I had requested a high floor. The size of the room was great and provided all the space and comfort one could wish for. We had one minor bathroom issue, which was fixed immediately, once we notified the staff actually spoke to a very nice gentleman, an electrical or maintenance supervisor, I believe, on the elevator. Parking in and out was easy and was included in the package I paid for. . Go Orioles and Ravens.

title: This hotel has a good location and nice features
comment: This hotel is convenient to museums and parkway with good bed and expected hotel features. The street level appearance is not nice from the city side where people approach walking from center city because they expect all customers to arrive from driveway.

title: comfort
comment: great place with all you need

everyoneShouldKnow: Awesome hotel in the middle of the BEST location at Disney World.
title: Magical stay
comment: The Dolphin is an elegant resort located within walking distance to The Boardwalk and a short boat ride to Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios. From my room, I could see the fireworks in the sky from Epcot each night and the boats gliding by as they transported guests.

everyoneShouldKnow: Several bldgs, mist not on beachfront
title: enjoyed stsy
comment: Hotel is in good location, staff helpful & friendly. Beach pool and beach very nice. View indirect not right on beach. Overall would recommend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer service is a lost art here. Emphasis on lost.
title: Absolutely horrible service here - stay away.
comment: I reserved a Superior (high floor) King bed hotel room. And the hotel staff here seemed bound and determined to make sure I didn't get what I paid for. One mistake is acceptable, but a string of mistakes by multiple people shows you just how poor the service at this hotel is.

title: thanks for a nice stay!
comment: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean and very confortable beds.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not rent a car through the in house Hertz office. Their main office is only a mile away and cheaper.
title: Be forewarned.
comment: I was staying for 5 days and opted to use the Green Choice relating to not needing a linen change for the first 2 days. I followed the in room instructions on the tag by placing it on the door knob in the evening. The second night I removed the tag and upon returning to my room late on the 3rd day, I found that my room had not been serviced because my initial choice had not been removed from their computer. I had to have night maintenance bring us supplies and we made our beds.

title: Every single Employee treated us wonderfully!
comment: Our wedding party received top notch service!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, amazing guest service & useful amenities.
title: Excellent Service
comment: Staff was very friendly & service oriented. Everyone was knowledgeable about the area & gave great recommendations for dining & getting around. Shuttle service to Pentagon City Metro made commuting to DC very convenient. Reasonably priced covered parking was a plus too. Room was clean & comfortable w/ plenty of room to spread out. The view was FANTASTIC! Overlooked DC, with clear views of Washington Monument, Lincoln & Jefferson Memorials and the Kennedy Center, as well as Arlington Cemetery and the Pentagon. Highly recommend!

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure they give you the Green Voucher as there were several nights I didn't receive on during the nightly checks that were performed.
title: Great location, always a great experience when there
comment: My experience with Belvoir - Raleigh has always been a very pleasant experience. Although I live in San Francisco, CA I'm almost always there in the RDU-RTP at least every six weeks for at least 5-7 days! And each time I check in the friendly staff great and treat me as if I were a family member coming home!

title: Terriffic experience
comment: This hotel has it all, great people and a great property. Absolute wonderful time.

title: wonderful hotel
comment: very clean hotel... warm friendly greeting at front desk when we arrived Sat. night .. very nice and accomadating over phone for a last minute rm. reservation... would stay again... we didnt use the pool or spa so i cannot comment on them

everyoneShouldKnow: It's near Disney and has a shuttle every 1/2 hour
title: The hotel was beautiful and the room was clean. We loved the shuttle to Disney
comment: The hotel registration was excellent and timely. The room neat and clean. We enjoyed our stay. The only thing that needs improvement is the evening shuttle bus driver. He was busy watching his tips rather than helping passengers and working for his tips. The day driver helped people in and out and also loaded the strollers for us. The night guy needs to be retrained by the day guy

everyoneShouldKnow: Great ocean views and beach... good location.
title: This Hotel has a great location
comment: In addition to a fantastic view, this hotel is located at the end of a cove complete with a cliff for addition views. The hotel is located next to many other restaurants and activities.

title: Friendly Staff/Nice renovation
comment: I stayed here recently, and have to say that Belvoir did a really nice job with the recent renovation. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The only negative that I can say, is that the air conditioners in the rooms could be updated and the sliding glass doors to the room balconies, REALLY need to be replaced. The gym is not bad, and the lobby restaurant/bar, has good food at a fairly reasonable price.

everyoneShouldKnow: the sinks drain really slow. The staff don't know what to do during a fire drill. False alarm or not.
title: fire drill
comment: Don't expect the staff to know how to manage a fire drill.

title: Nice hotel, great staff
comment: The hotel is nice and exceptional staff. Unfortunately, the room service meal i had was horrible: Wilted, over-dressed salad that tasted dirty and an overcooked hamburger with no mayo, ketchup, mustard included. The ocean views are not worth paying for unless you're above the 5th floor - otherwise you're just looking at a bunch of apartment buildings.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice pools, close to everything, great view from ocean front room
title: Great staff
comment: Roger our housekeeper was excellent

title: Very Accomodating
comment: The only complaint we have is that the bus service to the parks was extremely slow. The water taxis were GREAT! and accomodated to Epcot and and Hollywood Studios and the Boardwalk very efficiently. However after one bus trip to the Magic Kingdom and having to wait for over 50 minutes for a bus to return us to the hotel we decided to drive ourselves the next few days to the Magic Kingdom and to Animal Kingdom. The poor bus service may not be the hotels fault but this should be addressed . Otherwise the hotel was wonderful: clean, friendly and accomodating with late open food spots. I repeat, the water taxi was wonderful!

everyoneShouldKnow: As BPG said for Platinum benefits
title: It is very good for BPG Platinum
comment: You will have the Platinum benefits by hotel depended besides instant:

title: All Round Excellence
comment: From being greeted by the Valets though to check in, bar & restaurant, the staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful. This coupled with the bright and clean reception area, excellent and stylish pool & bar area and clean functional rooms makes this a must stay when next in the area.

title: This hotel has great fuatures
comment: This hotel has great fuatures

title: Series of poor events
comment: Little disappointed with the material condition of this room, especially with the way you promote the multi-million dollar renovation. When I arrived in noticed the window sheers were tattered from someone's pet clawing at them, so I notified the desk. My toilet made a trickling noise because the shutoff valve didn't work properly for the whole first night, also notified the desk. Got a towel to dry off on the first morning that had an baseball sized hole in it. Lastly, I was supposed to get some kind of continental breakfast and the only thing out was coffee a half hour after it was supposed to be open.

title: Great location!
comment: Great location. Friendly staff. Nice Executive lounge.

title: Bad Experience
comment: Location is great, but that's about all this hotel has going for it.

everyoneShouldKnow: How spread-out the layout of the rooms are
title: This hotel is too spread out.
comment: Our room was as far from the main lobby as possible and behind us was the trash bins, which smelled. All in all, the room location was very inconvenient. Also, it would be nice if there was outdoor dining and longer hours for Lava's outside bar & grill.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very nice, just watch out for breakfast. The staff was not trained well, and they did not have enough help.
title: nice hotel but breakfast needed help
comment: Your hotel was great except for the breakfast service. Staff had a struggle on Saturday morning. You need to be sure you have enough staff to serve breakfast, and PLEASE train them to offer coffee as soon as you sit down. We had to wait a long time to get seated, and your staff was struggling in several areas. Please staff adequately and train them how to wait on people who are grouchy and hungry and are paying a lot of money for their meal. The girl at the omelet station told me to come back because she was three behind. So, please get yoiur staff up to speed and get enough staff in there to wait on people appropriately. When I pay $33.00 for two breakfasts, I should have anything I want!!! I will be glad to give you more pointers. Thank you for your attention. It is not fair to your staff and especially to my pocketbook.

title: Convenient and Relaxing
comment: Right on the airport property and no obtrusive noise to be heard. Hotel appeared new and up to date and well kept.

title: Great stay in Chicago
comment: Had a great stay at the Towers this past week, staff was very attentive.

title: Bathroom Lights
comment: Hard to see in the bathroom.

title: Room Service
comment: My only suggestion would be to change the in room dining menu. I've been staying at the hotel for years and the menu hasn't changed. It's time to be creative and change the menu.

title: pan
comment: No one ever came to make up my bed or clean the bathroom or check whether I needed fresh towels (I didn't). There was a huge black stain on the rug that clearly no one had tried to remove or clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are very well trained, polite and courteous
title: Very Comfortable and Friendly Hotel
comment: My husband and I flew from England to spend our 40th wedding anniversary in Boston, what a wonderful hotel with truly friendly staff. We would like to mention Amy, who is an absolute credit to The Belvoir Hotel. We booked some sighseeing tours with her, and she was very knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble, when we mentioned that it was our anniversary she arranged for us to be upgraded to a suite, it was very special. She even left a message for her colleague to contact us in our room to check it was okay. Terrific customer service!

title: Excellent meeting arrangements, great rooms, food, pool
comment: We were really impressed and we will be back. Thanks to Amanda and all.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is close enough to the parks, yet just far enough to settle down excited kids for eating and sleeping.
title: Since 1990s
comment: I have been staying here since the early 1990s; then with my parents and sister. Eventually my husband & 2 kids would stay here on our trips to the DLR and now just hubby & me. We call it "home" when we are in the parks and tired; "Let's go relax at home, then come back later." I have gotten my brother & sis-in-law to join and they stay now and just love it. The buffet breakfast at the Garden Court is so affordable and the food tasty and filling. The quiet atmosphere makes it relaxing before or after a busy day in the parks. The bedding is so comfortable. We have purchased the exact pillows online to get that great night sleep we always get at the Belvoir Anaheim.

everyoneShouldKnow: If the room temperature is not comfortable when you first arrive, ask for another room immediately.
title: Room Temperature Was Not Comfortable
comment: The room was not a comfortable temperature. We reported the issue to the front desk after the first night, but no improvement in comfort resulted.

title: matilda
comment: This hotel is centrally located and has gret service

everyoneShouldKnow: Get to the pool early to get a chaise!
title: Infinity Pool and more!
comment: We enjoyed our time floating in the infinity pool- the best view and place to relax at the hotel.

title: New Orleans CPA SEminar
comment: Your place was inadequate from the beginning. I needed a refrig and had to request three times. The 2nd night no parking and was told when there was parking we would get a call. No call. The carpet in the room was filthy. The price was ridiculous. I requested decaf packs for the coffee maker plus various other items, toilet tissue, etc. Partially received. Each day brought a new disappointment. The front desk seemed unsure about some

title: Great customer service!
comment: All the staff went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. Belvoir will be our first choice for future travel.

title: Stay at Belvoir Garden Grove
comment: Very comfortable, modern, and clean room. I was disappointed to be placed next to the elevator as a Gold BPG member. Many families stay at the hotel, so there was both elevator and children noises. I'm sure rooms away from the elevator are very quiet. The staff was also confused on the internet service. I was told I would be refunded the daily charge and was not. Other than the room placement and internet confusion, it is a very comfortable hotel for business people and families.

title: Voice/Data access limited!
comment: T-mobile and AT&T users will be very frustrated with this hotel. I had almost no mobile signal for the duration of my visit, & resorted to standing near exits to make phone calls, etc. I spoke to others who were booked at the hotel during the week i was there (conference), and it seems if you use Verizon, you are fine, but if you have anything else, you are one your own. To make matters more aggravating, this is one of those hotels that charges $15/night for mid-grade internet connectivity, and that is per device!

title: Room was loud, bad customer service
comment: During my stay, I woke up super early in the morning because of the construction outside my window. I tried to take a photo of the view (the ocean), but the construction was in the way. Not very relaxing.

title: Staff
comment: They did a great job with their evens services

title: mr
comment: great location and great staff

title: Great Visit
comment: The hotel was very clean, and room was above my expectations. I was able to sleep through the night on a very comfortable bed.

title: This hotel is very nice and gives easy access to all of downtown Portsmouth.
comment: The room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was personable and answered any questions we had. We had a wonderful stay.

title: comfortable beds
comment: I enjoyed all aspects of this hotel

title: Service
comment: Luis M was our waiter for breakfast on Saturday.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great value for price paid. Room furnishings are current and up to date.
title: Great hotel for the value!
comment: Very nice hotel. Staff is helpful and smiling. I most appreciate the smiles when I come back to the hotel from a full day of work.

title: Very good hotel!
comment: Comfortable rooms and friendly staff. The hotel has a private beach but the guests are charged to use the umbrela.

title: Great hotel
comment: My family and I loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly. It's surrounded by great restaurants and stores. I would definitely come to this hotel in the future. The gym, indoor pool, lounge...etc everything was just great!

title: Hotel did not meet our expecations
comment: We held our wedding reception here. Our reception was not what we excepted. Hotel was not fully staffed to accommodate 440 guests.

title: This hotel was one of the worst Belvoir hotel I ever stayed.
comment: There is an unpleasant odor due to proximity of a garbage dump. The club lounge on the 7th floor was very minimum. The workout facility was very inadequate. The front desk staff was not very helpful or flexible.

title: Very Dissapponted
comment: My wife and I stayed here on 9/21/[YEAR-0] for our 10 year anniversary and were heading out on a cruise the next day. We got there early, about 1:30pm and was told the room was not ready yet. We were told that it would be ready before 3:00pm. No problem, we needed to eat lunch anyway. We were also told that we were upgraded to a beach room and that our window looked out at the water. Well, 3:00 came and our room was still not ready. 3:15, and we started to complain and another lady came up to the desk and completed the process and gave us our room. We get up to the room and the view from the window was that of the hotel next door, not of the beach. We called and spoke to the manager and she had an attitude and acted as if she could care less. Apparently, none of those rooms have a view of the ocean. Either way, the manage was not helpful or polite at all. I will never stay at a Sharaton again.

title: Almost missed the flight
comment: The reason I chose this hotel because it was close to LAX and I can avoid traffic. However, I was really disappointed with the check out process. The front desk staff was very helpful while the bell man and the valet took over half an hour to get my luggues and my car. Luckily, my flight was delayed otherwise I would surely miss the flight.
